CaptainCasa Demos - Documentation

This documentation contains all demos that are part of the CaptainCasa demo workplace.

The demos show how to implement dialogs using the CaptainCasa Enterprise Client framework.

A dialog is implemented by defining a layout (layout definition) as XML using a set of tags that is provided by the CaptainCasa framework. And it consists ouf of a Java class that reflectes the server side processing of this dialog.

Grids & Trees

Grids and Trees

Simple Grid

Managing grids is simple:

On layout side a grid is represented by the FIXGRID component. The FIXGRID component owns a number of columns, each one represented by a GRIDCOL component. Within the GRIDCOL component you can reference one (this means: exactly ONE) "normal" component, such as FIELD, LABEL, ICON, BUTTON and all others.

On server program side the grid binds to a FIXGRIDListBinding object. This object provides a method "getItems()" that passes back a normal collection. Each row in the grid is represented by one object inside the collection.

The collection objects need to provide the properties that are requested by each row's columns. The expression for binding these properties is ".{propertyName}".

Have a look into the Java code and compare it with the layout definition: you will see that there is a simple matching of properties within the inner class, representing one item.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGrid}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGrid.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Search &amp; Export..." />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoGrid.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Grid columns..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" avoidroundtrips="true" clientname="personGrid" height="100%;100" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGrid.grid}" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" cellselection="true" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" searchenabled="true" sortreference=".{firstName}" text="First Name" tooltip="This is the first name." width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_11" clientname="firstName" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" searchenabled="true" sortreference=".{lastName}" text="Last Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_15" clientname="lastName" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Birthday" width="1%;100" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_17" clientname="birthday" format="date" value=".{birthday}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" sortreference=".{married}" text="Mar." tooltip="Married" width="1%;30" >
<t:checkbox id="g_19" align="center" clientname="married" selected=".{married}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_20" tooltip="Remove columns" width="1%;65" >
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener=".{onRemove}" clientname="remove" contentareafilled="false" text="Remove" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_22" tooltip="Grid item detail" width="1%;25" >
<t:icon id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoGrid.grid.rowDataUI.onOpenRowDataPopup}" clientname="details" image="/images/icons/application_form_magnify.png" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoGrid.onAddRow}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add row" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_26" actionListener="#{d.DemoGrid.onClear}" text="Remove all rows" width="100+" />
<t:coldistance id="g_27" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_28" actionListener="#{d.DemoGrid.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Configure Grid..." width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

    package workplace;

import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGrid 
    extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        boolean i_married;
        Date i_birthday;
        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
        public void setFirstName(String value) { i_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { i_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setMarried(boolean value) { i_married = value; }
        public boolean getMarried() { return i_married; }
        public Date getBirthday() { return i_birthday; }
        public void setBirthday(Date birthday) { i_birthday = birthday; }
        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
        public void onRemove(ActionEvent ae)
        {
            YESNOPopup.createInstance
            (
                "Removing item",
                "Do you really want to remove the selected item?",
                new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
                {
                    public void reactOnYes()
                    {
                        removeExecute();
                    }
                    public void reactOnNo()
                    {
                    }
                }
            );
        }
        private void removeExecute()
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Item was executed: " + getLastName() + "/" + m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection() + "/" + m_grid.getShiftPressedOfLastSelection() + "/" + m_grid.getCtrlPressedOfLastSelection());
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    boolean m_oddeven = false;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // create some dummy items
        for (int i=0; i<1; i++)
        {
            GridItem row;
            row = new GridItem();
            row.setFirstName("Michael");
            row.setLastName("Schumacher");
            row.setMarried(true);
            row.setBirthday(new Date());
            m_grid.getItems().add(row);
            row = new GridItem();
            row.setFirstName("Alain");
            row.setLastName("Prost");
            row.setMarried(true);
            row.setBirthday(new Date());
            m_grid.getItems().add(row);
            row = new GridItem();
            row.setFirstName("Niki");
            row.setLastName("Lauda");
            row.setMarried(true);
            m_grid.getItems().add(row);
            row = new GridItem();
            row.setFirstName("Nik");
            row.setLastName("Heidfeld");
            row.setMarried(false);
            m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        }
        // optional: setting the title for PDF export
        m_grid.getExporter().getPDFExporter().setGridTitle("Demo Grid");
        // optional: setting download file name 
        m_grid.getExporter().setExportFilePrefix("demoGridExport");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void setOddeven(boolean value) { m_oddeven = value; }
    public boolean getOddeven() { return m_oddeven; }
    
    public void onAddRow(ActionEvent ae)    
    {
        // add the item
        GridItem item = new GridItem();
        item.setFirstName("new");
        item.setLastName("new");
        m_grid.getItems().add(item);
        // select the item and focus the item
        m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
        m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(item);
    }
    
    public void onClear(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Grid of Bean Objects

This demo shows that beans (e.g. coming from the logical layer) can directly be used within grid items. The "." notation of expression is used to navigate into the bean's properties.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithBeans}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridWithBeans.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Grid..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithBeans.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_7" width="25" >
<t:icon id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridWithBeans.grid.rowDataUI.onOpenRowDataPopup}" image="/images/icons/application_form_magnify.png" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Id" width="80" >
<t:field id="g_10" text=".{dep.id}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Name" width="80" >
<t:field id="g_12" text=".{dep.name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_14" text=".{dep.location}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="Budget" width="80" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_16" align="right" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" value=".{dep.budget}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.LogicFacade.Department;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridWithBeans}")

public class DemoGridWithBeans
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Department i_dep;
        public GridItem(Department dep)
        {
            super();
            i_dep = dep;
        }
        public Department getDep() 
        { 
            return i_dep; 
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridWithBeans(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        List<Department> deps = LogicFacade.getDepartments();
        for (Department dep: deps)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(dep));
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
   
}

Coloring grid lines

You now can directly define the background of one row by using the FIXGRID attirbutes ROWBACKGROUND and ROWBGPAINT.

You can define:
1. a fix value ("#F0F0F0")
2. a "normal" expression addressing the page bean ("#{...}")
3. an item expression addressing the item (".{...}")

Of course you can still define some own background color for the individual cell components.

Internally the corresponding value is applied to each individual cell of the row and is added to the background color settings of the cell component.
This means: if e.g. the field brings in some own background (by default: white), then the additional background is drawn on top.

Consequence: you typically define some background color with transparency, so that the cell component's background can still be visible.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.captaincasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowbgpaint}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowbgpaint}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_8" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowbgpaint.grid}" rowbackground=".{rowBackground}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Some name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Some street" width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_12" text=".{street}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="Some town" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_15" background="#00008010" text=".{town}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridRowbgpaint}")

public class DemoGridRowbgpaint
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_name;
        String i_street;
        String i_town;
        String i_rowBackground;
        public String getStreet() { return i_street; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { this.i_street = value; }
        public String getTown() { return i_town; }
        public void setTown(String value) { this.i_town = value; }
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { this.i_name = value; }
        public String getRowBackground() { return i_rowBackground; }
        public void setRowBackground(String rowBackground) { i_rowBackground = rowBackground; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridRowbgpaint(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setName("Name " + i);
            gi.setStreet("Street " + i);
            gi.setTown("Town " + i);
            // set bgpaint for some of the columns
            if (i%5 == 0)
                gi.setRowBackground("#a8d08d40");
            if (i%7 == 0)
                gi.setRowBackground("#8eaadb40");
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridrowbgpaint.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridRowbgpaint}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grid with Details

Select one item from the article list, either by double clicking or by navigating with the keyboard and pressing Enter. Result: the details of the item will be shown below the grid.

In the implementation of the example you see:

(.) By overriding the onRowExecute() method you can add server side coding, which is executed when the user double-clicks a row. (There is a corresponding onRowSelect() method which is executed when the user double clicks the grid, as well.)

(.) Inside the grid column fields, and inside the detail fields the business object (Article, Stock) coming from the logic layer is simply referenced. There is no repetition of properties within the grid row objects.

(.) The detail area is only rendered when a selected article is available. This is defined within the layout definition of the corresponding row holding the detail area.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDetail}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Select one of the following items by double-click." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" avoidroundtrips="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDetail.articleRows}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_7" sortreference=".{article.id}" text="Article Id" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_8" bgpaint=".{bgpaintForRow}" text=".{article.id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" sortreference=".{article.text}" text="Article Text" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_10" bgpaint=".{bgpaintForRow}" text=".{article.text}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" sortreference=".{article.uom}" text="Unit of Measure" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_12" bgpaint=".{bgpaintForRow}" text=".{article.uom}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Stock Area" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_14" bgpaint=".{bgpaintForRow}" text=".{article.stockArea}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="Supplier" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_16" bgpaint=".{bgpaintForRow}" text=".{article.supplier}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_17" text="Value" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_18" bgpaint=".{bgpaintForRow}" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" text=".{article.value}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="Currency" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_20" bgpaint=".{bgpaintForRow}" text=".{article.currency}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_22" rendered="#{d.DemoGridDetail.selArticleRow != null}" >
<t:pane id="g_23" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:field id="g_26" labeltext="Id" text="#{d.DemoGridDetail.selArticleRow.article.id}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:field id="g_29" labeltext="Description" text="#{d.DemoGridDetail.selArticleRow.article.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:field id="g_32" labeltext="Unit" text="#{d.DemoGridDetail.selArticleRow.article.uom}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:field id="g_35" labeltext="Supplier" text="#{d.DemoGridDetail.selArticleRow.article.supplier}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:field id="g_38" labeltext="Stock area" text="#{d.DemoGridDetail.selArticleRow.article.stockArea}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_39" width="10" />
<t:fixgrid id="g_40" avoidroundtrips="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDetail.stockRows}" sbvisibleamount="20" width="50%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_41" text="Location" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_42" text=".{stock.location}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_43" align="right" text="Quantity" width="100" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_44" align="right" enabled="false" format="float" value=".{stock.quantity}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDetail}")

public class DemoGridDetail
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // BUSINESS LOGIC 
    // (in inner classes, so that it is kept with the UI class - please
    //  do not follow this example!)

    static Random s_random = new Random();
    
    public static class Stock
    {
        String i_location;
        float i_quantity;
        public void setLocation(String value) { i_location = value; }
        public String getLocation() { return i_location; }
        public void setQuantity(float value) { i_quantity = value; }
        public float getQuantity() { return i_quantity; }
    }
    
    static String[] CURRENCIES = new String[] { "�","$" };
    static String[] VALUES = new String[] { "47","555", "100", "88" };
    public static class Article
    {
        public static List<Article> readArticles()
        {
            List<Article> result = new ArrayList<Article>();
            for (int i=0; i<1000; i++)
            {
                Article a = new Article();
                a.setId(s_random.nextInt(200000)+"");
                a.setText("Text for article " + a.getId());
                a.setSupplier(s_random.nextInt(200000)+"");
                if (i%2 == 0)
                {
                    a.setUom("pc");
                    a.setStockArea("Front");
                }
                else
                {
                    a.setUom("kg");
                    a.setStockArea("Back");
                }
                a.setValue(new BigDecimal(VALUES[i%VALUES.length]));
                a.setCurrency(CURRENCIES[i%CURRENCIES.length]);
                result.add(a);
            }
            return result;
        }
        String i_id;
        String i_text;
        String i_uom;
        String i_supplier;
        String i_stockArea;
        BigDecimal i_value;
        String i_currency;
        public void setId(String value) { i_id = value; }
        public String getId() { return i_id; }
        public void setText(String value) { i_text = value; }
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public void setUom(String value) { i_uom = value; }
        public String getUom() { return i_uom; }
        public void setSupplier(String value) { i_supplier = value; }
        public String getSupplier() { return i_supplier; }
        public void setStockArea(String value) { i_stockArea = value; }
        public String getStockArea() { return i_stockArea; }
        public BigDecimal getValue() { return i_value; }
        public void setValue(BigDecimal value) { i_value = value; }
        public String getCurrency() { return i_currency; }
        public void setCurrency(String currency) { i_currency = currency; }
        public List<Stock> getStock()
        {
            List<Stock> result = new ArrayList<Stock>();
            int maxi = s_random.nextInt(25);
            for (int i=0; i<maxi; i++)
            {
                Stock s = new Stock();
                s.setLocation("Loc-"+s_random.nextInt(500));
                s.setQuantity(s_random.nextInt(1000));
                result.add(s);
            }
            return result;
        }
    }
    
    // INTERACTION LOGIC 
    
    public class ArticleRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Article i_article;
        public ArticleRow(Article article)
        {
            i_article = article;
        }
        public Article getArticle()
        {
            return i_article;
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            selectArticleRow(this);
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public String getBgpaintForRow()
        {
            if (this == m_selArticleRow)
                return "bgbackground(#FFC000C0)";
            else
                return null;
        }
    }

    public class StockRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Stock i_stock;
        public StockRow(Stock stock)
        {
            i_stock = stock;
        }
        public Stock getStock()
        {
            return i_stock;
        }
    }
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<ArticleRow> m_articleRows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<ArticleRow>(true);
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<StockRow> m_stockRows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<StockRow>(true);
    protected ArticleRow m_selArticleRow;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridDetail(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // fill article grid
        List<Article> as = Article.readArticles();
        for (Article a: as) 
            m_articleRows.getItems().add(new ArticleRow(a));
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<ArticleRow> getArticleRows() { return m_articleRows; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<StockRow> getStockRows() { return m_stockRows; }
    public ArticleRow getSelArticleRow() { return m_selArticleRow; }
    
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void selectArticleRow(ArticleRow ar)
    {
        if (m_selArticleRow != null) m_selArticleRow.getChangeIndex().indicateChange();
        m_selArticleRow = ar;
        m_selArticleRow.getChangeIndex().indicateChange();
        // fill stock grid
        m_stockRows.getItems().clear();
        for (Stock s: ar.getArticle().getStock()) 
            m_stockRows.getItems().add(new StockRow(s));
    }
    
    

}

Header and Footer

A grid typically has one header row - the one containing the grid columns' titles. But: you can add any number of additional header and footer rows.

In the example there is one header row that allows the user to search through the data: type some search term into the search fields and wait a bit: a server side search will be automatically triggered. Background: the search fields contain two attributes: FLUSH and FLUSHTIMER - after 1000ms of non-activity the changed data will be flushed to the server.

And there is a header row to show the totals of the last column.

Header and footer rows can be switched on/off by just using the normal RENDERED attribute provided by each component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter}" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.rows.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns..." />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.rows.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Grid..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.rows}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridheader id="g_8" avoidexport="true" rendered="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.headerRendered}" rowheight="30" >
<t:label id="g_9" align="right" background="#C0C0C0" text="Search " />
<t:field id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.onSearch}" background="#b4c6e7" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.searchFirstName}" />
<t:field id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.onSearch}" background="#b4c6e7" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.searchLastName}" />
<t:label id="g_12" background="#C0C0C0" />
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" width="80" >
<t:coldistance id="g_14" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_16" text=".{bo.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_17" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_18" text=".{bo.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_19" align="right" text="Fee" width="50" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_20" align="right" enabled="false" format="int" value=".{bo.fee}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridfooter id="g_21" rendered="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.footerRendered}" >
<t:label id="g_22" align="right" background="#C0C0C0" text="Total" />
<t:label id="g_23" align="right" background="#C0C0C0" />
<t:label id="g_24" align="right" background="#C0C0C0" />
<t:label id="g_25" align="right" background="#C0C0C0" font="weight:bold" text="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.totalFee}" />
</t:gridfooter>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="Rendering" width="100" />
<t:checkbox id="g_29" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.headerRendered}" text="Header" />
<t:checkbox id="g_30" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter.footerRendered}" text="Footer" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridHeaderFooter}")

public class DemoGridHeaderFooter
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class BO implements Serializable
    {
        public BO(String firstName, String lastName, int fee)
        {
            m_firstName = firstName;
            m_lastName = lastName;
            m_fee = fee;
        }
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        int m_fee;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { m_firstName = firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { m_lastName = lastName; }
        public int getFee() { return m_fee; }
        public void setFee(int fee) { m_fee = fee; }
    }
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected BO m_bo;
        public MyRow(BO bo)
        {
            m_bo = bo;
        }
        public BO getBo() { return m_bo; }

    }

    protected int m_totalFee;
    protected String m_searchLastName = "";
    protected String m_searchFirstName = "";
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    protected BO[] BOS = new BO[]
    {
        new BO("Adrian","Miller",50),        
        new BO("Harald","Smith",30),        
        new BO("Johnny","Carpenter",40),        
        new BO("Claudia","Pecunia",30),        
        new BO("Caroline","Mocca",40),        
        new BO("Thomas","Thomassi",30),        
        new BO("Gary","Cooper",40),        
        new BO("Joseph","Conqueror",30),        
        new BO("Michael","Johnson",40),        
        new BO("Robin","Vista",30),        
        new BO("Jane","Carter",40),        
        new BO("Hillary","Bush",30),        
        new BO("Mats","Wilander",40),        
        new BO("Niki","Lauderdale",30),        
    };
    protected boolean m_headerRendered = true;
    protected boolean m_footerRendered = true;

    public DemoGridHeaderFooter(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        fillList();
    }
    
    public boolean getFooterRendered() { return m_footerRendered; }
    public void setFooterRendered(boolean value) { m_footerRendered = value; }
    
    public boolean getHeaderRendered() { return m_headerRendered; }
    public void setHeaderRendered(boolean value) { m_headerRendered = value; }

    public int getTotalFee() { return m_totalFee; }
    public void setTotalFee(int value) { m_totalFee = value; }

    public String getSearchLastName() { return m_searchLastName; }
    public void setSearchLastName(String value) { m_searchLastName = value; }

    public String getSearchFirstName() { return m_searchFirstName; }
    public void setSearchFirstName(String value) { m_searchFirstName = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    public void setRows(FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> value) { m_rows = value; }

    public void onSearch(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        fillList();
    }
    
    private void fillList()
    {
        m_rows.getItems().clear();
        m_totalFee = 0;
        for (BO bo: BOS) 
        {
            if (bo.getFirstName().toLowerCase().startsWith(m_searchFirstName.toLowerCase()) && 
                bo.getLastName().toLowerCase().startsWith(m_searchLastName.toLowerCase()) )
            {
                m_rows.getItems().add(new MyRow(bo));
                m_totalFee += bo.getFee();
            }
        }
    }
}

Hide empty rows

Add new rows by pressing the "Add" button - up to the row count of 10 they will be added to the grid, then the grid starts scrolling.

You can control this behaviour using the attribute SHOWEMPTYROWS. By default empty rows are occupying space - but you can switch off with setting SHOWEMPTYROWS to "false". Pay attention: this attribute is only relevant when NOT specifying any height with the component!

Please also pay attention: the grid automatically adds vertical space for dynamically rendering a horizontal scrollbar if required. In the example this was switched off by setting HORIZONTALSCROLLMODE to "autowithresize".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridShowEmptyRows}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistancebig@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_2" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default: no content shown if empty" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="autowithresize" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridShowEmptyRows.grid}" sbvisibleamount="10" selectorcolumn="1" showemptyrows="false" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridShowEmptyRows.onAddItem}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add Item" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Explicitly show some empty content" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_18" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="autowithresize" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridShowEmptyRows.grid2}" sbvisibleamount="10" selectorcolumn="1" showemptyrows="false" showemptyrowsminvisibleamount="2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="First Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_20" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_21" text="Last Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_22" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridShowEmptyRows.onAddItem2}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add Item" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridShowEmptyRows}")

public class DemoGridShowEmptyRows
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        
        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    }
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid2 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    public DemoGridShowEmptyRows(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid2() { return m_grid2; }
    
    public void onAddItem(ActionEvent event)
    {
        GridItem gi = new GridItem();
        gi.setFirstName("<new>");
        gi.setLastName("<new>");
        m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
    }

    public void onAddItem2(ActionEvent event)
    {
        GridItem gi = new GridItem();
        gi.setFirstName("<new>");
        gi.setLastName("<new>");
        m_grid2.getItems().add(gi);
    }

}

Flexible row heights

For header and footer

The grid can be configured so that the header and footer rows may define a row height on their owns. To do so, use the following attributes:

(.) FIXGRID-HEADLINEROWHEIGHT: this is the row height that is assigned to the headline, containing the column titles.

(.) GRIDHEADER-ROWHEIGHT and GRIDFOOTER-ROWHEIGHT: this is the row height of the corresponding header/footer row.

If not explicitly defined then the FIXGRID-ROWHEIGHT definition is automatically applied.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowHeight}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#00000020" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" headlinerowheight="50" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowHeight.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridheader id="g_4" rowheight="40" >
<t:label id="g_5" background="#0000FF20" text="First Name - second headline" />
<t:label id="g_6" background="#0000FF20" text="Last Name - second headline" />
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_8" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_10" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridfooter id="g_11" rowheight="40" >
<t:label id="g_12" background="#0000FF20" text="First Name - footer line" />
<t:label id="g_13" background="#0000FF20" text="Last Name - footer line" />
</t:gridfooter>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridRowHeight}")

public class DemoGridRowHeight
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    public DemoGridRowHeight(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            gi.setLastName("LN " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public void setGrid(FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> value) { m_grid = value; }
    
}

For content rows - by server definition

This example shows a grid containing items with individual row heights. The height is defeind by the server side program by explicitly setting the height per item.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithIndividualRowHeight}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithIndividualRowHeight}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" autoexecute="true" border="#00000010" bordercolor="#00000010" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithIndividualRowHeight.grid}" suppressheadline="false" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" text="Last name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_6" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Comment" width="200" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_10" padding="2" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:textpane id="g_12" text=".{comment}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridWithIndividualRowHeight}")

public class DemoGridWithIndividualRowHeight
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_comment;
        String i_firstName;
        String i_name;
        public String getComment() { return i_comment; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Execute on: " + i_name);
        }
        @Override
        public int getRowHeight()
        {
            if (i_comment != null)
                return 60;
            else
                return super.getRowHeight();
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridWithIndividualRowHeight(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            gi.i_name = "Last " + i;
            gi.i_firstName = "First " + i;
            if (i%5 == 2)
            {
                gi.i_comment = "This is a comment which may occcupy some more pixels to show up.";
            }
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridwithindividualrowheight.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridWithIndividualRowHeight}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Row heights by content

The height of the lines in this grid are automatically driven by the content of their cell components.

The parameters to set are:

1. FIXGRID-DYNAMICHEIGHTSIZING to be set to "true"
2. FIXGRID-ROWHEIGHT is the minimum row height that is used of any row

When using: please check performance! In a "normal" gird the height of its cells is not calculated but is driven by the FIXGRID-ROWHEIGHT definition. Now the grid sizing needs to analyze the dimens of its cells with every activity in the grid (e.g. scrolling).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" bordercolor="#00000010" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" dynamicheightsizing="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing.grid}" selectorcolumn="2" selectorcolumnwidth="50" width="100%" withfixcolumnsbyuserconfiguration="true" >
<t:gridfooter id="g_18" rendered="false" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Footer left" />
<t:label id="g_20" text="Footer right" />
</t:gridfooter>
<t:gridcol id="g_5" font="size:16" text="Some text" width="100%" >
<t:textpane id="g_6" text=".{text}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" font="size:16" text="Some items" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_8" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:pane id="g_10" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:repeat id="g_11" listbinding=".{list}" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{text}" />
<t:icon id="g_14" actionListener=".{onRemoveAction}" image="/images.iconssvg.delete_16x16.#606060.10x10.ccsvg" />
</t:row>
</t:repeat>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
<t:icon id="g_16" actionListener=".{onAddItemAction}" enabled=".{availableAddItem}" image="/images/iconssvg/add_12x12.svg" rowalignmenty="top" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import workplace.DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing.ListItem;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing}")

public class DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class ListItem extends Object implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        GridItem i_gridItem;
        public ListItem(GridItem gridItem)
        {
            i_gridItem = gridItem;
        }
        public void onRemoveAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
        {   
            i_gridItem.i_list.remove(this);
        }
        String i_text;
        public String getText() { return i_text; } 
        public void setText(String text) { i_text = text; } 
    }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_text;
        List<ListItem> i_list = new ArrayList<ListItem>();
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public void setText(String value) { this.i_text = value; }
        public List<ListItem> getList() { return i_list; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
        public void onAddItemAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
        {
            ListItem li = new ListItem(this);
            li.setText("New item");
            i_list.add(li);
        }
        public boolean getAvailableAddItem() 
        { 
            return i_list.size() < 5; 
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            if (i%5 == 0)
                gi.setText("A\nB\nC");
            else if (i%6 == 3)
                gi.setText("This is some longer text that may be broken into several lines. This is some longer text that may be broken into several lines. This is some longer text that may be broken into several lines. This is some longer text that may be broken into several lines. ");
            else
                gi.setText("A B C");
            int maxj = 1;
            if (i%7 == 2)
                maxj = 3;
            for (int j=0; j<maxj; j++)
            {
                ListItem li = new ListItem(gi);
                li.setText("List item " + j);
                gi.getList().add(li);
            }
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogriddynamicheightsizing.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridDynamicHeightSizing}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Avoid row stretching

By default the grid (FIXGRID, ARRAYGRID, ...) processing always streteches its contained rows so that no row is cut within the grid.

This strategy is fine for "normal" grids - and ensures that the grid always is "properly filled" with rows. - For grids with dynamic row height sizing the strategy is not optimal, especially if rows might occupy some significant height.

By setting the attribute AVOIDROWSTRETCHING the grid rows are output with the height they require - the bottom content row which is shown in a grid may as consequence only be partially visible.

The grid management ensures that you always can scroll to the last row so that it becomes fully visible.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridNoRowStretching}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridNoRowStretching}" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_8" avoidrowstretching="true" dynamicheightsizing="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridNoRowStretching.grid}" sbvisibleamount="15" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" >
<t:gridfooter id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccemphasized" text="SOME FOOTER" />
</t:gridfooter>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Content" width="100%;100" >
<t:pane id="g_10" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_6" contentbinding=".{rowContent}" />
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.SCROLLPANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridNoRowStretching}")

public class DemoGridNoRowStretching
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding i_rowContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
        public GridItem()
        {
            render();
        }
        /**
         * Creates some random number of rows inside in order to create
         * content with different row height per row.
         */
        private void render()
        {
            int maxi = new Random().nextInt(10) + 1;
            SCROLLPANENode p = new SCROLLPANENode()
                .setPadding("10")
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setHeight("100%;;300")
                .setRowdistance(7);
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode()
                    .setColdistance(7);
                p.addSubNode(r);
                LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                    .setText(""+maxi + " persons:")
                    .setFont("weight:bold");
                r.addSubNode(l);
            }
            for (int i=0; i<maxi; i++)
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode()
                    .setColdistance(7);
                p.addSubNode(r);
                {
                    LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                        .setText(""+(i+1))
                        .setAlign("left")
                        .setWidth("30");
                    r.addSubNode(l);
                }
                {
                    LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                        .setText(RandomLogic.getLastName())
                        .setWidth("100%;150");
                    r.addSubNode(l);
                }
                {
                    LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                        .setText(RandomLogic.getFirstName())
                        .setWidth("100%;150");
                    r.addSubNode(l);
                }
            }
            i_rowContent.setContentNode(p);
        }
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getRowContent() { return i_rowContent; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridNoRowStretching(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);   
        fillGrid();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridnorowstretching.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridNoRowStretching}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem());
    }

}

Individual row heights in tree

Individual row height sizing can also be applied to trees, of course.

In the example the font of the tree nodes is individually set for each level. As consequence the height of the corresponding rows is different.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTreeDynRowHeight}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeDynRowHeight}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" border="#00000010" drawoddevenrows="false" dynamicheightsizing="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeDynRowHeight.tree}" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" text="Column" width="100%;200" >
<t:treenode id="g_6" font=".{font}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeDynRowHeight}")

public class DemoTreeDynRowHeight
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_font;
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        public String getFont() { return i_font; }
        public void setFont(String value) { this.i_font = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
        public void onToggle()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTreeDynRowHeight(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        buildTree();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotreedynrowheight.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTreeDynRowHeight}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void buildTree()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("Top chapter" + i);
            top.setFont("size:24;weight:bold");
            if (i != 0)
                top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            else
                top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_OPENED);
            for (int j=0; j<4; j++)
            {
                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("Sub chapter " + i);
                sub.setFont("size:18");
                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
                if (j != 0)
                    sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
                else
                    sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_OPENED);
                for (int k=0; k<3; k++)
                {
                    TreeNode subsub = new TreeNode(sub);
                    subsub.setText("Detail chapter " + i);
                    subsub.setFont(null);
                    subsub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                }
            }
        }
    }

}

Flexible line as cell content

...and another example on flexible row height:

The grid is set to size its cells according to their required height (FIXGRID-DYNAMICHEIGHTSIZING set to "true").

The right cell contains a PANE itself containing a ROWFLEXLINE component, in which a flexible number of AVATARICONs is added.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellFlexLine}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellFlexLine}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" bordercolor="#00000010" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" dynamicheightsizing="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellFlexLine.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" text="Team" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_6" text=".{team}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="Team members" width="100%;100" >
<t:pane id="g_8" >
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_9" >
<t:repeat id="g_10" listbinding=".{members}" >
<t:avataricon id="g_11" iconsize="48" image=".{image}" text=".{name}" />
</t:repeat>
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridCellFlexLine}")

public class DemoGridCellFlexLine
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MembersItem extends Object implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_name;
        String i_image;
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { this.i_name = value; }
        public String getImage() { return i_image; }
        public void setImage(String value) { this.i_image = value; }

    }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_team;
        List<MembersItem> i_members = new ArrayList<MembersItem>();
        public String getTeam() { return i_team; }
        public void setTeam(String value) { this.i_team = value; }
        public List<MembersItem> getMembers() { return i_members; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridCellFlexLine(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        refreshList();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridcellflexline.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridCellFlexLine}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void refreshList()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setTeam("Team " + i);
            int maxj = new Random().nextInt(40);
            for (int j=0; j<maxj; j++)
            {
                MembersItem mi = new MembersItem();
                mi.setName("M"+j);
                int imageIndex = j % 3;
                mi.setImage("/images/pictures/avatar"+imageIndex+".jpg");
                gi.getMembers().add(mi);
            }
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }
}

Dynamic height-sizing of headline

There are two functions used in this grid.

1. The GRDICOL instances are set to multi line text - by setting attribute MULTILINE to "true".

2. The FIXGRID's attribute DYNAMICHEADLINEROWHEIGHTSIZING is set to "true". As consequence the size of the headline is calculated by its content.

The items of the grid are not affected by the dynamic height-calculation of the headline row. They still are sized according to the ROWHEIGHT that is defined in the FIXGRID (with a default being defined in the style definition).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynHeadlineSizing}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynHeadlineSizing}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textpane id="g_6" text="Resize the column widhts and observe how the text inside the headline adapts." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_2" dynamicheadlinerowheightsizing="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynHeadlineSizing.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_3" multiline="true" text="First name of the person" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_7" text=".{person.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" multiline="true" text="Last name of the person" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{person.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" multiline="true" text="Height of the person in cm" width="80" >
<t:label id="g_12" format="int" text=".{person.height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" multiline="true" text="Some title of the person" width="80" >
<t:label id="g_15" text=".{person.title}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDynHeadlineSizing}")

public class DemoGridDynHeadlineSizing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Person i_person = new Person();
        public GridItem(Person person)
        { 
            i_person = person; 
        }
        public Person getPerson() { return i_person; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridDynHeadlineSizing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(RandomLogic.createPerson()));
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogriddynheadlinesizing.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridDynHeadlineSizing}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Dynamic height-sizing of headline - for grouped columns
Dynamic height sizing with images

This demo shows how the IMAGE component behaves when being used in a grid with dynamic height sizing (FIXGRID-DYNAMICHEIGHTSIZING set to "true").

Change the column width of the image-column and observe how the image size adapts - and as result the row height adapts as well.

In general the IMAGE component always tries to fit into its given space - by default keeping the image ratio. The height of the image cell is limited by the pixel height of the image (or the IMAGEWIDTH/HEIGHT that you explicitly assign).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynHeightSizingImage}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynHeightSizingImage}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:textpane id="g_7" text="Change the column width of the &#34;Image&#34; column and check how the image sizing adapts." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_14" avoidrowstretching="true" dynamicheightsizing="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynHeightSizingImage.grid}" selectorcolumn="2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" align="center" text="Image" width="100" >
<t:image id="g_9" image=".{image}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Image path" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{image}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDynHeightSizingImage}")

public class DemoGridDynHeightSizingImage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_image;
        public String getImage() { return i_image; }
        public void setImage(String value) { this.i_image = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public static String[] s_images = new String[]
    {
        "/images.iconssvg.cancel.#606060.16x16.ccsvg",
        "/images.iconssvg.cancel.#606060.32x32.ccsvg",
        "/images.iconssvg.cancel.#606060.48x48.ccsvg",
        "/images.iconssvg.cancel.#606060.64x64.ccsvg",
        "/images/pictures/avatar0.jpg",
        "/images/pictures/ph0.jpg",
        "/images/pictures/photo1.gif",
    };
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridDynHeightSizingImage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            int imageIndex =i % s_images.length;
            gi.setImage(s_images[imageIndex]);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogriddynheightsizingimage.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridDynHeightSizingImage}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Column Sequence and Widths

Column sizing by content

By default columns are sized independent from their content by specifying the WIDTH attribute on GRIDCOL level. You either can assign pixel value ("100"), or a percentage value ("50%"), or a mixture out of both ("100%;200" == 100% but 200 pixels as minimum).

By setting the attribute GRIDCOL-DYNAMICWIDTHSIZING the calculation of the width of the column is done according to the width of its contained content. You still can define a WIDTH, which is now interpreted as the minimum width that is guaranteed in any case.

Please be aware about the fact, that the client only knows "some" of the items that are available on server side. The automatic calculation of width is based on these items. Consequence: when scrolling the grid then the width of a column may change.

Please make sure that when switching GRIDCOL-DYNAMICWIDTHSIZING to "true", that the cell component within the GRIDCOL definition does not contain a width definition on its own.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynamicColSizing}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynamicColSizing.grid}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" dynamicwidthsizing="true" text="Text 1" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{text1}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" dynamicwidthsizing="true" text="Text 2" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_7" text=".{text2}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" dynamicwidthsizing="true" text="Text 3" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{text3}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" dynamicwidthsizing="true" text="Text 4" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{text4}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridDynamicColSizing.onUpdateContentAction}" text="Update content" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:
