package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDynamicColSizing}")

public class DemoGridDynamicColSizing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String i_text1;
        protected String i_text2;
        protected String i_text3;
        protected String i_text4;
        public String getText1() { return i_text1; }
        public String getText2() { return i_text2; }
        public String getText3() { return i_text3; }
        public String getText4() { return i_text4; }
    }

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    public DemoGridDynamicColSizing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
        updateGridLines(1f);
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void onUpdateContentAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        float factor = 0.25f + new Random().nextFloat() * 2;
        updateGridLines(factor);
    }

    private void updateGridLines(float factor)
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = m_grid.getItems().get(i);
            gi.i_text1 = buildString(i / 2,factor);
            gi.i_text2 = buildString((100-i)/4,factor);
            gi.i_text3 = buildString(i/3,factor);
            gi.i_text4 = buildString((100-i)/3,factor);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }
    
    private String buildString(int length, float factor)
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        int maxi = (int)Math.round(factor * (double)length);
        for (int i=0; i<maxi; i++)
            sb.append("A");
        return sb.toString();
    }
}

Column width info & update

This demo shows how to retrieve and update information about the width of the grid columns at runtime.

A grid starts with being sized corresponding to the definition within the layout (XML definition). But the user may change the width of columns, or may change the sequene of columns.

You get notified by corresponding methods, that you may override within the grid processing. And you may override the layout definition's width definition at runtime by corresponding methods.

Please also check the Java-API documentation for the class FIXGRIDBinding.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="First" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="first" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Second" width="110" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{second}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Third" width="120" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{third}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Fourth" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{fourth}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_17" text="Initiate roundtrip" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="10s" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Original column widths" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_21" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.grid.originalcolumnwidths}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_22" height="10s" />
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="The following infos are only populated after some roundtrip:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" text="Modified column widths" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_27" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.grid.modcolumnwidths}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="Modified column order" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_30" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.grid.columnsequence}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_31" height="10s" />
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:coldistance id="g_33" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_34" text="Index" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_35" width="5" />
<t:label id="g_36" text="New width" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="Update column width" width="150" />
<t:spinner id="g_39" maxvalue="3" minvalue="0" placeholder="0..3" value="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.columnIndexForUpdate}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_40" width="5" />
<t:field id="g_41" placeholder="e.g. 200, 100%, ..." text="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.widthForUpdate}" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_42" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_43" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.onUpdateWidthAction}" text="Update" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_44" height="10s" />
<t:rowline id="g_45" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_46" height="10s" />
<t:row id="g_47" >
<t:label id="g_48" text="Protocol" width="150" />
<t:scrollpane id="g_49" border="#00000030" height="100%" width="100%;100" >
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:textpane id="g_51" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing}")

public class DemoGridColumnSizing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_fourth;
        public String getFourth() { return m_fourth; }
        public void setFourth(String value) { this.m_fourth = value; }

        String m_third;
        public String getThird() { return m_third; }
        public void setThird(String value) { this.m_third = value; }

        String m_second;
        public String getSecond() { return m_second; }
        public void setSecond(String value) { this.m_second = value; }

        String m_first;
        public String getFirst() { return m_first; }
        public void setFirst(String value) { this.m_first = value; }

    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>()
    {
        @Override
        protected void onColumnSequenceUpdated()
        {
            protocol("Column sequence update: " + getColumnsequence());
        }
        @Override
        protected void onColumnWidthsUpdated()
        {
            protocol("Column sequence update: " + getModcolumnwidths());
        }
    };
    String m_widthForUpdate;
    int m_columnIndexForUpdate;
    String m_protocol = "";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridColumnSizing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirst("First " + i);
            gi.setSecond("Second " + i);
            gi.setThird("Third " + i);
            gi.setFourth("Fourth " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridcolumnsizing.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridColumnSizing}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public String getWidthForUpdate() { return m_widthForUpdate; }
    public void setWidthForUpdate(String value) { this.m_widthForUpdate = value; }

    public int getColumnIndexForUpdate() { return m_columnIndexForUpdate; }
    public void setColumnIndexForUpdate(int value) { this.m_columnIndexForUpdate = value; }

    public void onUpdateWidthAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            if (m_widthForUpdate == null || m_widthForUpdate.trim().length() == 0)
                throw new Exception("Please define a propert width.");
            m_grid.setModcolumnwidth(m_columnIndexForUpdate,m_widthForUpdate);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }
    
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void protocol(String s)
    {
        String t = (SimpleDateFormat.getDateTimeInstance()).format(new Date());
        m_protocol = t + ": " + s + "\n" + m_protocol;
    }
    
}

Column sequence / width

A grid contains columns that can be arranged by the user.

The user can re-size columns by picking the shadowed area on the right and dragging/dropping the columns size.

The user can re-arrange columns by dragging and dropping the whole title area of the column onto another one.

Please note: the information about sizes and sequences that might be changed by the user is available on server side as well. You may for example store a user's column sizing and column sequence in some kind of user profile.

Every time a request is sent from the client to the server size, sequence updates are made available within the server side FIXGRIDBinding object. - On the other hand you can set these values from your logic.

Sizes and sequence definitions are semicolon separated strings, each value representing the sequence / size of the corresponding column.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCols}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" avoidroundtrips="true" background="#FFFFFF" bordercolor="#D0D0D0" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" drawoddevenrows="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCols.rows}" persistid="rows" sbvisibleamount="15" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Town" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_9" text=".{street}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Street" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_11" text=".{town}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridCols.onAddRow}" text="Add Item" />
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridCols.rows.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Configure grid..." />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridCols.onResetAction}" text="Reset column infos" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:button id="g_21" text="Synch data to Server" width="140+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:field id="g_25" background="#F0F0F0" enabled="false" labeltext="Column Sequence" text="#{d.DemoGridCols.rows.columnsequence}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:field id="g_29" background="#F0F0F0" enabled="false" labeltext="Column Widths" text="#{d.DemoGridCols.rows.modcolumnwidths}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:field id="g_33" background="#F0F0F0" enabled="false" labeltext="Visible Items" text="#{d.DemoGridCols.rows.clientvisibleamount}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_34" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:field id="g_37" labeltext="New Column Sequence" text="#{d.DemoGridCols.newSequence}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:field id="g_41" labeltext="New Column Widths" text="#{d.DemoGridCols.newWidths}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:button id="g_45" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridCols.onSynchToClient}" text="Synch data to Client" width="140+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridCols extends PageBean
{
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        String m_town;
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setTown(String value) { m_town = value; }
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
    }
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    String m_newSequence;
    String m_newWidths;
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void setNewWidths(String value) { m_newWidths = value; }
    public String getNewWidths() { return m_newWidths; }
    public void setNewSequence(String value) { m_newSequence = value; }
    public String getNewSequence() { return m_newSequence; }
    
    public DemoGridCols(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            MyRow mr = new MyRow();
            mr.setFirstName("FN/"+i);
            mr.setLastName("LN/"+i);
            mr.setStreet("S/"+i);
            mr.setTown("T/"+i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(mr);
        }
   }
    
    public void onAddRow(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        MyRow mr = new MyRow();
        m_rows.getItems().add(mr);
    }
    
    public void onResetAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_rows.resetPersistentData();
    }
    
    public void onSynchToServer(ActionEvent ae)
    {
    }
    
    public void onSynchToClient(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (m_newWidths != null && m_newWidths.length() != 0)
            m_rows.setModcolumnwidths(m_newWidths);
        else
            m_rows.setModcolumnwidths(null);
        if (m_newSequence != null && m_newSequence.length() != 0)
            m_rows.setColumnsequence(m_newSequence);
        else
            m_rows.setColumnsequence(null);
    }
    
}

Only show full columns

Change the size horizontal size of this grid by e.g. changing the browser window size or by changing the size of the workpage container.

You will see: the grid will always only show full columns. If there is no sufficient screen space then some columns will be (optically) removed. This is due to defining attributr FIXGRID-ONLYSHOWFULLCOLUMNS to "true".

On GRIDCOL level you define the priority of columns using attribute GRIDCOL-ONLYSHOWFULLCOLUMNSPRIO. In the demo you see that the priorities are not reflecting the lef-to-right order of the columns: the lowest priority is assigned to the "zipCode" column, then the "street" column, etc.

Typical use case of this feature: if using a grid in mobile scenarios then you do not wnat the user to scroll horizontally - but better come up with a selection of appropriate columns.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridFullColumns}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFullColumns}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFullColumns.grid}" onlyshowfullcolumns="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" onlyshowfullcolumnsprio="2" text="First name (2)" width="100%;120" >
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" onlyshowfullcolumnsprio="1" text="Last name (1)" width="100%;120" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" onlyshowfullcolumnsprio="4" text="Street (4)" width="100%;120" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{street}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" onlyshowfullcolumnsprio="5" text="Zip code (5)" width="100%;120" >
<t:label id="g_15" text=".{zipCode}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" onlyshowfullcolumnsprio="3" text="Town (3)" width="100%;120" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{town}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridFullColumns}")

public class DemoGridFullColumns
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_town;
        String i_zipCode;
        String i_street;
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getTown() { return i_town; }
        public void setTown(String value) { this.i_town = value; }
        public String getZipCode() { return i_zipCode; }
        public void setZipCode(String value) { this.i_zipCode = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return i_street; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { this.i_street = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridFullColumns(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            gi.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            gi.setStreet("Street " + i);
            gi.setZipCode(""+(10000+i));
            gi.setTown("Town " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridfullcolumns.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridFullColumns}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grouping column headers

Grouped columns

The component FIXGRDIDWITHGROUPING is a "just normal" grid, but provides the possibility to define a grouping on header level.

Take a look at the drag&drop that is provided on column level: you only can drag/drop columns within one group - so that the grouping never can be destroyed.

The definition is done by using component GRIDICOLGROUP. When defining, pay attention to correctly define the grouping: the arrangement of groups must be 100% balanced. This means: all GRIDCOL nodes need to exactly be positioned on the same hierarchy level. It is not possible to have a grouping level of "1 level" in the one part of the grid, and a grouping level of "2 levels" in other parts.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping}" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns..." />
<t:link id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:fixgridwithgrouping id="g_8" bordercolor="#00000010" bordercolorsperlevel="#00000050;#00000030" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" borderwidthsperlevel="1;1" columndragdropenabled="false" drawoddevenrows="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping.grid}" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" >
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_9" align="center" text="All 1" >
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_10" align="center" text="Left group" >
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Test1" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{test1}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Test2" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{test2}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:gridcolgroup>
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_15" align="center" text="Middle Group" >
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Test3" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{test3}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Test4" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_19" text=".{test4}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_20" text="Test5" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_21" text=".{test5}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:gridcolgroup>
</t:gridcolgroup>
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_22" align="center" text="All 2" >
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_23" align="center" text="Right group" >
<t:gridcol id="g_24" text="Test6" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_25" text=".{test6}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_26" text="Test7" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_27" text=".{test7}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_29" sortreference=".{test8}" text="Test8" width="100%;100" >
<t:checkbox id="g_30" selected=".{test8}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:gridcolgroup>
</t:gridcolgroup>
</t:fixgridwithgrouping>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping}")

public class DemoGridWithGrouping
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_test1;
        String i_test2;
        String i_test3;
        String i_test4;
        String i_test5;
        String i_test6;
        String i_test7;
        boolean i_test8;
        public String getTest7() { return i_test7; }
        public void setTest7(String value) { this.i_test7 = value; }
        public String getTest6() { return i_test6; }
        public void setTest6(String value) { this.i_test6 = value; }
        public String getTest5() { return i_test5; }
        public void setTest5(String value) { this.i_test5 = value; }
        public String getTest4() { return i_test4; }
        public void setTest4(String value) { this.i_test4 = value; }
        public String getTest3() { return i_test3; }
        public void setTest3(String value) { this.i_test3 = value; }
        public String getTest2() { return i_test2; }
        public void setTest2(String value) { this.i_test2 = value; }
        public String getTest1() { return i_test1; }
        public void setTest1(String value) { this.i_test1 = value; }
        public boolean getTest8() { return i_test8; }
        public void setTest8(boolean value) { this.i_test8 = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridWithGrouping(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setTest1("Test1 " + i);
            gi.setTest2("Test2 " + i);
            gi.setTest3("Test3 " + i);
            gi.setTest4("Test4 " + i);
            gi.setTest5("Test5 " + i);
            gi.setTest6("Test6 " + i);
            gi.setTest7("Test7 " + i);
            gi.setTest8(i%2 == 0);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridwithgrouping.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grouped columns - "rendered" with columns

Click the check boxes and the corresponding columns will be rendered - or not rendered.

This demo shows that the grid column grouping can also used together with the normal "rendered" management of columns.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered}" >
<t:row id="g_32" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:checkbox id="g_33" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test1}" text="Test1" />
<t:checkbox id="g_37" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test2}" text="Test2" />
<t:checkbox id="g_38" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test3}" text="Test3" />
<t:checkbox id="g_40" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test4}" text="Test4" />
<t:checkbox id="g_41" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test5}" text="Test5" />
<t:checkbox id="g_42" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test6}" text="Test6" />
<t:checkbox id="g_43" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test7}" text="Test7" />
<t:checkbox id="g_44" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test8}" text="Test8" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_35" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns..." />
<t:link id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:fixgridwithgrouping id="g_8" bordercolor="#00000010" bordercolorsperlevel="#00000050;#00000030" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" borderwidthsperlevel="1;1" columndragdropenabled="false" drawoddevenrows="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.grid}" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" >
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_9" align="center" text="All 1" >
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_10" align="center" text="Left group" >
<t:gridcol id="g_11" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test1}" text="Test1" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{test1}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test2}" text="Test2" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{test2}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:gridcolgroup>
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_15" align="center" text="Middle Group" >
<t:gridcol id="g_16" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test3}" text="Test3" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{test3}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test4}" text="Test4" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_19" text=".{test4}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_20" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test5}" text="Test5" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_21" text=".{test5}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:gridcolgroup>
</t:gridcolgroup>
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_22" align="center" text="All 2" >
<t:gridcolgroup id="g_23" align="center" text="Right group" >
<t:gridcol id="g_24" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test6}" text="Test6" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_25" text=".{test6}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_26" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test7}" text="Test7" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_27" text=".{test7}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_29" rendered="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered.renderedInfo.test8}" sortreference=".{test8}" text="Test8" width="100%;100" >
<t:checkbox id="g_30" selected=".{test8}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:gridcolgroup>
</t:gridcolgroup>
</t:fixgridwithgrouping>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridWithGroupingRendered}")

public class DemoGridWithGroupingRendered
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_test1;
        String i_test2;
        String i_test3;
        String i_test4;
        String i_test5;
        String i_test6;
        String i_test7;
        boolean i_test8;
        public String getTest7() { return i_test7; }
        public void setTest7(String value) { this.i_test7 = value; }
        public String getTest6() { return i_test6; }
        public void setTest6(String value) { this.i_test6 = value; }
        public String getTest5() { return i_test5; }
        public void setTest5(String value) { this.i_test5 = value; }
        public String getTest4() { return i_test4; }
        public void setTest4(String value) { this.i_test4 = value; }
        public String getTest3() { return i_test3; }
        public void setTest3(String value) { this.i_test3 = value; }
        public String getTest2() { return i_test2; }
        public void setTest2(String value) { this.i_test2 = value; }
        public String getTest1() { return i_test1; }
        public void setTest1(String value) { this.i_test1 = value; }
        public boolean getTest8() { return i_test8; }
        public void setTest8(boolean value) { this.i_test8 = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    Map<String,Boolean> m_renderedInfo = new HashMap<String,Boolean>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridWithGroupingRendered(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        switchAllColumnsToRendered(true);
        loadData();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridwithgrouping.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridWithGrouping}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public Map<String, Boolean> getRenderedInfo() { return m_renderedInfo; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void switchAllColumnsToRendered(boolean b)
    {
        for (int i=1;i<=8;i++)
        {
//            m_renderedInfo.put("test"+i,true);
            if (i%2 == 0)
                m_renderedInfo.put("test"+i,true);
            else
                m_renderedInfo.put("test"+i,false);
        }
    }

    private void loadData()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setTest1("Test1 " + i);
            gi.setTest2("Test2 " + i);
            gi.setTest3("Test3 " + i);
            gi.setTest4("Test4 " + i);
            gi.setTest5("Test5 " + i);
            gi.setTest6("Test6 " + i);
            gi.setTest7("Test7 " + i);
            gi.setTest8(i%2 == 0);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

}

Header colspan definition

In order to build trees with structured headers there are two features to pay attention to:

1. in the components within the GRIDHEADER (same with GRIDFOOTER) you may define a COLSPAN.

2. in the GRIDHEADER there is a new attribute BEFOREDEFAULTHEADER which arranges the corresponding header line correspondingly.

The COLSPAN management only correctly works if the grid column sequence is not modifiable by the user: set FIXGRID-COLUMNDRAGDROPENABLED to "false" as consequence.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridHeaderSpan}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridHeaderSpan}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderSpan.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#00000010" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" columndragdropenabled="false" headlinerowheight="35" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridHeaderSpan.grid}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridheader id="g_8" beforedefaultheader="true" >
<t:label id="g_9" background="#CACACA" font="weight:bold" />
<t:label id="g_10" align="center" background="#CACACA" colspan="6" font="weight:bold" text="Private data" />
<t:label id="g_11" align="center" background="#CACACA" colspan="2" font="weight:bold" text="Company" />
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridheader id="g_12" beforedefaultheader="true" >
<t:label id="g_13" background="#CACACA" font="weight:bold" />
<t:label id="g_14" align="center" background="#CACACA" colspan="3" font="weight:bold" text="Name" />
<t:label id="g_15" align="center" background="#CACACA" colspan="3" font="weight:bold" text="Address" />
<t:label id="g_16" align="center" background="#CACACA" colspan="2" font="weight:bold" text="Registration" />
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridcol id="g_17" text="Comment" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_18" text=".{comment}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="Title" width="50" >
<t:label id="g_20" text=".{title}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_21" text="First name" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_22" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" text="Last name" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_24" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_25" text="Street" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_26" text=".{street}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_27" text="Zip code" width="70" >
<t:label id="g_28" text=".{zipCode}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_29" text="Town" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_30" text=".{town}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_31" text="Pers Id" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_32" text=".{persNummer}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_33" text="Cost center" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_34" text=".{kostenstelle}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridHeaderSpan}")

public class DemoGridHeaderSpan
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_comment;
        public String getComment() { return i_comment; }
        public void setComment(String value) { this.i_comment = value; }

        String i_kostenstelle;
        public String getKostenstelle() { return i_kostenstelle; }
        public void setKostenstelle(String value) { this.i_kostenstelle = value; }

        String i_persNummer;
        public String getPersNummer() { return i_persNummer; }
        public void setPersNummer(String value) { this.i_persNummer = value; }

        String i_town;
        public String getTown() { return i_town; }
        public void setTown(String value) { this.i_town = value; }

        String i_street;
        public String getStreet() { return i_street; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { this.i_street = value; }

        String i_zipCode;
        public String getZipCode() { return i_zipCode; }
        public void setZipCode(String value) { this.i_zipCode = value; }

        String i_title;
        public String getTitle() { return i_title; }
        public void setTitle(String value) { this.i_title = value; }

        String i_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }

        String i_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }

        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridHeaderSpan(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
          GridItem gi = new GridItem();
          if (i%2 == 0)
              gi.setTitle("Dr.");
          gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
          gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
          gi.setZipCode(""+(i+88888));
          gi.setStreet("Street " + i);
          gi.setTown("Town " + i);
          gi.setPersNummer("DE03"+i);
          gi.setKostenstelle("4711");
          gi.setComment("Comment " + i);
          m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridheaderspan.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridHeaderSpan}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grid Header Cell

Title Label with Icons

You can define additional components to be placed into the column header.

The way to do so, is:

(.) the first component within a GRIDCOL component is the cell-component
(.) all the rest of the components are components that are added into the title header

Please note: even though the title-components (the 2nd, 3rd, ... ones) are arranged below a GRIDCOL component, they are not part of the grid item! They are controls that are NOT "multiplied out" into the cells, but they are controls that are rendered one time within the title area.
As result you must not use any relative expressions (".{...}") for these components - because they do not refer to the item. You need to use absolute expressions ("#{...}").

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" headlinerowheight="40" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.grid}" sbvisibleamount="25" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_6" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:icon id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.onHeaderIconPressed}" image="/images/icons/add.png" reference="add_firstName" rendered="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.iconAddRendered}" />
<t:icon id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.onHeaderIconPressed}" image="/images/icons/accept.png" reference="ok_firstName" rendered="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.iconAcceptRendered}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_11" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
<t:icon id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.onHeaderIconPressed}" image="/images/icons/add.png" reference="add_lastName" rendered="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.iconAddRendered}" />
<t:icon id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.onHeaderIconPressed}" image="/images/icons/accept.png" reference="ok_lastName" rendered="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.iconAcceptRendered}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:checkbox id="g_15" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.iconAddRendered}" text="Add Icon Rendered" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:checkbox id="g_17" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel.iconAcceptRendered}" text="Accept Icons Rendered" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridHeaderLabel}")

public class DemoGridHeaderLabel
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    boolean m_iconAddRendered = true;
    boolean m_iconAcceptRendered = true;

    public DemoGridHeaderLabel(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            gi.setLastName("LN " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public boolean isIconAddRendered() { return m_iconAddRendered; }
    public void setIconAddRendered(boolean iconAddRendered) { m_iconAddRendered = iconAddRendered; }

    public boolean isIconAcceptRendered() { return m_iconAcceptRendered; }
    public void setIconAcceptRendered(boolean iconAcceptRendered) { m_iconAcceptRendered = iconAcceptRendered; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void onHeaderIconPressed(ActionEvent event)
    {
        BaseActionEvent bae = (BaseActionEvent)event;
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Header Icon was pressed: " + bae.getSourceReference());
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Header Icon was pressed: " + bae.getSourceReference());
    }
    
    
}

Complex Header Cell

By default the grid header cell holds a text - that's it.

But you can change to render an individual set of controls:

(.) The second control below the GRIDCOL component is rendered "right of" the normal text label. In the example both GRIDCOL definitions have a complex PANE definition as second control.

(.) The width of the default cell header text is "100%", as result the "second control" is rendered at the right end of the grid header cell. But: by using attribute GRIDCOL-TEXTWIDTH you can assign an individual width. In the example, this width was set to "0", so that the whole space on the right is made available for the PANE component.

(.) The height of the header line can be explicitly set by using attribute FIXGRID-HEADERROWHEIGHT.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAddHeaderControls}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" headlinerowheight="120" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAddHeaderControls.grid}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" background="#ccF0CC" textwidth="0" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_6" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="3" />
<t:label id="g_9" font="weight:bold;size:14" text="First Name" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:textarea id="g_11" background="#00000000" border="0" enabled="false" height="100%" text="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" background="#c0c0ff" textwidth="0" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_13" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_14" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="3" />
<t:label id="g_17" font="weight:bold;size:14" text="Last Name" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:textarea id="g_19" background="#00000000" border="0" enabled="false" height="100%" text="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridAddHeaderControls}")

public class DemoGridAddHeaderControls
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public void setGrid(FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> value) { this.m_grid = value; }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.m_lastName = value; }

        String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.m_firstName = value; }

    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridAddHeaderControls(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);      
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First Name " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last Name " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Abbreviated column header texts

The components LABEL and GRIDCOL provide an attribute TEXTABBREVIATION. If defined then this text will be used instead of the normal TEXT-definition, if the screen space is not sufficient.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoLabelAbbreviation}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabelAbbreviation}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text="LABEL component" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textpane id="g_6" text="With the second label an abbreviated text is defined. Move the split pane divider to the left: the second label will switch to this abbreviated text on missing screen space." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:splitpane id="g_8" border="#00000010" dividerlocation="50%" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_9" padding="10" >
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" background="#00000010" cutwidth="true" text="Label without abbreviation" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" background="#00000010" cutwidth="true" text="Label with abbreviation defined" textabbreviation="Lbl w abbr" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_14" />
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccbig" text="FIXGRID component" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_18" text="When resizing the columns then the texts will switch to their abbreviated version if the text width is greater than the column width." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_20" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabelAbbreviation.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_21" text="Article number" textabbreviation="#Art" width="20%" >
<t:label id="g_22" text=".{articleId}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" text="Description" textabbreviation="Descr" width="80%" >
<t:label id="g_24" text=".{desription}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLabelAbbreviation}")

public class DemoLabelAbbreviation
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_desription = new String();
        String i_articleId;
        public String getDesription() { return i_desription; }
        public String getArticleId() { return i_articleId; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoLabelAbbreviation(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.i_articleId = "47276"+i;
            gi.i_desription = "Description for article " + gi.i_articleId;
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demolabelabbreviation.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLabelAbbreviation}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Fix columns

Fix columns - basics

Scroll the grid from the left to the right - the first three columns will be fix.
Also observe the way the focus is moved through the grid when using the tab-key: the fix columns will not be scrolled.

You just have to call method FIXGRIDListVBinding.setNumbnerOfFixColumns(...) in order to define the corresponding behavior.

There is a background color that is automatically assigned to the fix columns. This background color can be changed by updating the style (style variable "@gridFixAreaBackground@", style class "riscflexgrid_fixarea").

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirect}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirect}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#00000010" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirect.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Id" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{person.id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="Last name" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_16" text=".{person.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="First name" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{person.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_30" text="Title" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_31" text=".{person.title}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Department" width="100%;200" >
<t:label id="g_19" text=".{person.department}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" text="Weight" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_24" text=".{person.weight}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_25" text="Height" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_26" text=".{person.height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_33" text="Birthday" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_34" format="date" text=".{person.birthDay}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_27" text="Comment" width="100%;300" >
<t:label id="g_28" text=".{person.comment}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_36" text="Weight" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_37" text=".{person.weight}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_38" text="Height" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_39" text=".{person.height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_40" text="Birthday" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_41" format="date" text=".{person.birthDay}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_42" text="Comment" width="100%;300" >
<t:label id="g_43" text=".{person.comment}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirect}")

public class DemoGridFixColumnsDirect
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Person i_person;
        public GridItem(Person person)
        {
            i_person = person;
        }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        public Person getPerson() { return i_person; } 
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridFixColumnsDirect(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillGrid();
        m_grid.setNumberOfFixColumns(3);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridfixcolumnsdirect.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirect}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(RandomLogic.createPerson()));
    }

}

Fix columns - dynamic setting

By calling API FIXGRIDBinding.setNumberOfFixColumns you can define the number of fix columns.

The number of fix columns can be changed at runtime: when moving the slider of the demo then the grid will react accordingly.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_45" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_2" text="Number of fix columns" >
<t:slider id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable.onFixColumnsAction}" flush="true" majortickspacing="1" maxvalue="3" minortickspacing="1" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable.fixColumns}" width="200" />
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#00000010" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Id" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{person.id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="Last name" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_16" text=".{person.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="First name" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{person.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_30" text="Title" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_31" text=".{person.title}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Department" width="100%;200" >
<t:label id="g_19" text=".{person.department}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" text="Weight" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_24" text=".{person.weight}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_25" text="Height" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_26" text=".{person.height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_33" text="Birthday" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_34" format="date" text=".{person.birthDay}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_27" text="Comment" width="100%;300" >
<t:label id="g_28" text=".{person.comment}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_36" text="Weight" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_37" text=".{person.weight}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_38" text="Height" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_39" text=".{person.height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_40" text="Birthday" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_41" format="date" text=".{person.birthDay}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_42" text="Comment" width="100%;300" >
<t:label id="g_43" text=".{person.comment}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable}")

public class DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Person i_person;
        public GridItem(Person person)
        {
            i_person = person;
        }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        public Person getPerson() { return i_person; } 
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_fixColumns = 2;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillGrid();
        m_grid.setNumberOfFixColumns(m_fixColumns);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridfixcolumnsdirectvariable.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectVariable}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public void onFixColumnsAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_grid.setNumberOfFixColumns(m_fixColumns);
    }

    public int getFixColumns() { return m_fixColumns; }
    public void setFixColumns(int value) { this.m_fixColumns = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(RandomLogic.createPerson()));
    }

}

Fix columns - by configuration

When setting attribute FIXGRID-WITHFIXCOLUMNSBYUSERCONFIGURATION to "true", then the dialog for configuring the selection and sequence of columns will also show a field in which you can define the number of fix columns.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_45" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#00000010" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig.grid}" persistid="DIRECTCONFIG" width="100%" withfixcolumnsbyuserconfiguration="true" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Id" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{person.id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="Last name" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_16" text=".{person.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="First name" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{person.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_30" text="Title" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_31" text=".{person.title}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Department" width="100%;200" >
<t:label id="g_19" text=".{person.department}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" text="Weight" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_24" text=".{person.weight}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_25" text="Height" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_26" text=".{person.height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_33" text="Birthday" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_34" format="date" text=".{person.birthDay}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_27" text="Comment" width="100%;300" >
<t:label id="g_28" text=".{person.comment}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_36" text="Weight" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_37" text=".{person.weight}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_38" text="Height" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_39" text=".{person.height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_40" text="Birthday" width="100%;150" >
<t:label id="g_41" format="date" text=".{person.birthDay}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_42" text="Comment" width="100%;300" >
<t:label id="g_43" text=".{person.comment}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig}")

public class DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Person i_person;
        public GridItem(Person person)
        {
            i_person = person;
        }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        public Person getPerson() { return i_person; } 
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillGrid();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridfixcolumnsdirectconfig.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridFixColumnsDirectConfig}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
 
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(RandomLogic.createPerson()));
    }
}

Double line grid

This demo shows how to build double line rows. Each cell itself is structured as PANE component internally holding two rows, each row holding one label.

In the same way you can also build triple (and more) lines within one grid row.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDoubleLine}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDoubleLine.rows}" rowheight="40" sbvisibleamount="15" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridheader id="g_4" >
<t:pane id="g_5" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:gridheaderlabel id="g_7" height="50%" sortreference=".{firstName}" text="First Name" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:gridheaderlabel id="g_10" height="50%" sortreference=".{lastName}" text="Last Name" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_11" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:gridheaderlabel id="g_13" height="50%" sortreference=".{street}" text="Street" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:gridheaderlabel id="g_16" height="50%" sortreference=".{city}" text="City" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:gridheaderlabel id="g_17" sortreference=".{country}" text="Country" />
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridheader id="g_18" rowheight="1" />
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="Name" width="50%" >
<t:pane id="g_20" background="#FFFFFF" focusable="true" >
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" height="50%" text=".{firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" height="50%" text=".{lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_26" text="Address" width="50%" >
<t:pane id="g_27" background="#FFFFFF" focusable="true" >
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" height="50%" text=".{street}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:label id="g_32" height="50%" text=".{city}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_33" text="Country" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_34" background="#FFFFFF" text=".{country}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDoubleLine}")

public class DemoGridDoubleLine
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_country;
        public String getCountry() { return m_country; }
        public void setCountry(String value) { m_country = value; }

        protected String m_city;
        public String getCity() { return m_city; }
        public void setCity(String value) { m_city = value; }

        protected String m_street;
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }

        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    public DemoGridDoubleLine(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setFirstName("First Name " + i);
            r.setLastName("Last Name " + i);
            r.setStreet("Street " + i);
            r.setCity("City " + i);
            r.setCountry("Country " + i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
    }
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    public void setRows(FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> value) { m_rows = value; }
    
    

}

Complex Columns

Grid Row Selector

Types

The component GRIDROWSELECTOR simplifies the selection of grid rows. Dependent on whether a grid row is selected or unselected, a corresponding icon will show up.

The component typically is placed at the very beginning of a grid.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelector}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelector.grid1}" sbvisibleamount="3" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" width="15" >
<t:gridrowselector id="g_5" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelector.grid2}" sbvisibleamount="3" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" width="25" >
<t:gridrowselector id="g_11" imagefalse="/images/icons/accept_light.png" imagetrue="/images/icons/accept.png" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_13" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_15" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelector.grid3}" sbvisibleamount="3" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_16" width="25" >
<t:gridrowselector id="g_17" imagefalse="/images/icons/checkbox_false.png" imagetrue="/images/icons/checkbox_true.png" />
</t:gridcol>
