<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_19" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_21" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelector.grid3}" sbvisibleamount="3" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_22" width="35" >
<t:gridrowselector id="g_23" showindex="true" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_24" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_25" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridSelector}")

public class DemoGridSelector
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_name;
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }

    }
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid1 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid2 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid3 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridSelector(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi1 = new GridItem();
            gi1.setName("Name " + i);
            m_grid1.getItems().add(gi1);
            GridItem gi2 = new GridItem();
            gi2.setName("Name " + i);
            m_grid2.getItems().add(gi2);
            GridItem gi3 = new GridItem();
            gi3.setName("Name " + i);
            m_grid3.getItems().add(gi3);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid1() { return m_grid1; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid2() { return m_grid2; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid3() { return m_grid3; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Title Cell Icon

When using the attribute FIXGRID-SELECTORCOLUMN, so that a selector column is drawn as first column, then you can in addition place an icon into the title cell.

You do so by defining the attribute FIXGRID-SELCTORCOLUMNTITLEIMAGE.

On server side the method "onSelectorTitleIconInvoked(...)" is called within the grid binding. You need to override e.g. the FIXGRIDListBinding class in order to add your own implementation.

In the example, the icon is rendered like a checkbox - so pay attention: the chekbox that you see on the top left is not a real checkbox, it is an icon - the image behind the icon is updated correspondingly.
When the user selects the icon, then in the example either all items are selected, or all items are de-selected.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectorTitleIcon}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectorTitleIcon.grid}" sbvisibleamount="25" selectonrowfocus="false" selectorcolumn="1" selectorcolumntitleimage="#{d.DemoGridSelectorTitleIcon.titleImage}" selectorcolumnwidth="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventGridSelectorTitleIcon;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridSelectorTitleIcon}")

public class DemoGridSelectorTitleIcon
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyGridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    }
    
    public class MyGrid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<MyGridItem>
    {
        @Override
        public void onSelectorTitleIconInvoked(BaseActionEventGridSelectorTitleIcon event)
        {
            int numberOfSelectedItems = m_grid.getSelectedItems().size();
            if (numberOfSelectedItems <= 1)
            {
                // select all...
                m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
                for (MyGridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
                    m_grid.selectItem(gi);
                m_titleImage = "/images/icons/checkbox_true.png";                
            }
            else
            {
                // select nothing
                m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
                m_titleImage = "/images/icons/checkbox_false.png";                
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    MyGrid m_grid = new MyGrid();
    String m_titleImage = "/images/icons/checkbox_false.png";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridSelectorTitleIcon(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            MyGridItem gi = new MyGridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            gi.setLastName("LN " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public MyGrid getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public String getTitleImage() { return m_titleImage; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    
}

Horizontal Scrolling

The horizontal scroll bar of the grid can be explicitly controlled by using the attribute HORIZONTALSCROLLMODE. You can test the behaviour of the grid for each mode within this demo by resizing the contained column.

There are four modes:

"hidden" - OK, there is obviously no horizontal scrollbar shown any time. The grid is cut, the user does not have any possibility to reach the content. This mode should be handled with care... ;-)

"auto" - This is the default mode. In order to avoid screen flickering and resizing the total height of the grid is calculated always as total of all row heights + a potential horizontal scrollbar at the bottom. If the grid does not require a horizontal scrollbar then its height is distributed equally to all other rows. You will see that there is a row height resizing when increasing the width of the corresponding column.

"autowithresize" - Now, with this mode the row height of the rows really represents the ROWHEIGHT definition of the grid. If a scrollbar is required then the total grid is resized, i.e. it notfies the whole page that it requires more vertical space, and as consequence triggers a resizing of the whole page. This mode does only make sense to be used if NOT explicitly specifying a height to the grid.

"always" - Well, now the horizontal scrollbar is always rendered.

As mentioned: the default is "auto", because it's the most performant way. You might typically use "autowithresize" when using grids without height definition and with only a few rows. "Few rows" also means, that you might use the attribute SHOWEMPTYROWS and set it to false.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollMode}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Scrollmode &#34;hidden&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="hidden" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollMode.grid1}" rowheight="20" sbvisibleamount="4" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_9" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:pane id="g_11" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="&#34;auto&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_15" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="auto" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollMode.grid2}" rowheight="20" sbvisibleamount="4" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_17" height="20" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_18" width="10" />
<t:pane id="g_19" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="&#34;autowithresize&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_23" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="autowithresize" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollMode.grid3}" rowheight="20" sbvisibleamount="4" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_24" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_25" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:pane id="g_27" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="Scrollmode &#34;always&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_31" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="always" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollMode.grid3}" rowheight="20" sbvisibleamount="4" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_32" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_33" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridScrollMode}")

public class DemoGridScrollMode
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_name;
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }
    }
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid1 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid2 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid3 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid4 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    public DemoGridScrollMode(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi;
            gi = new GridItem(); gi.setName("Name " + i); m_grid1.getItems().add(gi);
            gi = new GridItem(); gi.setName("Name " + i); m_grid2.getItems().add(gi);
            gi = new GridItem(); gi.setName("Name " + i); m_grid3.getItems().add(gi);
            gi = new GridItem(); gi.setName("Name " + i); m_grid4.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid1() { return m_grid1; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid2() { return m_grid2; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid3() { return m_grid3; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid4() { return m_grid3; }
}

Tree

Simple Tree

Trees are a special type of grids. Within the layout definition you see a FIXGRID component, that internally holds columns. The first column holds a TREENODE component, the next one a normal FORMATTEDFIELD.

On server side the counter part of the FIXGRID is an object of tpye FIXGRIDTREEBinding. This object holds a root node, under which you can arrange other nodes. In the example a class "MyRow" was subclassed from FIXGRIDTreeItem, holding additional information such as the number of inhabitants per item.

Each node has a status. This status tells if it is either opened or closed, or if the node is an end node. You can open/close nodes from program side by changing this status.

Within the implementation of an item you can react on diverse events from client side: onToggle, onSelect, onExecute (double click/ return selection).

In the example the tree is loaded within the constructor. Of course you can also load the tree step by step - every time the onToggle() is called, then you can read the sub-nodes and put them below the toggled item.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTree}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoTree.tree.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_15" avoidroundtrips="true" bordercolor="#D0D0D0" borderheight="0" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTree.tree}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Country / Town" width="100%;100" >
<t:treenode id="g_5" levelwidth="20" usesmartlabel="false" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" align="right" text="Inhabitants" width="100" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" align="right" format="int" value=".{inhabitants}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoTree.onOpenAllNodes}" text="Open all" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoTree.onCloseAllNodes}" text="Close all" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTree extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDTreeItem
    {
        int i_inhabitants;
        public MyRow(FIXGRIDTreeItem parent, String text, int inhabitants, boolean isEndNode)
        {
            super(parent);
            setText(text);
            i_inhabitants = inhabitants;
            if (isEndNode)
            {
                setStatus(STATUS_ENDNODE);
                setImage("/images/icons/accept.png");
            }
        }
        public void setInhabitants(int value) { i_inhabitants = value; }
        public int getInhabitants() { return i_inhabitants; }
        public void onToggle()
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("TOGGLE on " + getText());
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            if (getStatusInt() == STATUS_CLOSED) setStatus(STATUS_OPENED);
            else if (getStatusInt() == STATUS_OPENED) setStatus(STATUS_CLOSED);
        }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("SELECT on " + getText());
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyRow> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyRow>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoTree(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // fill the tree
        MyRow country;
        MyRow town;
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"Germany",80000000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Bammental",6800,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Berlin",3000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Munich",1000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Hamburg",1200000,true);
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"Liechtenstein",20000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Vaduz",20000,true);
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"United Kingdom",60000000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"London",6000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Manchester",500000,true);
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"United States",280000000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Los Angeles",5000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"New York",9000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"San Francisco",1000000,true);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyRow> getTree() { return m_tree; }
    
    public void onOpenAllNodes(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        setStatusInFolderNodes(m_tree.getRootNode(),FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_OPENED);
    }
    
    public void onCloseAllNodes(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        setStatusInFolderNodes(m_tree.getRootNode(),FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_CLOSED);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void setStatusInFolderNodes(FIXGRIDTreeItem node, int status)
    {
        List<FIXGRIDTreeItem> nodes = node.getChildNodes();
        for (int i=0; i<nodes.size(); i++)
        {
            FIXGRIDTreeItem childNode = nodes.get(i);
            if (childNode.getStatusInt() != childNode.STATUS_ENDNODE)
            {
                childNode.setStatus(status);
                setStatusInFolderNodes(childNode,status);
            }
        }
    }
    
}

Tree with checkbox

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoTreewithcb}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" avoidroundtrips="true" bordercolor="#D0D0D0" borderheight="0" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.demoTreewithcb.tree}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" dynamicwidthsizing="true" text="Country / Town" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_5" >
<t:checkbox id="g_6" selected=".{checked}" />
</t:treenode>
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="Inhabitants" width="100" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_8" align="right" format="int" value=".{inhabitants}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.demoTreewithcb.onOpenAllNodes}" text="Open all" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.demoTreewithcb.onCloseAllNodes}" text="Close all" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTreewithcb extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDTreeItem
    {
        int i_inhabitants;
        boolean i_checked;
        String i_checkText;
        public MyRow(FIXGRIDTreeItem parent, String text, int inhabitants, boolean isEndNode)
        {
            super(parent);
            setText(text);
            i_checkText = "CT " + text; 
            i_inhabitants = inhabitants;
            if (isEndNode)
                setStatus(STATUS_ENDNODE);
        }
        public void setInhabitants(int value) { i_inhabitants = value; }
        public int getInhabitants() { return i_inhabitants; }
        public void setChecked(boolean value) { i_checked = value; }
        public boolean getChecked() { return i_checked; }
        public void onToggle()
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("TOGGLE on " + getText());
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            if (getStatusInt() == STATUS_CLOSED) setStatus(STATUS_OPENED);
            else if (getStatusInt() == STATUS_OPENED) setStatus(STATUS_CLOSED);
        }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("SELECT on " + getText());
        }
        public String getCheckText() { return i_checkText; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyRow> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyRow>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoTreewithcb(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // fill the tree
        MyRow country;
        MyRow town;
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"Germany",80000000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Bammental",6800,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Berlin",3000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Munich",1000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Hamburg",1200000,true);
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"Liechtenstein",20000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Vaduz",20000,true);
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"United Kingdom",60000000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"London",6000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Manchester",500000,true);
        country = new MyRow(m_tree.getRootNode(),"United States",280000000,false);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"Los Angeles",5000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"New York",9000000,true);
        town    = new MyRow(country,"San Francisco",1000000,true);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyRow> getTree() { return m_tree; }
    
    public void onOpenAllNodes(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        setStatusInFolderNodes(m_tree.getRootNode(),FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_OPENED);
    }
    
    public void onCloseAllNodes(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        setStatusInFolderNodes(m_tree.getRootNode(),FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_CLOSED);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void setStatusInFolderNodes(FIXGRIDTreeItem node, int status)
    {
        List<FIXGRIDTreeItem> nodes = node.getChildNodes();
        for (int i=0; i<nodes.size(); i++)
        {
            FIXGRIDTreeItem childNode = nodes.get(i);
            if (childNode.getStatusInt() != childNode.STATUS_ENDNODE)
            {
                childNode.setStatus(status);
                setStatusInFolderNodes(childNode,status);
            }
        }
    }
    
}

Tree with smart text

By using attribute TREENODE-USESMARTLABEL you can also use smart texts within a tree node as well.

Smart text definitions are done using the XML-way of formatting smart text (i.e. NOT the csv-way).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSmartLabelInTree}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSmartLabelInTree.tree}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Tree Node" width="100%;100" >
<t:treenode id="g_5" foreground=".{foreground}" usesmartlabel="true" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" rendered="true" text="Add. Column" width="120" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_7" image=".{image}" smarttext=".{text}" smarttexttype="xml" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSmartLabelInTree}")

public class DemoSmartLabelInTree
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        public String getForeground()
        {
            if (getText().contains("1"))
                return "#008000";
            if (getText().startsWith("Top"))
                return "#000000";
            else
                return "#000080";
        }
        public String getImage()
        {
            if (getText().contains("1"))
                return "/images/icons/accept.png";
            else
                return null;
        }
    }

    public DemoSmartLabelInTree(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("<u>Top</u> " + i+" Node");
            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            for (int j=0; j<i*2; j++)
            {
                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("<u>Sub</u> " + i + "/" + j+" Node <sub>(sub)</sub>");
                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
    }

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }
}

Explicit Status Image

By default there are three icons that represent the status of each tree node (closed, opened, end-node).

You can override these images either centrally by using client parameters "imagetreenode*". These central definitions are used by default for all tree nodes.

Or you can individually define the status images for the individual TREENODE component.

The individual definition can be done in two ways:

1. You may define the three images using the FIXSTATUSIMAGE* attributes. In this case the definition you do is used for all tree nodes of the tree.
2. You may define a specific image using attribute STATUSIMAGE, which points to a server side property, providing the name of the image. In this case you can individually assign status image for each individual node instance.

Please note: a tree node provides two images: the status image is the one indicating if the tree node is opened or closed or if the tree node is an end node.
Independent from this status image there is the optional normal image, which is assigned by calling the setImage()-method in the server side tree node representation. This image is arranged just in front of the text of the node.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeStatusImage}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" font="size:14" text="Default" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_5" background="#FFFFFF" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeStatusImage.tree}" sbvisibleamount="8" stylevariant="cctree" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_7" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" font="size:14" text="Other status images, defined in fix way" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_11" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeStatusImage.tree}" sbvisibleamount="8" stylevariant="cctree" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_13" background="#FFFFFF" fixstatusimageclosed="/eclntjsfserver/images/foldablepanedefaulttoicon.png" fixstatusimageendnode="/eclntjsfserver/images/control_play.png" fixstatusimageopened="/eclntjsfserver/images/foldablepanedefaulticon.png" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" font="size:14" text="Other status images, dynamically defined" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_17" background="#FFFFFF" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeStatusImage.tree}" sbvisibleamount="8" stylevariant="cctree" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_19" statusimage=".{statusImage}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeStatusImage}")

public class DemoTreeStatusImage
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    static Random RANDOM = new Random();
    
    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        // i_statusImage used for dynamic example only!
        String i_statusImage;
        public String getStatusImage() { return i_statusImage; }
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
            int r = RANDOM.nextInt() % 3;
            if (r == 0) i_statusImage = "/images/icons/accept.png";
            else if (r == 1) i_statusImage = "/images/icons/disk.png";
            else i_statusImage = "/images/icons/car.png";
        }
    }

    protected FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();
    public DemoTreeStatusImage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("Top " + i);
            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_OPENED);
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("Sub " + i + "/" + j);
                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
    }

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }

}

Select vs. Toggle

In the example the selected object does not change when the user is just toggling a certain node. It only changes if there is some real selection, that is not associated with a node toggling, is behind.

When the user clicks into a tree node then - as always within the grid processing - a selection is triggered.

Sometimes you want to differentiate on server side, if the click is associated with a toggling or if it is a "real" click. In the example "toggle clicks" do not automatically select the corresponding line - only "non toggle clicks" really cause a selection.

For this purpose you can access the events that are processed within a roundtrip - and can check if there is a toggle event part of the request processing.

When separating the line selection in the way shown, then you can easily show the user the selected node by adding some bgpaint command.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeSelectVersusToggle}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" background="#FFFFFF" border="0" borderheight="0" drawoddevenrows="false" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeSelectVersusToggle.tree}" reselectable="true" sbvisibleamount="10" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_5" bgpaint=".{treeNodeBgpaint}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Selection:" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_8" font="size:20" text="#{d.DemoTreeSelectVersusToggle.observedTreeNodeText}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.FacesEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.ThreadData;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventToggle;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeSingleClickExecute}")

public class DemoTreeSelectVersusToggle
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode, String text, int status)
        {
            super(parentNode);
            setText(text);
            setStatus(status);
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            // find out if a toggle comes as event, too
            List<FacesEvent> requestEvents = ThreadData.getInstance().getRequestEvents();
            boolean foundToggle = false;
            for (FacesEvent requestEvent: requestEvents)
            {
                if (requestEvent instanceof BaseActionEventToggle) 
                {
                    foundToggle = true;
                    break;
                }
            }
            if (foundToggle == false)
            {
                m_treeNodeObserved = this;
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("This was a real selection...");
            }
            else
            {
                Statusbar.outputMessage("This was just a toggle...");
            }
        }
        public String getTreeNodeBgpaint()
        {
            if (this == m_treeNodeObserved)
                return "rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#00FF0050,#00FF0020,vertical)";
            else
                return null;
        }
    }

    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();
    TreeNode m_treeNodeObserved = null;
    
    public DemoTreeSelectVersusToggle(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode(),"Germany",TreeNode.STATUS_OPENED);
            new TreeNode(top,"Bammental",TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            new TreeNode(top,"Heidelberg",TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            new TreeNode(top,"Unterhaching",TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
        }
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode(),"Austria",TreeNode.STATUS_OPENED);
            new TreeNode(top,"Kufstein",TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            new TreeNode(top,"Salzburg",TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
        }
    }
    
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }
    
    public String getObservedTreeNodeText()
    {
        if (m_treeNodeObserved == null)
            return null;
        else
            return m_treeNodeObserved.getText();
    }
}

Only show node's subcomponent

When setting flag ONLYSHOWSUBCOMPONENT to true, then the TREENODE does not show its default text (and optional image) node, but it only shows its contained sub component.

In the example the sub component is a FIELD component, that is bound to the text of the tree node. As result you can directly edit the tree node's text.

The sub component is sized, so that it automatically (independent from its WIDTH/HEIGHT definition) receives the full available width/height. You may add a PANE as sub component internally splitting up into one or several rows that then contain explicitly sized components.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeOnlyShowSubComponent}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" background="#FFFFFF" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeOnlyShowSubComponent.tree}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Tree Node" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_5" onlyshowsubcomponent="true" >
<t:field id="g_6" background="#00000000" border="left:0;right:0;top:0;bottom:0" text=".{text}" width="100%" />
</t:treenode>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeOnlyShowSubComponent}")

public class DemoTreeOnlyShowSubComponent
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {

        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTreeOnlyShowSubComponent(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);   
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("Top " + i);
            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            for (int j=0; j<10; j++)
            {
                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("Sub " + i + "/" + j);
                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotreeonlyshowsubcomponent.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTreeOnlyShowSubComponent}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Data Tree (PBC)

The Page Bean Component CCDataTree converts a flat data item collection into a tree.

You can easily set up the columns by which the tree is organized and you can easily set up the calculation of figures.

Please note: you must only add String-parameters or BigDecimal-parameters into the data item map!

The Page Bean Component CCDataTree is available within the pagebean-addons package (eclnt_pbc.jar).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" border="left:1;right:1;top:1;bottom:0;color:#00000018" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:tabbedline id="g_5" value="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree.tabIndex}" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree.onTabAction}" text="By Country" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree.onTabAction}" text="By Product Group" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree.onTabAction}" text="By Customer Category" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_10" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree.dataTree}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCDataTree" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCDataTree;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCDataTree.DataColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree}")

public class DemoPBCCCDataTree
    extends DemoPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCDataTree m_dataTree = new CCDataTree();
    int m_tabIndex;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCDataTree(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        init();
        initView0();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccdatatree.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataTree}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCDataTree getDataTree() { return m_dataTree; }

    public int getTabIndex() { return m_tabIndex; }
    public void setTabIndex(int value) { this.m_tabIndex = value; }

    public void onTabAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        switch (m_tabIndex) 
        {
            case 0: initView0(); break;
            case 1: initView1(); break;
            case 2: initView2(); break;
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void init()
    {
        List<Map<String,Object>> data = loadData();
        // load data into tree
        m_dataTree.prepareData(data,new CCDataTree.DefaultListener()
        {
            public void reactOnSelect(List<String> keyValues)
            {
            }
            public void reactOnExecute(List<String> keyValues)
            {
            }
        });
    }

    private void initView0()
    {
        List<String> treeColumns = new ArrayList<String>();
        treeColumns.add("COUNTRY");
        treeColumns.add("PRODUCTGROUP");
        treeColumns.add("CUSTOMERCATEGORY");
        initView(treeColumns,"Country / Product Group / Customer Category");
    }
    
    private void initView1()
    {
        List<String> treeColumns = new ArrayList<String>();
        treeColumns.add("PRODUCTGROUP");
        treeColumns.add("COUNTRY");
        treeColumns.add("CUSTOMERCATEGORY");
        initView(treeColumns,"Product Group / Country / Customer Category");
    }
    
    private void initView2()
    {
        List<String> treeColumns = new ArrayList<String>();
        treeColumns.add("CUSTOMERCATEGORY");
        treeColumns.add("COUNTRY");
        treeColumns.add("PRODUCTGROUP");
        initView(treeColumns,"Customer Category / Country / Product Group");
    }
    
    private void initView(List<String> treeColumns,String treeTitle)
    {
        List<CCDataTree.DataColumnInfo> dataColumns = new ArrayList<CCDataTree.DataColumnInfo>();
        dataColumns.add(new DataColumnInfo("REVENUE","Revenue",CCDataTree.EnumCalculation.TOTAL,"dec2"));
        dataColumns.add(new DataColumnInfo("PIECES","Pieces",CCDataTree.EnumCalculation.TOTAL,"dec0"));
        dataColumns.add(new DataColumnInfo("REVENUE","Average revenue",CCDataTree.EnumCalculation.AVERAGE,"dec0"));
        m_dataTree.prepareView(treeColumns,dataColumns,treeTitle);
        m_dataTree.sortByDataColumn(dataColumns.get(0),false);
    }
    
    private List<Map<String,Object>> loadData()
    {
        Random r = new Random();
        String[] countries = new String[] 
        {
            "Germany",
            "Austria",
            "United Kingdom",
            "United States",
            "Italy",
            "France"
        };
        String[] productGroups = new String[]
        {
             "Hardware",
             "Software",
             "Consumer Electronics",
             "Books",
             "Food",
             "Beverage",
             "Services"
        };
        String[] customerCategories = new String[]
        {
             "Private",
             "Retailer",
             "Business"
        };
        List<Map<String,Object>> result = new ArrayList<Map<String,Object>>();
        for (String country: countries)
        {
            for (String productGroup: productGroups)
            {
                for (String customerCategory: customerCategories)
                {
                    Map<String,Object> dataItem = new HashMap<String, Object>();
                    dataItem.put("COUNTRY",country);
                    dataItem.put("PRODUCTGROUP",productGroup);
                    dataItem.put("CUSTOMERCATEGORY",customerCategory);
                    BigDecimal revenue = new BigDecimal(r.nextInt(100000));
                    BigDecimal pieces = new BigDecimal(r.nextInt(1000));
                    dataItem.put("REVENUE",revenue);
                    dataItem.put("PIECES",pieces);
                    result.add(dataItem);
                }
            }
        }
        return result;
    }
}

Tree with editable text

Within the TREENODE component you may place any sub-component. So you can also place a FIELD inside.

By setting attribute ONLYSHOWSUBCOMPONENT to true, the TREENODE component does not render its own text anymore but only renders the sub-component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeEditableText}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" background="#FFFFFF" drawoddevenrows="false" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeEditableText.tree}" sbvisibleamount="35" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_5" onlyshowsubcomponent="true" >
<t:field id="g_6" background="#00000000" border="0" text=".{text}" width="100%" />
</t:treenode>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeEditableText}")

public class DemoTreeEditableText
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
        public void onToggle()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTreeEditableText(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("Some text: Top " + i);
            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("Some text: Sub " + i + "/" + j);
                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotreeeditabletext.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTreeEditableText}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Tree with vertical lines

By default, trees are rendered without vertical lines on the left of the nodes. But: you can switch on by using attribute TREENODE-WITHLINEDRAWING.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTreeLines}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeLines}" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="20" >
<t:pane id="g_4" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Without lines" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" coldistance="20" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_8" drawoddevenrows="false" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeLines.tree}" stylevariant="cctree" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_10" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_11" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" stylevariant="ccbig" text="With lines" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" coldistance="20" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_15" drawoddevenrows="false" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeLines.tree}" stylevariant="cctree" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_17" withlinedrawing="true" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeLines}")

public class DemoTreeLines
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        boolean i_childrenRead = false;
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
        public void onToggle()
        {
            if (i_childrenRead == false)
            {
                i_childrenRead = true;
                for (int i=0; i<3; i++)
                {
                    TreeNode top = new TreeNode(this);
                    top.setText("Sub folder " + i);
                    top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
                }
                for (int i=0; i<3; i++)
                {
                    TreeNode top = new TreeNode(this);
                    top.setText("Sub node " + i);
                    top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                }
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTreeLines(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        // build tree
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("Node " + i);
            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            top.toggleNode();
            top.getChildNodes().get(1).toggleNode();
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotreelines.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTreeLines}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Drag&drop of nodes

This demos shows how to drag&drop tree nodes.

1. you can drag&drop folder nodes and item nodes from one folder into the other
2. you can drag&drop folder nodes and item nodes in order to change their sequence within one folder node

The basics of the processing are:

1. normal drag&drop management via DRAGSEND and DROPRECEIVE attributes which are applied on TREENODE level
2. fact that in a grid/tree the dragged items are automatically the selected ones
3. positioning data in the BaseActionEventDrop that is interpreted, so that items are added in front/behind other items
4. APIs in the FIXGRIDTreeItem to re-arrange nodes

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTreeDragDrop}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeDragDrop}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeDragDrop.tree}" stylevariant="cctree" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_10" dragsend=".{dragSend}" dropreceive=".{dropReceive}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Collection;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeDragDrop}")

public class DemoTreeDragDrop
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        public void onToggle() { }
        /*
         * dragSend and dropReceive are generated out of gridId - so that drag drop
         * operations are always "inside" this grid - and not cross grids, if there
         * are several grids in the client dialog.
         */
        public String getDragSend() 
        { 
            return "GRID"+m_gridId+":ALL"; 
        }
        public String getDropReceive() 
        { 
            if (getStatusInt() == TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE)
                return "GRID"+m_gridId+":verticalsplit"; 
            else
                return "GRID"+m_gridId+":edges"; 
        }
        @Override
        /*
         * All client events for the TREENODE are sent to processTREENODEAction.
         * ==> override and add own event management, here: drag & drop.
         */
        public void processTREENDOEAction(ActionEvent event)
        {
            super.processTREENDOEAction(event);
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
                processItemsDropped(this,(BaseActionEventDrop)event);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int s_gridIdCounter = 0;
    
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();
    int m_gridId = s_gridIdCounter++; // each grid receives an own id

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTreeDragDrop(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillTree();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotreedragdrop.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTreeDragDrop}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillTree()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("Top " + i);
            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            for (int j=0; j<10; j++)
            {
                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("Sub " + i + "/" + j);
                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
                for (int k=0; k<10; k++)
                {
                    TreeNode subSub = new TreeNode(sub);
                    subSub.setText("Sub sub " + i + "/" + j + "/" + k);
                    subSub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                }
            }
        }
    }
    
    private void processItemsDropped(TreeNode target, BaseActionEventDrop event)
    {
        // the items that are dragged are always the currently selected ones
        Collection<TreeNode> sns = m_tree.getSelectedItemsAsSequence(); 
        boolean ok = checkIfNodeMovingIsPossible(target,sns);
        if (ok == false)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError("Moving the nodes is not possible.");
            return;
        }
        // remove nodes from current position
        for (TreeNode sn: sns)
            sn.removeNode();
        // dependent on drop position: decide where to move items to
        if (event.getPercentageHorizontal() >= 50 && target.getStatusInt() != TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE)
        {
            if (event.getPercentageVertical() < 50)
            {
                // as top items
                int counter = 0;
                for (TreeNode sn: sns)
                {
                    target.addSubNode(sn,counter);
                    counter++;
                }
            }
            else
            {
                // as last items
                for (TreeNode sn: sns)
                    target.addSubNode(sn,false);
            }
            // ensure target node is opened for the user
            target.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_OPENED);
        }
        else
        {
            int insertIndex = target.getParentNode().getChildNodes().indexOf(target);
            if (event.getPercentageVertical() >= 50)
                insertIndex++;
            // as top items
            int counter = 0;
            for (TreeNode sn: sns)
            {
                target.getParentNode().addSubNode(sn,insertIndex+counter);
                counter++;
            }
        }
    }

    private boolean checkIfNodeMovingIsPossible(TreeNode target, Collection<TreeNode> sns)
    {
        for (TreeNode sn: sns)
        {
            boolean below = checkIfNode1IsBelowNode2(target,sn);
            if (below == true)
                return false;
        }
        return true;
    }

    private boolean checkIfNode1IsBelowNode2(FIXGRIDTreeItem sn, FIXGRIDTreeItem target)
    {
        FIXGRIDTreeItem current = sn;
        while (true)
        {
            if (current == null)
                return false;
            if (current == target)
                return true;
            current = current.getParentNode();
        }
    }

}

Grid Popup Menu

Simple, static definition

On FIXGRID level there are two popup menu definitions that you can use:

(1) the POPUPMENU attribute is the one that is the reference to the POPUPMENU definition for the whole grid.
(2) the ROWPOPUPMENU attribute is the one that is the reference to the POPUPMENU definition for the grid items.

On FIXGRID level the popup events are automatically delegated to the item's or the grid's "onPopupMenuItem()" method. You need to override these methods in order to add your event processing.

In the example the menu for the whole grid only contains the "New Item" command, whereas the menu on item level allows to either call "New Item" or "Remove Item".

The event information that is available in the action listener method allows to check, where the user pressed the right mouse button in order to open the popup menu. Dependent from this information in the example the new item is either created in front or behind the corresponding item.

Of course you still can in addition define individual popup menus for each component that you place into the grid columns.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu.onWholePageAction}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#00000020" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu.rows}" popupmenu="GRIDPOPUPMENU" rowpopupmenu="GRIDROWPOPUPMENU" rowpopupmenuloadroundtrip="true" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDROWPOPUPMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_8" command="REMOVE" text="Remove Item" />
<t:menuitem id="g_9" command="NEW" text="New Item" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDPOPUPMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_10" command="NEW" text="New Item" />
<t:menuitem id="g_11" command="SELECTALL" hotkey="ctrl-65" text="Select all Items" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu}")

public class DemoGridPopupMenu
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            if ("REMOVE".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_rows.getItems().remove(this);
            }
            else if ("NEW".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                boolean inFront = (event.getPercentageVertical() < 50);
                MyRow r = new MyRow();
                int insertIndex = m_rows.getItems().indexOf(this);
                if (inFront == false)
                    insertIndex++;
                m_rows.getItems().add(insertIndex,r);
                m_rows.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(r);
            }
        }
    }
    
    public class MyGridListBinding extends FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>
    {
        @Override
        protected void onPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            if ("NEW".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                MyRow r = new MyRow();
                m_rows.getItems().add(r);
                m_rows.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(r);
            }
            else if ("SELECTALL".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
                for (MyRow row: getItems())
                    m_rows.selectItem(row);
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected MyGridListBinding m_rows = new MyGridListBinding();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridPopupMenu(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("fixgrid");
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            r.setLastName("LN " + i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void onWholePageAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            if ("COPY".equals(e.getCommand()))
            {
                Statusbar.outputAlert("Number of items: " + m_rows.getSelectedItems().size());
            }
        }
    }

}

Dynamic definition per cell

This demo shows how to build a popup menu that is specific for each cell of each row - without defining the POPUPMENU on cell component level (here LABEL inside GRIDCOL).

The building blocks are:

1. usage of FIXGRID-ROWPOPUPMENU and FIXGRID-ROWPOPUPMENULOADROUNDTRIP: the central popup menu with the id "GRIDPOPUPMENU" is defined as popup menu for the grid row, and a serve round trip is caused when the user presses the right mouse button

2. in the round trip (onRowPopupMenuLoad-method) the popup menu is built via DYNAMICCONTENT.

3. the grid provides the information about the selected column by calling method "getColumnIndexOfLastSelection()". The index that is returned always applies to the sequence of columns as defined in the FIXGRID definition (i.e. it does not depend from the column arrangement at runtime, where the user can update the column order by drag/drop)

You also see, that the grid provides a method "getColumnInfos()", returning an list of ColumnInfo-objects which hold the essential meta data for each columns. Using this meta data you can build up corresponding dynamic scenarios.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellPopupMenu}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellPopupMenu}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellPopupMenu.grid}" rowpopupmenu="GRIDPOPUPMENU" rowpopupmenuloadroundtrip="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" text="First name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_6" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="Last name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_9" />
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDPOPUPMENU" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_10" contentbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellPopupMenu.menuContent}" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.ColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridCellPopupMenu}")

public class DemoGridCellPopupMenu
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            outputColumnInfo();
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            outputColumnInfo();
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            outputColumnInfo();
            int selectedColumn = m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection();
            if ("CLEAR".equals(event.getCommand()))
                setTextOfColumn(selectedColumn,"");
            else if ("ADD+".equals(event.getCommand()))
                setTextOfColumn(selectedColumn,getTextOfColumn(selectedColumn)+"+");
            else if ("ADD++".equals(event.getCommand()))
                setTextOfColumn(selectedColumn,getTextOfColumn(selectedColumn)+"++");
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuLoad(BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad event)
        {
            outputColumnInfo();
            int selectedColumn = m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection();
            List<ComponentNode> l = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
            {
                MENUITEMNode min = new MENUITEMNode()
                        .setCommand("CLEAR")
                        .setText("Clear");
                l.add(min);
            }
            {
                MENUITEMNode min = new MENUITEMNode()
                        .setCommand("ADD+")
                        .setText("Change to " + getTextOfColumn(selectedColumn) + "+");
                l.add(min);
            }
            {
                MENUITEMNode min = new MENUITEMNode()
                        .setCommand("ADD++")
                        .setText("Change to " + getTextOfColumn(selectedColumn) + "++");
                l.add(min);
            }
            m_menuContent.setContentNodes(l);
        }
        private void setTextOfColumn(int column, String text)
        {
            switch (column)
            {
                case 0: i_firstName = text; return;
                case 1: i_lastName = text; return;
            }
            throw new Error("This column is not known: " + column);
        }
        private String getTextOfColumn(int column)
        {
            switch (column)
            {
                case 0: return getFirstName();
                case 1: return getLastName();
