            }
            throw new Error("This column is not known: " + column);
        }
        private void outputColumnInfo()
        {
            int selectedColumn = m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection();
            ColumnInfo ci = m_grid.getColumnInfos().get(selectedColumn);
            Statusbar.outputMessage("Column info: " + ci.getSortreference());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_menuContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridCellPopupMenu(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.i_firstName = "First " + i;
            gi.i_lastName = "Last " + i;
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridcellpopupmenu.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridCellPopupMenu}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getMenuContent() { return m_menuContent; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Large Output Lists

Array Grid

For output-only scenarios there is a special grid - the ARRAYGRID. In the ARRAYGRID all layout information about the columns is passed through array parameters. The mandatory parameters on grid level are the columns[] and widths[] array - the mandatory parameter on item level is the values[] array.

Aside the dynamic configuration there is one important aspect: ARRAYGRID components are not "multiplied out" into their cell components at runtime. This makes them usable for large grids that normally, with normal FIXGRID rendering, would occupy quite a lot of memory for holding the corresponding component tree.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:timer id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.onTimer}" duration="10000" rendered="false" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:rowheader id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Number of columns" />
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="10" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" format="int" value="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.columnCount}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.onNewColumns}" text="Update grid" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Export..." />
<t:link id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Columns..." />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:arraygrid id="g_14" avoidroundtrips="true" bordercolor="#00000020" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" flushcolumnupdates="true" gridcolbgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000040);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000060)" gridcolfont="weight:bold" gridcolforeground="#f0f0f0" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.grid}" rowbgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000004);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000014);" rowpopupmenu="ROW" sbvisibleamount="30" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" usefieldforlabel="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.onAddItem}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add Item" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_17" />
<t:popupmenu id="ROW" >
<t:menuitem id="g_18" command="remove" text="Remove" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding}")

/**
 * Demo of dynamic grid.
 * The first column (index 0) is a special one in this demo - by assigning
 * the text value ARRAYGRIDListBinding.TEXT_GRIDROWSELECTOR or TEXT_GRIDROWINDEX,
 * a grid row selector is rendered as column content. Otherwise (with normal)
 * text a normal LABEL is rendered.
 */
public class DemoArrayGridBinding
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyARRAYGRIDItem extends ARRAYGRIDItem
    {
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("onRowExecute was called");
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("onRowSelect was called");
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            super.onRowPopupMenuItem(event);
            if ("remove".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_grid.getItems().remove(this);                
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static Random s_random = new Random();
    
    ARRAYGRIDListBinding<MyARRAYGRIDItem> m_grid = new ARRAYGRIDListBinding<MyARRAYGRIDItem>();
    int m_columnCount = 25;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoArrayGridBinding(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initGrid();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            onAddItem(null);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public ARRAYGRIDListBinding getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void setColumnCount(int value) 
    { 
        m_columnCount = value; 
        if (m_columnCount <= 0)
            m_columnCount = 1;
    }
    public int getColumnCount() { return m_columnCount; }
    
    public void onAddItem(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Random r = new Random();
        MyARRAYGRIDItem agi = new MyARRAYGRIDItem();
        String[] values = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] backgrounds = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] fonts = new String[m_columnCount];
        for (int j=0; j<m_columnCount; j++)
        {
            if (j == 2 && m_grid.getItems().size()%2 == 0)
                continue;
            values[j] = j+"_"+s_random.nextInt(99999);
        }
        for (int j=0; j<m_columnCount; j++) 
        {
            int randomInt = r.nextInt(10);
            if (randomInt == 5)
            {
                backgrounds[j] = "#ffc0c040";
                fonts[j] = "weight:bold";
            }
            else if (j % 2 == 0)
                backgrounds[j] = "#ffffc040";
            else if (j % 7 == 0)
                backgrounds[j] = "#c0ffc040";
            else
                backgrounds[j] = "#c0ffff40";
        }
        String[] images = new String[m_columnCount];
        images[0] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        images[1] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        images[2] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        agi.setValues(values);
        agi.setBackgrounds(backgrounds);
        agi.setImages(images);
        agi.setFonts(fonts);
        m_grid.getItems().add(agi);
        if (event != null)
            m_grid.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(agi);
    }
    
    public void onNewColumns(ActionEvent event)
    {
        initGrid();
    }
    
    public void onTimer(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Timer: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initGrid()
    {
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        String[] titles = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] widths = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] aligns = new String[m_columnCount];
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++) titles[i] = "Title " + i;
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++)
        {
            widths[i] = "100";
            if (i%5 == 4) widths[i] = "150";
        }
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++)
        {
            aligns[i] = "left";
            if (i%5 == 4) aligns[i] = "right";
        }
        m_grid.setTitles(titles);
        m_grid.setWidths(widths);
        m_grid.setAligns(aligns);
    }
    
}

Array Grid - faster variant

This variant of the ARRAYGRID defines the attribute ARRAYGRID-USEMULTILABEL as "true". The texts are not individually rendered by own components, but all texts within one line are rendered with one component.

Result: the grid is much faster, especially if containing many columns (> 30 columns).

But: not all features of the "full" ARRAYGRID are available in this variant. You cannot use images in front of texts and you also cannot switch between individual control types for rendering cells.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:timer id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel.onTimer}" duration="10000" rendered="false" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:rowheader id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Number of columns" />
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="10" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" format="int" value="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel.columnCount}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel.onNewColumns}" text="Update grid" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Export..." />
<t:link id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Columns..." />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:arraygrid id="g_14" avoidroundtrips="true" bordercolor="#00000020" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" flushcolumnupdates="true" gridcolbgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000040);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000060)" gridcolfont="weight:bold" gridcolforeground="#f0f0f0" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel.grid}" rowbgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000004);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000014);" rowpopupmenu="ROW" sbvisibleamount="30" selectorcolumn="1" usemultilabel="true" width="100%" usefieldforlabel="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel.onAddItem}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add Item" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_17" />
<t:popupmenu id="ROW" >
<t:menuitem id="g_18" command="remove" text="Remove" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding}")

/**
 * Demo of dynamic grid.
 * The first column (index 0) is a special one in this demo - by assigning
 * the text value ARRAYGRIDListBinding.TEXT_GRIDROWSELECTOR or TEXT_GRIDROWINDEX,
 * a grid row selector is rendered as column content. Otherwise (with normal)
 * text a normal LABEL is rendered.
 */
public class DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyARRAYGRIDItem extends ARRAYGRIDItem
    {
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("onRowExecute was called");
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("onRowSelect was called");
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            super.onRowPopupMenuItem(event);
            if ("remove".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_grid.getItems().remove(this);                
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static Random s_random = new Random();
    
    ARRAYGRIDListBinding<MyARRAYGRIDItem> m_grid = new ARRAYGRIDListBinding<MyARRAYGRIDItem>();
    int m_columnCount = 25;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoArrayGridBindingUseMultiLabel(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initGrid();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            onAddItem(null);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public ARRAYGRIDListBinding getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void setColumnCount(int value) 
    { 
        m_columnCount = value; 
        if (m_columnCount <= 0)
            m_columnCount = 1;
    }
    public int getColumnCount() { return m_columnCount; }
    
    public void onAddItem(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Random r = new Random();
        MyARRAYGRIDItem agi = new MyARRAYGRIDItem();
        String[] values = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] backgrounds = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] fonts = new String[m_columnCount];
        for (int j=0; j<m_columnCount; j++)
        {
            if (j == 2 && m_grid.getItems().size()%2 == 0)
                continue;
            values[j] = j+"_"+s_random.nextInt(99999);
        }
        for (int j=0; j<m_columnCount; j++) 
        {
            int randomInt = r.nextInt(10);
            if (randomInt == 5)
            {
                backgrounds[j] = "#ffc0c040";
                fonts[j] = "weight:bold";
            }
            else if (j % 2 == 0)
                backgrounds[j] = "#ffffc040";
            else if (j % 7 == 0)
                backgrounds[j] = "#c0ffc040";
            else
                backgrounds[j] = "#c0ffff40";
        }
        String[] images = new String[m_columnCount];
        images[0] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        images[1] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        images[2] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        agi.setValues(values);
        agi.setBackgrounds(backgrounds);
        agi.setImages(images);
        agi.setFonts(fonts);
        m_grid.getItems().add(agi);
        if (event != null)
            m_grid.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(agi);
    }
    
    public void onNewColumns(ActionEvent event)
    {
        initGrid();
    }
    
    public void onTimer(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Timer: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initGrid()
    {
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        String[] titles = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] widths = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] aligns = new String[m_columnCount];
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++) titles[i] = "Title " + i;
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++)
        {
            widths[i] = "100";
            if (i%5 == 4) widths[i] = "150";
        }
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++)
        {
            aligns[i] = "left";
            if (i%5 == 4) aligns[i] = "right";
        }
        m_grid.setTitles(titles);
        m_grid.setWidths(widths);
        m_grid.setAligns(aligns);
    }
    
}

Data Types in Array Grid

This demo shows how to define different data types within an array grid.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridDataTypes}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridDataTypes.onFillGrid}" text="Fill Grid" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridDataTypes.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:arraygrid id="g_8" background="#FFFFFF80" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridDataTypes.grid}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoArrayGridDataTypes}")

public class DemoArrayGridDataTypes
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends ARRAYGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
    }

    public DemoArrayGridDataTypes(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_grid.setTitles(new String[] {"Date of Birth","Town of Birth","Weight at birth (kg)","Height at birth (cm)","female"});
        m_grid.setAligns(new String[] {"left","left","right","right","left"});
        m_grid.setWidths(new String[] {"120","100%;200","100","100","50"});
        m_grid.setFormats(new String[] {"datetime",null,"bigdecimal","int","boolean"});
        m_grid.setFormatmasks(new String[] {"medium",null,"dec3",null,null});
        onFillGrid(null);
    }

    protected ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void onFillGrid(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            // somtimes data, sometimes null
            if (i%3 != 2)
                gi.setValues(new Object[] {new Date(),"Town " + i,new BigDecimal("3.23").add(new BigDecimal(i)),new Integer(50+i),true});
            else
                gi.setValues(new Object[] {null,"Town " + i,null,null,false});
            // sometimes images
            if (i%4 == 0)
            {
                gi.setImages(new String[] {null,"/images/icons/add.png",null,null,null});
            }
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

}

Setting of Control Type

You can fine-control the array grid by assigning an explicit control type per column.
Example: you might set the control type "text-area" for columns containing long texts, that the user might scroll.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridControlTypes}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:arraygrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridControlTypes.grid}" rowheight="50" sbvisibleamount="15" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoArrayGridControlTypes}")

public class DemoArrayGridControlTypes
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public class GridItem extends ARRAYGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoArrayGridControlTypes(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_grid.setTitles(new String[] {"First Name","Last Name","Comment","Image"});
        m_grid.setWidths(new String[] {"100","100","100%;100","100"});
        m_grid.setControltypes(new int[] 
        {
            ARRAYGRIDListBinding.CONTROLTYPE_DEFAULT,
            ARRAYGRIDListBinding.CONTROLTYPE_DEFAULT,
            ARRAYGRIDListBinding.CONTROLTYPE_TEXTAREA,
            ARRAYGRIDListBinding.CONTROLTYPE_IMAGE
        });
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            String firstName = "First" + i;
            String lastName = "Last" + i;
            StringBuffer comment = new StringBuffer();
            for (int j=0; j<i%5; j++)
                comment.append("This is some comment about the person. ");
            String image = "/images/iconssvg/running_blue_16x16.svg";
            if (i%3 == 0) image = "/images/iconssvg/running_green_16x16.svg";
            if (i%4 == 0) image = null;
            gi.setValues(new String[] {firstName,lastName,comment.toString(),image});
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Multi label - direct usage

The MULTILABEL component renders multiple labels in one sequence. The information for the labels is contained in an object of class MULTILABELBinding.

Why is there special component to render multiple labels - and not use the normal LABEL component?
It's the speed of client side rendering. The rendering within the MULTILABEL does not render individual cells but passes all labels as one block into the DOM-tree.

The MULTILABEL component is designed to be used within the FIXGRID processing. It is implicitly used within the ARRAYGRID.

Please note:

1. You must assign background colors with a transparency (e.g. #00000010). The background is actually drawn in front of the labels in order to still see the labels' own background.
2. A selection/focus-ing of individual labels is not possible - the controls is always focused as one component.
3. On server side you can transfer the click information of an "invoke-event" so that you know which label was clicked.

Please take a look into the XML of the demo: the MULTILABEL component is not only used as content cell of the grid, but also as column header (second control instance in GRIDCOL).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoMultiLabel}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMultiLabel}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMultiLabel.grid}" selectorcolumn="2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" textwidth="0" width="#{d.DemoMultiLabel.header.width}" >
<t:multilabel id="g_10" actionListener=".{onInvokeAction}" invokeevent="leftclick" multilabelbinding=".{mlb}" />
<t:multilabel id="g_11" background="#00000028" height="100%" multilabelbinding="#{d.DemoMultiLabel.header}" width="100%" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventInvoke;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MULTILABELBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MULTILABELBinding.TextInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMultiLabel}")

public class DemoMultiLabel
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        MULTILABELBinding m_mlb = new MULTILABELBinding();
        public MULTILABELBinding getMlb() { return m_mlb; }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        public void onInvokeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
        {
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventInvoke)
            {
                TextInfo ti = m_mlb.getTextInfoForEvent((BaseActionEventInvoke)event);
                if (ti != null)
                    Statusbar.outputSuccess("Event in cell: id - " + ti.getId() + ", text -" + ti.getText());
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    MULTILABELBinding m_header = new MULTILABELBinding();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoMultiLabel(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        int maxCols = 100;
        // multi label that is shown in the gridcol header
        for (int j=0; j<maxCols; j++)
        {
            int width = (j%10)*10 + 40;
            TextInfo ti = new TextInfo().setText("Col "+j).setWidth(width);
            m_header.addTextInfo(ti);
        }
        // multi label that is shown in the grid cell per item
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            for (int j=0;j<maxCols;j++)
            {
                int width = (j%10)*10 + 40;
                TextInfo ti = new TextInfo()
                        .setText("Test "+i+"/"+j)
                        .setWidth(width)
                        .setId(i+"/"+j);
                if (j%4 == 0)
                {
                    ti.setBackground("#FFC0C0");
                }
                if (j%7 == 0)
                {
                    ti.setBackground("#40C040");
                    ti.setForeground("#FFFFFF");
                }
                gi.getMlb().addTextInfo(ti);
            }
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomultilabel.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMultiLabel}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public MULTILABELBinding getHeader() { return m_header; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

}

Multi label - performance

This demo shows the difference in performance between individually rendered grid cell components - and MULTILABEL-based rendering of cells.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance}" rowdistance="5" >
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="10" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_2" format="int" labeltext="Number of columns" value="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.nofColumns}" width="200" />
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.onRenderAction}" text="Update grids" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textpane id="g_20" text="Check the scrolling speed of the grids below with various number of columns. The MULTILABEL based grid is much faster when if comes to rendering a higher nunber of columns." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_33" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Traditional FIXGRID" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_7" contentbinding="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.dynGridContent}" />
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Internal usage of MULTILABEL" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_12" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.grid2}" rowheight="45" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Column" textwidth="0" width="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.grid2Width}" >
<t:pane id="g_11" >
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:multilabel id="g_15" height="100%" multilabelbinding=".{ml1}" width="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.grid2Width}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_13" background="#00000008" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:multilabel id="g_24" height="100%" multilabelbinding=".{ml2}" width="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.grid2Width}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_26" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:multilabel id="g_22" height="100%" multilabelbinding="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.mlTitle}" width="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance.grid2Width}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIXGRIDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWLINENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MULTILABELBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MULTILABELBinding.TextInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.map.LazyLoadingMap;
import org.eclnt.util.map.LazyLoadingMap.ILazyLoader;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance}")

public class DemoMultilabelGridPerformance
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Grid1Item extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Map<String,BigDecimal> i_data = new LazyLoadingMap<BigDecimal>();
        public Grid1Item()
        {
            ((LazyLoadingMap<BigDecimal>)i_data).setLoader(new ILazyLoader<BigDecimal>()
            {
                @Override
                public BigDecimal lazyLoad(String key)
                {
                    int v = s_random.nextInt(1000000);
                    return new BigDecimal(v);
                }
            });
        }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        public Map<String, BigDecimal> getData() { return i_data; }
    }

    public class Grid2Item extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        MULTILABELBinding i_ml1 = new MULTILABELBinding();
        MULTILABELBinding i_ml2 = new MULTILABELBinding();
        public MULTILABELBinding getMl1() { return i_ml1; }
        public MULTILABELBinding getMl2() { return i_ml2; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
        private void renderMultiLabels()
        {
            i_ml1.clear();
            i_ml2.clear();
            for (int i=0; i<m_nofColumns; i++)
            {
                {
                    TextInfo ti = new TextInfo();
                    BigDecimal v = new BigDecimal(s_random.nextInt(1000000));
                    String vt = ValueManager.convertObject2ClientDisplayString(v,"bigdecimal","dec2","CET",false,false);
                    ti.setText(vt);
                    ti.setWidth(100);
                    ti.setAlign("right");
                    i_ml1.addTextInfo(ti);
                }
                {
                    TextInfo ti = new TextInfo();
                    BigDecimal v = new BigDecimal(s_random.nextInt(1000000));
                    String vt = ValueManager.convertObject2ClientDisplayString(v,"bigdecimal","dec2","CET",false,false);
                    ti.setText(vt);
                    ti.setWidth(100);
                    ti.setAlign("right");
                    i_ml2.addTextInfo(ti);
                }
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynGridContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<Grid2Item> m_grid2 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<Grid2Item>();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<Grid1Item> m_grid1 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<Grid1Item>();
    int m_nofColumns = 25;
    Random s_random = new Random();
    MULTILABELBinding m_mlTitle = new MULTILABELBinding();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoMultilabelGridPerformance(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);  
        fillGrids();
        renderGrid1();
        renderGrid2();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomultilabelgridperformance.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMultilabelGridPerformance}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynGridContent() { return m_dynGridContent; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<Grid1Item> getGrid1() { return m_grid1; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<Grid2Item> getGrid2() { return m_grid2; }
    public MULTILABELBinding getMlTitle() { return m_mlTitle; }


    public int getNofColumns() { return m_nofColumns; }
    public void setNofColumns(int value) { this.m_nofColumns = value; }

    public void onRenderAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        renderGrid1();
        renderGrid2();
    }

    public int getGrid2Width() 
    { 
        return m_nofColumns * 100; 
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderGrid1()
    {
        FIXGRIDNode f = new FIXGRIDNode()
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setHeight("100%")
                .setObjectbinding(pbx("grid1"))
                .setRowheight(45);
        for (int i=0; i<m_nofColumns; i++)
        {
            GRIDCOLNode c = new GRIDCOLNode()
                    .setWidth("100")
                    .setText("Col " + i)
                    .setAlign("right");
            f.addSubNode(c);
            PANENode p = new PANENode();
            c.addSubNode(p);
            p.addSubNode(new ROWDISTANCENode().setHeight("100%"));
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                p.addSubNode(r);
                LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                        .setText(".{data['value+"+(i*2)+"']}")
                        .setFormat("bigdecimal")
                        .setFormatmask("dec2")
                        .setAlign("right")
                        .setWidth("100%");
                r.addSubNode(l);
            }
            p.addSubNode(new ROWDISTANCENode().setHeight("100%"));
            p.addSubNode(new ROWLINENode().setHeight(1).setBackground("#00000008"));
            p.addSubNode(new ROWDISTANCENode().setHeight("100%"));
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                p.addSubNode(r);
                LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                        .setText(".{data['value+"+(i*2+1)+"']}")
                        .setFormat("bigdecimal")
                        .setFormatmask("dec2")
                        .setAlign("right")
                        .setWidth("100%");
                r.addSubNode(l);
            }
            p.addSubNode(new ROWDISTANCENode().setHeight("100%"));
        }
        m_dynGridContent.setContentNode(f);
    }

    private void renderGrid2()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<m_nofColumns; i++)
        {
            TextInfo ti = new TextInfo();
            ti.setText("Col " + i);
            ti.setAlign("right");
            ti.setWidth(100);
            ti.setBackground("#00000000");
            ti.setFont("weight:bold");
            m_mlTitle.addTextInfo(ti);
        }
        for (Grid2Item gi: m_grid2.getItems())
        {
            gi.renderMultiLabels();
        }
    }

    private void fillGrids()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            m_grid1.getItems().add(new Grid1Item());
            m_grid2.getItems().add(new Grid2Item());
        }
    }

}

Selection Issues

Re-selection of items

Every time a selection is sent to the server side, the demo application outputs some information to the status bar - including some timestamp. You will notice that there is a different behavior of sending events to the server side if re-clicking an already selected item, dependent on the definition of the RESELETABLE attribute.

By default a grid only sends item selection events if the item is switching from unselected to selected.

By defining attribute RESELECTABLE to "true" you can override this behavior. In this case any click onto the item is causing a selection event which is tranferred to the server side.

In most cases you do not require a re-selection event, so the default is set to "false". You may for example require to define it as "true" if you e.g. want to get information about the currently selected column - or if you just always want to re-read certain data with every click event.-

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridReselectable}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Reselectable" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_4" flush="true" group="RESELECTABLE" refvalue="true" text="Reselectable" value="#{d.DemoGridReselectable.reselectable}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="125" />
<t:textpane id="g_7" font="size:10" text="Each click onto an item is triggering a selection event on server side - regardless if the item is already selected." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_10" flush="true" group="RESELECTABLE" refvalue="false" text="Not reselectable (default)" value="#{d.DemoGridReselectable.reselectable}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="125" />
<t:textpane id="g_13" font="size:10" text="If an item is already selected, then follow-on-clicks do NOT trigger further selection events on server side." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_16" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridReselectable.grid}" reselectable="#{d.DemoGridReselectable.reselectable}" sbvisibleamount="35" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_17" text="First name" width="50%;100" >
<t:label id="g_18" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="Last name" width="50%;100" >
<t:label id="g_20" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridReselectable}")

public class DemoGridReselectable
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Grid item selection: " + i_lastName + ", " + i_firstName + " - " + System.currentTimeMillis());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    boolean m_reselectable = false;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridReselectable(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);      
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridreselectable.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridReselectable}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public boolean getReselectable() { return m_reselectable; }
    public void setReselectable(boolean value) { this.m_reselectable = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Delayed execution

Use AUTOEXECUTE to define that the grid will send an execute event after not changing the selection for a certain duration.

This means: you can quickly navigate through the grid, without performing the execution of expansive activities item by item.

Instead you move the expansive activity into the execute-event-handler which is then called after certain duration of not changing the selection.

The duration can be defined by attribute AUTOEXECUTEDURATION. The default is 1000ms.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAutoExecute}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="Select an item in the grid - best by clicking inside and then using cursor-up and -down navigation. You see: the graphics on the right is not built up for each item you select, but is only built up for the item where you stopped the selection processing." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="20" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_5" autoexecute="true" avoidroundtrips="2" background="#FFFFFF" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAutoExecute.grid}" sbvisibleamount="35" width="30%;220" >
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Id" width="50" >
<t:label id="g_7" background=".{background}" text=".{id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Last name" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_9" background=".{background}" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="First name" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_11" background=".{background}" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
<t:box id="g_12" height="100%" padding="20" width="70%;300" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" align="center" stylevariant="ccbig" text="#{d.DemoGridAutoExecute.chartTitle}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:chartjs id="g_16" chartjsconfig="#{d.DemoGridAutoExecute.chart}" height="100%" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:box>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridAutoExecute}")

public class DemoGridAutoExecute
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_id;
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public String getId() { return i_id; }
        public void setId(String value) { this.i_id = value; }
        public String getBackground()
        {
            if (m_currentlyShownItem == this)
                return "#FFd080";
            else
                return null;
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            // no activity here - otherwise the grid processing gets slower
            // and there is a lot of flickering on the screen
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            // this method is called after explicit selection by the user
            // (hitting the return key or double clicking) ...and it
            // is called when not changing the selection for a while.
            createChart(this);
        }
    }

    static class JO extends HashMap<String,Object> {}
    static class JOs extends ArrayList<JO> {}

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_chartTitle;
    String m_chart;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    GridItem m_currentlyShownItem;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridAutoExecute(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setId(4711+i+"");
            gi.setLastName("Last " + gi.getId());
            gi.setFirstName("First " + gi.getId());
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
        // select first person
        createChart(m_grid.getItems().get(0));
    }

    @Override
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridautoexecute.jsp"; }
    @Override
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridAutoExecute}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getChartTitle() { return m_chartTitle; }

    public String getChart() { return m_chart; }
    public void setChart(String value) { this.m_chart = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static final String[] REGIONS = new String[] {"North","West","South","East"};
    static final String[] COLORS = new String[] {"#FFC0C0","#C0FFC0","#C0C0FF","#C0C0C0"};

    static final String[] CATEGORIES = new String[] {"Hardware","Software","Other"};

    private void createChart(GridItem gi)
    {
        m_currentlyShownItem = gi;
        m_chartTitle = "Sales of " + gi.getLastName() + ", " + gi.getFirstName();
        Random r = new Random();
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("type","bar");
        JO data = new JO();
        chart.put("data",data);
        {
            List<String> labels = new ArrayList<String>();
            for (String category: CATEGORIES) labels.add(category);
            data.put("labels",labels);
            JOs datasets = new JOs();
            data.put("datasets",datasets);
            for (int i=0; i<REGIONS.length; i++)
            {
                JO dataset = new JO();
                datasets.add(dataset);
                List<BigDecimal> datasetData = new ArrayList<BigDecimal>();

                for (int j=0; j<CATEGORIES.length; j++)
                    datasetData.add(new BigDecimal(r.nextInt(45000)));
                dataset.put("label",REGIONS[i]);
                dataset.put("data",datasetData);
                dataset.put("fill",true);
                dataset.put("backgroundColor",COLORS[i]);
            }
        }
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_chart = gson.toJson(chart);
    }


}

Single click execute

There are two ways to react on grid selections:

By default:

(.) onRowSelect is called in the grid item when the user clicks an item - or navigates into it by keyboard
(.) onRowExecute is called when the user double-clicks an item (long-click on mobile devices) - or the user hits the return key within the grid item

By using attribute SINGLECLICKEXECUTE you can fine-tune this behavior. By setting the attribute to true, the "onRowExecute" is already called when the user single-clicks into the grid.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSingleClickExecute}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Single click execute" width="150" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_4" flush="true" group="SEC" refvalue="true" text="true" value="#{d.DemoGridSingleClickExecute.singelClickExecute}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="150" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" group="SEC" refvalue="false" text="false" value="#{d.DemoGridSingleClickExecute.singelClickExecute}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSingleClickExecute.grid}" sbvisibleamount="35" singleclickexecute="#{d.DemoGridSingleClickExecute.singelClickExecute}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridSingleClickExecute}")

public class DemoGridSingleClickExecute
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_name;
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { this.i_name = value; }

        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            OKPopup.createInstance("onRowExecute called","onRowExecute was called on item: " + i_name);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    boolean m_singelClickExecute;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridSingleClickExecute(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setName("Name " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridsingleclickexecute.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridSingleClickExecute}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public boolean getSingelClickExecute() { return m_singelClickExecute; }
    public void setSingelClickExecute(boolean value) { this.m_singelClickExecute = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Item selection and focus

The grid method "selectAndFocus" is a quite powerful one: it selects the item, ensure that it is visible and puts the focus into the first focus-able component of the item.

There is more behind the item positioning than you might be aware of...: at server side, with an initial grid with variable number of rows (i.e. height is maintained), there is no knowledge about how many items are visible on client side. As result, there might be an automated scrolling for initial screens so that the item is visible.

After the initialization phase of the grid (and after the first roundtrip of the grid to the server), the server now knows how many items do fit into the grid on client side. From now on there is no necessity for automated scrolling anymore.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectFocus}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Index" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_4" format="int" value="#{d.DemoGridSelectFocus.indexToBeSelected}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridSelectFocus.onSelectAndFocus}" text="Select and Focus" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_10" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectFocus.grid}" sbvisibleamount="40" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_12" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_14" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridSelectFocus}")

public class DemoGridSelectFocus 
    extends PageBean
    implements IClientLogAware
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    public DemoGridSelectFocus(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
        // initial focus to row 30
        m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(m_grid.getItems().get(30));
        m_indexToBeSelected = 30;
    }

    protected int m_indexToBeSelected;
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public void setGrid(FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> value) { m_grid = value; }

    public int getIndexToBeSelected() { return m_indexToBeSelected; }
    public void setIndexToBeSelected(int value) { m_indexToBeSelected = value; }

    public void onSelectAndFocus(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
        m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(m_grid.getItems().get(m_indexToBeSelected));
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        GridItem gi = m_grid.getSelectedItem();
        if (gi != null)    
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Selected item: " + gi.getFirstName());
        else
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Selected item: nothing selected");
        return true;
    }

    
    
}

Item selection and scrolling

This demos does not show a spectacular grid... - but shows that you can control the grid from server side:

(.) You can scroll the grid to any position using the setSbvalue() method
(.) You can select/deselect items as desired
(.) You can ensure that a certain item is guaranteed to be visible

Always keep in mind: the server side grid management may know hundreds of items - the client only receives these items (+ scroll bar location information), that are the visible ones.

There's one special thing built in as well: try to select item 13. The server side logic will not allow you to do so - and will immediately select item 14.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridselection}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.demoGridselection.onSelectNextItem}" text="Select next row" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoGridselection.onScroll}" text="Scroll by one" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="20" />
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridselection.rows}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="First Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_11" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridselection 
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            super.onRowSelect();
            // special handling for item with index 12 (text says "13"...) this never allows
            // selection!!! Immediately jump to item 13
            if (m_rows.getItems().indexOf(this) == 12)
            {
                m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
                m_rows.selectItem(m_rows.getItems().get(13));
            }
        }
        
    }
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();

    public DemoGridselection(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            MyRow row = new MyRow();
            row.setFirstName("First name " + (i+1));
            m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        }
        // select the first item to be selected from the beginning on
        m_rows.selectItem(m_rows.getItems().get(0));
    }
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows()
    {
        return m_rows;
    }

    /**
     * Moves selection to the next row. If the end of the items
     * is reached then selection is moved to the first row.
     */
    public void onSelectNextItem(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        MyRow selectedItem = m_rows.getSelectedItem();
        if (selectedItem == null)
            return;
        int index = m_rows.getItems().indexOf(selectedItem);
        index++;
        if (index >= m_rows.getItems().size())
            index = 0;  // start from the beginning
        MyRow newSelectedItem = m_rows.getItems().get(index);
        m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
        m_rows.selectItem(newSelectedItem);
        m_rows.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(newSelectedItem);
    }
    
    /**
     * Scroll the grid by one.
     */
    public void onScroll(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        int newSbvalue = m_rows.getSbvalue() + 1;
        int maxValue = m_rows.getItems().size() - m_rows.getClientvisibleamount();
        if (newSbvalue > maxValue)
            newSbvalue = 0; // back to top so that "rotating scrolling"
        m_rows.setSbvalue(""+newSbvalue);
    }
    
}

Node selection in tree

Input an index and press the "Show" button - the corresponding tree node will be selected and the whole grid will be scrolled to make sure that it is visible. In case of a tree, all nodes above the selected node are opened to make it visible.

The method to be used on server side is "<grid>.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(...)".

A similar method that you might use is "<grid>.selectAndFocusItem(...)" which in addition moves the focus into the corresponding line.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTreePositioning}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreePositioning}" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="20" >
<t:box id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoTreePositioning.onShowAction}" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_6" format="int" labeltext="Node Index" value="#{d.DemoTreePositioning.index}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:textpane id="g_8" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="Select an index between 0 and 619." width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoTreePositioning.onShowAction}" text="Show" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoTreePositioning.onShowAndFocusAction}" text="Show &amp; focus" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:box>
<t:fixgrid id="g_14" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreePositioning.tree}" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_16" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreePositioning}")

public class DemoTreePositioning
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        public void onToggle() { }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_index = 0;
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();
    List<TreeNode> m_nodesList = new ArrayList<TreeNode>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTreePositioning(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher); 
        // build up tree
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText("Top" + i + "_" + m_nodesList.size());
            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            m_nodesList.add(top);
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("Sub" + i + "," + j + "_" + m_nodesList.size());
                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
                m_nodesList.add(sub);
                for (int k=0; k<5; k++)
                {
                    TreeNode subsub = new TreeNode(sub);
                    subsub.setText("Subsub" + i + "," + j+"," + k + "_" + m_nodesList.size());
                    subsub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                    m_nodesList.add(subsub);
                }
            }
        }
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Number of items: " + m_nodesList.size());
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotreepositioning.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTreePositioning}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onShowAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            TreeNode node = m_nodesList.get(m_index);
            m_tree.deselectCurrentSelection();
            m_tree.selectItem(node);
            m_tree.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(node);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }

    public void onShowAndFocusAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            TreeNode node = m_nodesList.get(m_index);
            m_tree.deselectCurrentSelection();
            m_tree.selectAndFocusItem(node);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }

    public int getIndex() { return m_index; }
    public void setIndex(int value) { this.m_index = value; }
    
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Fine granular Focus Management

This demo shows how to position the cursor in a cell directly.

At runtime a grid binding (FIXGRIDListBinding instance) is connected to its corresponding component representation - and can ask the component for its column/ cell configuration.
In the demo each cell component is holding corresponding reference information within the REFERENCE attribute - which is the base for positioning the cursor at the right place.

Consequence: in the example the column structure is completely managed within the layout (.jsp page) - the logical processing (.java) is not affected, if e.g. the column sequence is updated within the layout.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectAndEdit}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectAndEdit.grid}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="33%" >
<t:field id="g_5" reference="firstName" requestfocus=".{focusValues.firstName}" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="33%" >
<t:field id="g_7" reference="lastName" requestfocus=".{focusValues.lastName}" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Street" width="34%" >
<t:field id="g_9" reference="street" requestfocus=".{focusValues.street}" text=".{street}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Row Index" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_13" align="right" format="int" value="#{d.DemoGridSelectAndEdit.rowIndex}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Column Index" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_16" align="right" format="int" value="#{d.DemoGridSelectAndEdit.columnIndex}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="20" />
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridSelectAndEdit.onSelectAndFocus}" text="Select &amp; Focus" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.ColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.session.RequestFocusManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridSelectAndEdit}")

public class DemoGridSelectAndEdit
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Map<String,Long> i_focusValues = new HashMap<String,Long>();
        public Map<String,Long> getFocusValues() { return i_focusValues; }

        protected String m_street;
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }

        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    }
    
    public class Grid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>
    {
        @Override
        public void initialize()
        {
            super.initialize();
            // Set the initial selection and focus to "1,1".
            // This must not be done within the constructor of the grid - because then
            // the grid is not bound to its server side component yet
            m_columnIndex = 1;
            m_rowIndex = 1;
            selectAndFocus();
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    Grid m_grid = new Grid();
    int m_columnIndex = 0;
    int m_rowIndex = 0;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridSelectAndEdit(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public Grid getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public int getColumnIndex() { return m_columnIndex; }
    public void setColumnIndex(int columnIndex) { m_columnIndex = columnIndex; }

    public int getRowIndex() { return m_rowIndex; }
    public void setRowIndex(int rowIndex) { m_rowIndex = rowIndex; }
    
    public void onSelectAndFocus(ActionEvent event)
    {
        selectAndFocus();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void selectAndFocus()
    {
        try
        {
            // the "reference" attribute of the cell component contains the information
            // about the contained property
