            ColumnInfo ci = m_grid.getColumnInfos().get(m_columnIndex);
            BaseComponent bc = (BaseComponent)ci.getGridcontrolComponent();
            String reference = bc.getAttributeValueAsString("reference");
            m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
            GridItem gi = m_grid.getItems().get(m_rowIndex);
            m_grid.selectItem(gi);
            gi.getFocusValues().put(reference,RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter());
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError(t.toString());
        }
    }
    
}

Selection Roundtrips

Change data within the grids on the left and navigate through the grids (e.g. by cursor up/down): each grid will show different roundtrip behaviour.

By default each row selection inside a grid triggers a roundtrip to the server side. As consequence the server side application might update other data (e.g. the detail display of the selected item).

You can override this behaviour by using the attribute FIXGRID-AVOIDROUNDTRIPS:

When defining "1" then roundtrips are only triggered if the row that you just leave contains changed data.
When defining "2" then row selections in general do not cause any server side communication.

Typical usage scenarios: the default roundtrip behaviour is the one to be preferred when a selection of a row should take immediate effect for other parts of your layout. The "1" roundtrip behaviour is the one that is useful when maintaining data within the grid - then with leaving the grid row a corresponding communication to the sever is triggered, while normal grid navigations (up/down) do not trigger a roundtrip. The "2" is the one to be used when any type of processing is triggered from outside anyway (e.g. from a button).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_4" text="Roundtrip counter:  " />
<t:label id="g_5" stylevariant="ccbig" foreground="#800000" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.roundtripCounter}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" stylevariant="ccbig" text="(0) Every selection causes rountrip (default)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="hidden" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid1}" rowflusharea="true" rowheight="18" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" align="center" text="Revenue" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_11" align="right" format="int" value=".{revenue}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" align="center" text="Cost" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_13" align="right" format="int" value=".{cost}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridfooter id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" align="right" background="#00000018" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid1.revenueAll}" />
<t:label id="g_16" align="right" background="#00000018" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid1.costAll}" />
</t:gridfooter>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" stylevariant="ccbig" text="(1) Only roundtrip on change of row data" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_20" avoidroundtrips="1" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="hidden" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid2}" rowheight="18" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_21" align="center" text="Revenue" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_22" align="right" format="int" value=".{revenue}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" align="center" text="Cost" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_24" align="right" format="int" value=".{cost}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridfooter id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" align="right" background="#00000018" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid2.revenueAll}" />
<t:label id="g_27" align="right" background="#00000018" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid2.costAll}" />
</t:gridfooter>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" stylevariant="ccbig" text="(2) No roundtrip on selection" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_31" avoidroundtrips="2" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="hidden" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid3}" rowheight="18" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_32" align="center" text="Revenue" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_33" align="right" format="int" value=".{revenue}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_34" align="center" text="Cost" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_35" align="right" format="int" value=".{cost}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridfooter id="g_36" >
<t:label id="g_37" align="right" background="#00000018" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid3.revenueAll}" />
<t:label id="g_38" align="right" background="#00000018" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips.grid3.costAll}" />
</t:gridfooter>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:coldistance id="g_40" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_41" text="Explicit Rountrip" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips}")

public class DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        int m_revenue;
        public void setRevenue(int value) { m_revenue = value; }
        public int getRevenue() { return m_revenue; }
        int m_cost;
        public void setCost(int value) { m_cost = value; }
        public int getCost() { return m_cost; }
    }
    
    public class Grid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>
    {
        public int getRevenueAll()
        {
            int result = 0;
            for (GridItem gi: getItems())
                result += gi.getRevenue();
            return result;
        }
        public int getCostAll()
        {
            int result = 0;
            for (GridItem gi: getItems())
                result += gi.getCost();
            return result;
        }
    }
    
    int m_roundtripCounter;
    protected Grid m_grid1 = new Grid();
    protected Grid m_grid2 = new Grid();
    protected Grid m_grid3 = new Grid();
    
    public DemoGridAvoidRoundtrips(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<4; i++)
        {
            m_grid1.getItems().add(new GridItem());
            m_grid2.getItems().add(new GridItem());
            m_grid3.getItems().add(new GridItem());
        }
    }
    
    public Grid getGrid1() { return m_grid1; }
    public Grid getGrid2() { return m_grid2; }
    public Grid getGrid3() { return m_grid3; }
    
    public int getRoundtripCounter() 
    {
        m_roundtripCounter++;
        return m_roundtripCounter; 
    }

}

Info about selected Column

Every time a selection event is passed from the client to the server side, there is the information available on which column of the grid the selection was executed, too.

By using the column index and by using further API functions of the grid (please have a look into the code), you can obtain more information about the column that was hit.

Please note: the column index always refers to the sequence of GRIDCOL-definitions as defined in your JSP/XML definition. This means: it is independent from the user re-arranging the columns on his/her own.

And, please note: the default behaviour of the grid is, that once a row was selected the next selection is not passed to the server side. You can override this default behaviour by using the attribute FIXGRID-RESELECTABLE. If you want your user to select different columns, one after the other, within the same grid, you need to set FIXGRID-RESELECTABLE to "true".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColumnIndex}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridColumnIndex.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Grid..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColumnIndex.grid}" reselectable="true" sbvisibleamount="20" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="First Name" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_8" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Last Name" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_10" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Street" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_12" text=".{street}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Town" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_14" text=".{town}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" stylevariant="ccbig" foreground="#800000" text="Information about the selected Column" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Index" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_20" text="#{d.DemoGridColumnIndex.columnIndex}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Text" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_23" text="#{d.DemoGridColumnIndex.columnText}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="Reference" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_26" text="#{d.DemoGridColumnIndex.columnReference}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.IFIXGRIDColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridColumnIndex}")

public class DemoGridColumnIndex
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_town;
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
        public void setTown(String value) { m_town = value; }
        
        protected String m_street;
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        
        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection was registered: Row-Index " + m_grid.getItems().indexOf(this) + 
                                    "/ Column-Index " + m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection());
            IFIXGRIDColumnInfo colInfo = m_grid.getColumnInfos().get(m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection());
            m_columnText = colInfo.getText();
            m_columnReference = colInfo.getSortreference();
        }
        
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Execution was registered: Row-Index " + m_grid.getItems().indexOf(this) + 
                                    "/ Column-Index " + m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection());
            IFIXGRIDColumnInfo colInfo = m_grid.getColumnInfos().get(m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection());
            m_columnText = colInfo.getText();
            m_columnReference = colInfo.getSortreference();
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected String m_columnText;
    protected String m_columnReference;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridColumnIndex(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("FN "+i);
            gi.setLastName("LN "+i);
            gi.setStreet("ST "+i);
            gi.setTown("TO "+i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // methods
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public int getColumnIndex() { return m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection(); }
    public String getColumnText() { return m_columnText; }
    public String getColumnReference() { return m_columnReference; }
    
}

Selection en/disabling

The FIXGRID component provide an ENABLED attribute, too. If set to false, then the grid itself will not send any type of selection events (onRowSelect, onRowExecute) to the server side.

Please note, that the enabled-status of the grid has nothing to do with the enabled-status of its contained items!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWholeEnabled}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:checkbox id="g_3" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridWholeEnabled.wholeGridEnabled}" text="Grid enabled" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_5" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" enabled="#{d.DemoGridWholeEnabled.wholeGridEnabled}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWholeEnabled.grid}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" background="#FFFFFFC0" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_9" background="#FFFFFFC0" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:textarea id="g_11" enabled="false" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoGridWholeEnabled.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridWholeEnabled}")

public class DemoGridWholeEnabled extends PageBean
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        
        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            m_protocol += "Select processing on item: " + m_lastName + ", " + m_firstName + "\n";
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            m_protocol += "Execute processing on item: " + m_lastName + ", " + m_firstName + "\n";
        }
    }
    
    protected boolean m_wholeGridEnabled = true;
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected String m_protocol = "";
    
    public DemoGridWholeEnabled(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setLastName("LN " + i);
            gi.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }
    
    public boolean getWholeGridEnabled() { return m_wholeGridEnabled; }
    public void setWholeGridEnabled(boolean value) { m_wholeGridEnabled = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void setProtocol(String value) { m_protocol = value; }
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
}

Bgpaint coloring for selected Lines

You may explicitly and individually define the colors of the selected line(s) by using attribute SELECTIONCOLOR1 and SELCETIONCOLOR2.

Both colors are used to form a vertical gradient for the corresponding row.

It is recommended to use transparent color definitions (#rrggbbtt), so that the original coloring of the item still shines through.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectionBgpaint}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" background="#ffffff80" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSelectionBgpaint.grid}" sbvisibleamount="30" selectioncolor1="#FF000080" selectioncolor2="#00FF0080" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridSelectionBgpaint}")

public class DemoGridSelectionBgpaint
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
     public DemoGridSelectionBgpaint(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

     public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
}

Independent Application Marking

Select items of the grid by click/ shift-click/ ctrl-click. The behavior is:
1. every 5th item is not select-able
2. the selection is not changed when navigating with the keyboard.


By default the grid manages selection issues "on its own" - the grid row, which the user currently navigates to, is the one selected. - Sometimes this automatic selection does not fit to the corresponding scenario.

Examples:
1. you want the user to navigate (e.g. with the keyboard) through the grid items but you do not want to update the selection.
2. you want the user to navigate through all items, but you have certain items which are not "select-able" from application point of view. (In this example every 5th item is not "select-able")

Consequence: you leave the grid selection as it is - it highlights the item the user just navigates to. But: you define some own "marking" on item level: the marking comes with some background coloring of the item.
So the marking is some application-marking - and is decoupled from the current navigation status.

The grid provides the information if the user pressed ctrl or shift when navigating through the grid, so you can apply some corresponding multiple marking.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridMarking}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridMarking.grid}" sbvisibleamount="25" selectorcolumn="1" singleclickexecute="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Marked" width="50" >
<t:checkbox id="g_5" bgpaint=".{bgpaint}" enabled="false" selected=".{marked}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_7" background="#FFFFFF" bgpaint=".{bgpaint}" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" bgpaint=".{bgpaint}" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_9" background="#FFFFFF" bgpaint=".{bgpaint}" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_11" text="Selected Item" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:textarea id="g_13" height="100" text="#{d.DemoGridMarking.detail}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridMarking}")

/*
 * By default the grid manages selection isseus "on its own" - the grid row, which
 * the user currently navigates to, it the one selected. There is a corresponding
 * visual selection of the row. - Sometimes this automatic selection does not
 * fit to the corresponding scenario, esp. if you want to define some rows not to be
 * selectable: in this case you want the user still to navigate to this row (e.g.
 * with keyboard) but the navigation should not automatically be bound to an
 * "application selection" of the correspdongin row.
 * Consequence: you leave the grid selection as it is - it highlights the item
 * the user just navigates to. But: you define some own "marking" in item level:
 * the marking comes with some background coloring of the item.
 */
public class DemoGridMarking
    extends DemoPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        /*
         * Definition is marking is possible or not.
         */
        boolean m_markable = true;
        
        /*
         * Application marking.
         */
        boolean m_marked = false;
        public boolean isMarked() { return m_marked; }
        public void setMarked(boolean marked) 
        {
            if (m_markable == false) return;
            m_marked = marked; 
        }

        String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.m_lastName = value; }

        String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.m_firstName = value; }
        
        /*
         * The background painting of a row - following the marked-indicator.
         * And: the last selected item is marked a bit different to the previous
         * selected items. The BGPAINT attribute of the cell controls binds
         * to this value (e.g. LABEL-BGPAINT = ".{bgpaint}").
         */
        public String getBgpaint()
        {
            int myIndex = m_grid.getItems().indexOf(this);
            if (m_marked == true)
            {
                if (myIndex == m_firstShiftClickIndex && m_secondShiftClickIndex >= 0)
                    return "rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FF6600A0,#FF660070,vertical)";
                else
                    return "rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FF660060,#FF660030,vertical)";
            }
            else
                return null;
        }
        
        @Override
        /*
         * This is the normal selection - representing the current navigation
         * of the user. No marking is done here.
         */
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        
        @Override
        /*
         * The grid is used in the mode FIXGRID-SINGLECICKEXECUTE. It is executed
         * when the user (single-)clicks into one row or when the user presses the
         * return key within one row. It is NOT executed when the user navigates
         * with the keyboard up/down.
         */
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            int myIndex = m_grid.getItems().indexOf(this);
            if (m_grid.getShiftPressedOfLastSelection() == true)
            {
                // shift clicked
                if (m_firstShiftClickIndex >= 0)
                {
                    if (m_secondShiftClickIndex >= 0)
                        applyFromToMarked(m_firstShiftClickIndex,m_secondShiftClickIndex,false);
                    m_secondShiftClickIndex = myIndex;
                    applyFromToMarked(m_firstShiftClickIndex,m_secondShiftClickIndex,true);
                }
                else
                {
                    m_firstShiftClickIndex = myIndex;
                }
            }
            else if (m_grid.getCtrlPressedOfLastSelection())
            {
                // ctrl clicked
                applyOneMarked(this);
            }
            else
            {
                // "default"
                applyOnlyOneMarked(this);
            }
        }
        
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    int m_firstShiftClickIndex = -1;
    int m_secondShiftClickIndex = -1;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridMarking(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        // fill grid - every 5th item is not markable
        for (int i=0; i<300; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            if (i%5 == 0)
                gi.m_markable = false;
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /*
     * Detail information for the bottom textarea of the screen - summary
     * of all marked items
     */
    public String getDetail()
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            if (gi.isMarked() == true)
            {
                sb.append(gi.getLastName() + ", " + gi.getFirstName() + "\n");
            }
        }
        return sb.toString();
    }
    
    private void applyOneMarked(GridItem gi)
    {
        gi.setMarked(!gi.m_marked);
    }
    
    private void applyOnlyOneMarked(FIXGRIDItem item)
    {
        m_firstShiftClickIndex = -1;
        m_secondShiftClickIndex = -1;
        int index = 0;
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            if (gi == item)
            {
                gi.setMarked(true);
                m_firstShiftClickIndex = index;
            }
            else
            {
                gi.setMarked(false);
            }
            index++;
        }
    }
    
    private void applyFromToMarked(int index1, int index2, boolean marked)
    {
        int from = index1;
        int to = index2;
        if (from > to)
        {
            to = index1;
            from = index2;
        }
        for (int i=from; i<=to; i++)
        {
            m_grid.getItems().get(i).setMarked(marked);
        }
    }
}

Avoid selection of certain lines

All items containing a "3" or a "5" in the last name are not select-able.

Take a look into the code of the "onRowSelect" implementation of the Java class.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridAvoidSelection}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAvoidSelection}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridAvoidSelection.grid}" sbvisibleamount="35" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" text="Last name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_6" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="First name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoGridAvoidSelection.summary}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_11" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridAvoidSelection}")

public class DemoGridAvoidSelection
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }

        String i_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }

        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            if (i_firstName.contains("3") || i_firstName.contains("5"))
            {
                m_grid.deselectItem(this);
            }
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridAvoidSelection(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);       
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridavoidselection.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridAvoidSelection}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public String getSummary() 
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            if (m_grid.getSelectedItems().contains(gi))
            {
                if (sb.length() > 0)
                    sb.append(", ");
                sb.append(gi.i_lastName);
            }
        }
        return sb.toString();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Sorting

Column sorting

Click onto the column headers - the content will be sorted.

The grid processing provides a default framework for sorting. You normally just have to specify the SORTREFERENCE on GRIDCOL level - the grid will automatically provide the function to sort the contained rows by the referenced property, once the user clicks onto the title column. The automatic sorting is "data-type-aware", i.e. Strings are sorted in a different way than integer numbers.

You can also embed your own sorting. To do so you need to override the FIXGRIDListBinding class and override the method "sortGrid(...)". In the example the second grid has an explicitly overriden sort algorithm.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSort}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Grid with implicit sorting:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_5" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSort.rows}" sbvisibleamount="8" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_6" sortreference="firstName" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" sortreference="lastName" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_9" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" sortreference="birthdate" text="Birth Date" width="100" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_11" format="date" value=".{birthdate}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Grid with explicit sorting:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_16" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridSort.rows2}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="200" >
<t:gridcol id="g_17" sortreference="value" text="First Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_18" text=".{value}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridSort}")

public class DemoGridSort
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // top grid
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected Date m_birthdate;
        public Date getBirthdate() { return m_birthdate; }
        public void setBirthdate(Date value) { m_birthdate = value; }

        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // bottom grid with explicit sorting ==> override method sortGrid
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow2 extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        int m_intValue;
        
        protected String m_value;
        public String getValue() { return m_value; }
        public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }
    }

    public class MyRow2ListBinding extends FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow2>
    {
        @Override
        protected void sortGrid(String sortReference,
                                String objectBindingString, 
                                boolean ascending)
        {
            System.out.println("Sort called: " + sortReference + ", direction " + ascending);
            // sort "value" by integer, but by text; use the most
            // sophisticated algorithm for sorting: bubble sort ;-)
            while (true)
            {
                boolean updatedSequence = false;
                for (int i=0; i<m_rows2.getItems().size()-1; i++)
                {
                    if (ascending && m_rows2.getItems().get(i).m_intValue > m_rows2.getItems().get(i+1).m_intValue ||
                        !ascending && m_rows2.getItems().get(i).m_intValue < m_rows2.getItems().get(i+1).m_intValue)
                    {
                        updatedSequence = true;
                        MyRow2 temp = m_rows2.getItems().get(i);
                        m_rows2.getItems().set(i,m_rows2.getItems().get(i+1));
                        m_rows2.getItems().set(i+1,temp);
                    }
                }
                if (updatedSequence == false)
                    break;
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructor ==> creation of items
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridSort(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        int maxi = 100;
        for (int i=0; i<maxi; i++)
        {
            // firs grid
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setFirstName("First Name " + i);
            r.setLastName("Last Name " + (maxi-i-1));
            Calendar c = Calendar.getInstance();
            c.set(Calendar.YEAR,1970);
            c.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR,i * 3);
            r.setBirthdate(c.getTime());
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
            // second grid
            MyRow2 r2 = new MyRow2();
            r2.setValue("Value " + i);
            r2.m_intValue = i;
            m_rows2.getItems().add(r2);
        }
    }
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    protected MyRow2ListBinding m_rows2 = new MyRow2ListBinding();
    public MyRow2ListBinding getRows2() { return m_rows2; }

}

Initial sorting

You can use the grid's sorting functions from your server side managed bean, too.

The simplest way is to sort by one column only and to pass the sort information directly using the "sort(...)" method.

You may also pass a sort which considers multiple columns by passing corresponding FIXGRIDSortInfo-instances and by calling the "resort()" method afterwards.

Also at later point of time you may always call the resort() method to re-apply the current sorting of the grid - e.g. after having added new items.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridInitialSort}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" avoidroundtrips="true" background="#F0F0F0" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridInitialSort.grid}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" sortreference=".{firstName}" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_6" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_7" sortreference=".{lastName}" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_8" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" sortreference=".{married}" text="Married" width="50" >
<t:checkbox id="g_10" align="center" background="#FFFFFF" selected=".{married}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" width="80" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener=".{onRemove}" contentareafilled="false" text="Remove" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridInitialSort.onAddRow}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add row" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridInitialSort.onExplicitlySort}" text="Sort by Last Name / First Name" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridInitialSort.onExplicitlySort2}" text="Sort by Last Name (desc.)" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridInitialSort extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        boolean i_married;
        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
        public void setFirstName(String value) { i_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { i_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setMarried(boolean value) { i_married = value; }
        public boolean getMarried() { return i_married; }
        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
        public void onRemove(ActionEvent ae)
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridInitialSort(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        fillGridWithData();
        sortGridByLastNameFirstName();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void onAddRow(ActionEvent ae)    
    {
        GridItem row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("new");
        row.setLastName("new");
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
    }
    
    public void onExplicitlySort(ActionEvent ae)    
    {
        sortGridByLastNameFirstName();
    }
    
    public void onExplicitlySort2(ActionEvent ae)    
    {
        sortGridByLastNameDescending();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void sortGridByLastNameDescending()
    {
        // simple sort by one column
        m_grid.sort("lastName",false);
    }

    private void sortGridByLastNameFirstName()
    {
//        // sort by two columns - low level API
//        m_grid.getSortInfo().clear();
//        FIXGRIDSortInfo fsi;
//        fsi = m_grid.getSortInfoForReference("lastName");
//        fsi.setSortSequence(0);
//        fsi.setSortStatus(FIXGRIDListBinding.SORT_ASCENDING);
//        fsi = m_grid.getSortInfoForReference("firstName");
//        fsi.setSortSequence(1);
//        fsi.setSortStatus(FIXGRIDListBinding.SORT_ASCENDING);
//        m_grid.resort();
        // sort by two columns - high level API
        m_grid.sort
        (
            new String[] {"lastName","firstName"},
            new boolean[] {true,false}
        );
    }
    
    private void fillGridWithData()
    { 
        GridItem row;
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Michael");
        row.setLastName("Schumacher");
        row.setMarried(true);
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Alain");
        row.setLastName("Prost");
        row.setMarried(true);
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Niki");
        row.setLastName("Lauda");
        row.setMarried(true);
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Nik");
        row.setLastName("Heidfeld");
        row.setMarried(false);
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Ralf");
        row.setLastName("Schumacher");
        row.setMarried(true);
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
    }
}

Tree Sorting

By default the tree-sorting strictly sorts the contained items by their content (e.g. by their text in case of sorting on the TREENODE column).

But: by setting property FIXGRIDTREEBinding.setFoldersAlwaysSortedToTop(...) you can enforce that folder nodes are always sorted to the top.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeFolderSorting}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Sort folders always to top" width="150" />
<t:checkbox id="g_4" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoTreeFolderSorting.tree.foldersAlwaysSortedToTop}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" font="size:10" text="(Sort the tree by pressing the column header.)" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" background="#ffffff" bordercolor="#00000010" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeFolderSorting.tree}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Text" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_11" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeFolderSorting}")

public class DemoTreeFolderSorting
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        
    }

    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();
    static String[] TEXTS = new String[] {"A","B","C","D","E"};

    public DemoTreeFolderSorting(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<TEXTS.length; i++)
        {
            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            top.setText(TEXTS[i]);
            if (i%2 == 0)
            {
                top.setStatus(FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_CLOSED);
                for (int j=0; j<TEXTS.length; j++)
                {
                    TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
                    sub.setText(TEXTS[j]);
                    if (j%2 == 0)
                    {
                        sub.setStatus(FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_CLOSED);
                        for (int k=0; k<TEXTS.length; k++)
                        {
                            TreeNode subsub = new TreeNode(sub);
                            subsub.setText(TEXTS[j]);
                            subsub.setStatus(FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                        }
                    }
                    else
                    {
                        sub.setStatus(FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                    }
                }
            }
            else
            {
                top.setStatus(FIXGRIDTreeItem.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
    }

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }
}

Triple state sorting

By default, clicking into the column header of a grid will first sort the content in an ascending direction, then in a descending direction and then again into ascending direction.

But: the grid also supports a "triple state" sorting. Here the sequence is: ascending, descending and then back to the original sequence.

There are two issues you have to follow:

1. set FIXGRID-TRIPLESORT to "true"
2. on Java side you need to tell what the original sequence of the grid items is. This is done by keeping an "originalIndex" in each grid item.

The "originalIndex" can be set by calling the method "applyOriginalIndexToCurrentContent" - in this case the items of the grid are indexed with their current order.

Please make sure: in case of updating the grid (e.g. adding or removing items), you need to re-apply the index again. Otherwise new items will be treated with a default index of "-1".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridTripleSort}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridTripleSort}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:checkbox id="g_7" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridTripleSort.tripleState}" text="Triple state sorting" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textpane id="g_9" text="Click into the column header for sorting. Dependent on the definition of &#34;Triple state sorting&#34; the sorting will either toggle between &#34;asending&#34;/&#34;descending&#34; or between &#34;ascending&#34;/&#34;descending&#34;/&#34;original order&#34;." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_2" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridTripleSort.grid}" triplesort="#{d.DemoGridTripleSort.tripleState}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_3" text="Value 1" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{value1}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Value 2" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{value2}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Value 3" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{value3}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridTripleSort}")

public class DemoGridTripleSort
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_value1;
        String i_value2;
        String i_value3;
        public String getValue3() { return i_value3; }
        public void setValue3(String value) { this.i_value3 = value; }
        public String getValue2() { return i_value2; }
        public void setValue2(String value) { this.i_value2 = value; }
        public String getValue1() { return i_value1; }
        public void setValue1(String value) { this.i_value1 = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    boolean m_tripleState = true;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridTripleSort(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        fillGrid();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridtriplesort.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridTripleSort}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public boolean getTripleState() { return m_tripleState; }
    public void setTripleState(boolean value) { this.m_tripleState = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setValue1("Value " + makeTwoDigitString((i+7)%8));
            gi.setValue2("Value " + makeTwoDigitString((i+3)%5));
            gi.setValue3("Value " + makeTwoDigitString((i+22)%50));
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
        m_grid.applyOriginalIndexToCurrentContent();
    }
    
    private String makeTwoDigitString(int i)
    {
        String s = ""+i;
        if (s.length() == 1)
            return "0"+s;
        else
            return s;
    }
}

Explicit sort- and export-value for column

Take a look into the definition of the last column: it is not sorted by its "value" but by its "sortValue". And if you call one of the export functions, then not the "value" is exported but the "exportValue".

A grid cell value is primarily referenced by the corresponding component inside the grid. But it is also used by default for sorting the grid and for exporting the grid.

There are situations in which you want to sort the grid by some different value - and there are situations in which you want to export some different value for the corresponding column.

An GRIDCOL component level there are two attributes to control this:

1. SORTREFERENCE
2. EXPORTREFERENCE

An EXPORTREFERENCE only needs to be defined if is different to the SORTREFERENCE.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridColValueMgmt}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColValueMgmt}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridColValueMgmt.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColValueMgmt.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Value" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{value}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Sort value" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{sortValue}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Export" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{exportValue}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" background="#FFC000" exportreference=".{exportValue}" sortreference=".{sortValue}" text="Combined" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_15" text=".{value}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.ColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.READTYPE;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridColValueMgmt}")

public class DemoGridColValueMgmt
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_exportValue;
        int i_sortValue;
        String i_value;
        public String getExportValue() { return i_exportValue; }
        public void setExportValue(String value) { this.i_exportValue = value; }
        public int getSortValue() { return i_sortValue; }
        public void setSortValue(int value) { this.i_sortValue = value; }
        public String getValue() { return i_value; }
        public void setValue(String value) { this.i_value = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    String m_protocol = "";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridColValueMgmt(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        fillGrid();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridcolvaluemgmt.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridColValueMgmt}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }

    public void onOutputTextAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        List<ColumnInfo> cols = m_grid.getVisibleColumns();
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            int counter = 0;
            for (ColumnInfo col: cols)
            {
                if (counter != 0) sb.append(", ");
                String cv = m_grid.getItemColumnClientStringValue(gi,col,READTYPE.EXPORT);
                sb.append(cv);
                counter++;
            }
            sb.append("\n");
        }
        m_protocol = sb.toString();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setValue(""+i);
            gi.setSortValue(i);
            gi.setExportValue("EXP "  + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

}

Drag & Drop

Grid Drag Drop

Drag & drop items from the left to the right, and vice versa. When dropping onto an item you will see that the dropped item is either positioned in front of or behind - dependent from the vertical position where you dropped.

This example shows the simplest way to implement Drag & Drop for grids. The FIXGRID component provides DRAGSEND and DROPRECEIVE attributes - these are the ones which are valid for the whole grid, e.g. when the user drags/drops from/to an empty area of the grid which is not covered by a row.

And the grid provides for a ROWDRAGSEND and ROWDROPRECEIVE attribute, these are the ones that are located on item level - so that you can drop information onto individual items.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" font="size:17" text="Stock Items 1" width="50%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_5" font="size:17" text="Stock Items 2" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" dragsend="grid1:grid1" dropreceive="grid2" enabled="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid1Enabled}" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.stockItems1}" rowdragsend="grid1:grid1" rowdropreceive="grid2:verticalsplit" sbvisibleamount="20" width="50%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="ArticleId" width="60" >
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{articleId}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Article Text" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{articleText}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="20" />
<t:fixgrid id="g_13" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" dragsend="grid2:grid2" dropreceive="grid1" enabled="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid2Enabled}" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.stockItems2}" rowdragsend="grid2:grid2" rowdropreceive="grid1:verticalsplit" sbvisibleamount="20" width="50%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="ArticleId" width="60" >
<t:label id="g_15" text=".{articleId}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Article Text" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{articleText}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:checkbox id="g_19" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid1Enabled}" text="Enabled" width="50%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="20" />
<t:checkbox id="g_21" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid2Enabled}" text="Enabled" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Collection;
import java.util.Set;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop}")

public class DemoGridDragDrop
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected boolean m_grid2Enabled = true;
    public boolean getGrid2Enabled() { return m_grid2Enabled; }
    public void setGrid2Enabled(boolean value) { m_grid2Enabled = value; }

    protected boolean m_grid1Enabled = true;
    public boolean getGrid1Enabled() { return m_grid1Enabled; }
    public void setGrid1Enabled(boolean value) { m_grid1Enabled = value; }

    public class StockItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_articleText;
        public String getArticleText() { return m_articleText; }
        public void setArticleText(String value) { m_articleText = value; }

        protected String m_articleId;
        public String getArticleId() { return m_articleId; }
        public void setArticleId(String value) { m_articleId = value; }

        @Override
        public void onRowDrop(BaseActionEventDrop event)
        {
            String dragSend = event.getDragInfo(); 
            // drag & drop on item level ==> move dropped item at right position!
            boolean inFront = true;
            if (event.getPercentageVertical() >= 50)
                inFront = false;
            if (dragSend.startsWith("grid1:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems1,m_stockItems2,m_stockItems2.getItems().indexOf(this),inFront);
            else if (dragSend.startsWith("grid2:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems2,m_stockItems1,m_stockItems1.getItems().indexOf(this),inFront);
        }
    }
    
    public class StockItemGrid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<StockItem>
    {
        @Override
        protected void onDrop(BaseActionEventDrop dropEvent)
        {
            String dragsend = dropEvent.getDragInfo();
            if (dragsend.startsWith("grid1:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems1,m_stockItems2,-1,true);
            else if (dragsend.startsWith("grid2:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems2,m_stockItems1,-1,true);
        }
    }
    
    
    
    public DemoGridDragDrop(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("fixgrid");
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            StockItem si = new StockItem();
            si.setArticleId("4711"+i);
            si.setArticleText("Text for " + i);
            m_stockItems1.getItems().add(si);
            si = new StockItem();
            si.setArticleId("0815"+i);
            si.setArticleText("Text for " + i);
            m_stockItems2.getItems().add(si);
        }
    }

    protected StockItemGrid m_stockItems2 = new StockItemGrid();
    public StockItemGrid getStockItems2() { return m_stockItems2; }
    
    protected StockItemGrid m_stockItems1 = new StockItemGrid();
    public StockItemGrid getStockItems1() { return m_stockItems1; }

    private void moveItemsBetweenGrids(StockItemGrid gridFrom, 
                                       StockItemGrid gridTo, 
                                       int toIndex,
                                       boolean inFront)
    {
        if (inFront == false)
            toIndex++;
        Collection<StockItem> sis = gridFrom.getSelectedItemsAsSequence();
        for (StockItem si: sis)
        {
            if (toIndex >= 0)
            {
                gridTo.getItems().add(toIndex,si);
                toIndex++;
            }
            else
            {
                gridTo.getItems().add(si);
            }
            gridFrom.getItems().remove(si);
        }
    }
    
}

Single Selection Grid

Drag and drop is available on most of the components.

In the example you can drag items from the list on the left and drop them onto the corresponding top element on the right. Drop operations are only possible if the nature of the item on the left fits to the nature of the item on the right.

What's the principle behind?

The objects on the left specify their DRAGSEND attribute by expressing what they represent. The expression is done in the way "<type>:<id>", for example: "car:Ford". (It is also possible that one object is expressing more representations, then you concatenate the definitions: "<type>:<id>;<type>:<id>;<type>:<id>").

The components on the right specify their DROPRECEIVE attribtues by expressing what types they are able to process. Example the car node on the right has the DROPRECEIVE attribute "car". A component can process multiple types by concatenating these types: "<type>;<type>;<type>".

When the user drops a component onto the other component then the receiving component gets passed the DRAGSEND information of the dragged component into the corresponding action listener. It can parse this information and react accordingly.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoDragDrop}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" background="#FFFFFF" bordercolor="#D0D0D0" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.demoDragDrop.leftRows}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="50%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" background="#C0C0C0" text="Image" width="22" >
<t:image id="g_5" dragsend=".{draginfo}" image=".{image}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" background="#C0C0C0" text="Objects" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_7" dragsend=".{draginfo}" text=".{text}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="5" />
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" background="#FFFFFF" bordercolor="#D0D0D0" dropreceive="person;car;computer" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.demoDragDrop.rightRows}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="50%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Sorted Objects" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_11" dropreceive=".{dropReceive}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Text Area" width="120" />
<t:textarea id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDrop.onTextAreaAction}" dropreceive="person;car;computer" height="50" text="#{d.DemoDragDrop.textAreaContent}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Combo Field" width="120" />
<t:combofield id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDrop.onTextAreaAction}" dropreceive="person;car;computer" text="#{d.DemoDragDrop.textAreaContent}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Editable Combobox" width="120" />
<t:combobox id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDrop.onTextAreaAction}" dropreceive="person;car;computer" editable="true" value="#{d.DemoDragDrop.textAreaContent}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDropCopy;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoDragDrop extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class LeftRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        public LeftRow(String text, String type)
        {
            m_text = text;
            m_draginfo = type+":"+text;
            m_type = type;
        }
        String m_text;
        String m_draginfo;
        String m_type;
        public void setText(String value) { m_text = value; }
        public String getText() { return m_text; }
        public void setDraginfo(String value) { m_draginfo = value; }
        public String getDraginfo() { return m_draginfo; }
        public String getImage() { return "../images/icons/"+m_type+".png"; }
    }
    
    /**
     * Overridden FIXGRIDTreeBinding with specialized drop management
     * in onGridAction().
     */
    public class MyRightGrid extends FIXGRIDTreeBinding<RightRow>
    {
        public void onGridAction(ActionEvent event)
        {
            super.onGridAction(event);
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Event was processed: " + event.getClass().getName());
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop || 
                event instanceof BaseActionEventDropCopy) 
            {
                String droppedValue = ((BaseActionEventDrop)event).getDragInfo();
                if (droppedValue.startsWith("car:")) m_carTop.processTREENDOEAction(event);
                else if (droppedValue.startsWith("person:")) m_personTop.processTREENDOEAction(event);
                else if (droppedValue.startsWith("computer:")) m_computerTop.processTREENDOEAction(event);
            }
            BaseActionEvent bae = (BaseActionEvent)event;
        }
    }
    
    
    public class RightRow extends FIXGRIDTreeItem
    {
        String m_dropReceive;
        String m_type;
        public RightRow(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode, String text, String dropReceive, String type)
        {
            super(parentNode);
            setText(text);
            m_dropReceive = dropReceive;
            m_type = type;
        }
        public String getDropReceive() { return m_dropReceive; }
        public void processTREENDOEAction(ActionEvent event)
        {
            super.processTREENDOEAction(event);
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
            {
                BaseActionEventDrop bae = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
                int index = bae.getParams()[0].indexOf(':');
                String value = bae.getParams()[0].substring(index+1);
                RightRow rr = new RightRow(this,value,null,m_type);
                rr.setStatus(rr.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                // remove from left 
                for (int i=0; i<m_leftRows.getItems().size(); i++)
                {
                    if (m_leftRows.getItems().get(i).getText().equals(value))
                    {
                        m_leftRows.getItems().remove(i);
                        break;
                    }
                }
            }
            else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDropCopy)
            {
                BaseActionEventDrop bae = (BaseActionEventDropCopy)event;
                int index = bae.getParams()[0].indexOf(':');
                String value = bae.getParams()[0].substring(index+1);
                RightRow rr = new RightRow(this,value,null,m_type);
                rr.setStatus(rr.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
        public String getImage() { return "../images/icons/"+m_type+".png"; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<LeftRow> m_leftRows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<LeftRow>();
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<RightRow> m_rightRows = new MyRightGrid();
    RightRow m_carTop;
    RightRow m_personTop;
    RightRow m_computerTop;
    
    String m_textAreaContent = "";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoDragDrop(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // left side
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Harry","person"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Ford","car"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Laptop","computer"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Desktop Computer","computer"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Audi","car"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Mercedes","car"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Claude","person"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Toyota","car"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Host","computer"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Joan","person"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Chrysler","car"));
        m_leftRows.getItems().add(new LeftRow("Volkswagen","car"));
        // right side
        m_personTop = new RightRow(m_rightRows.getRootNode(),"Persons","person","person");
        m_carTop = new RightRow(m_rightRows.getRootNode(),"Cars","car","car");
        m_computerTop = new RightRow(m_rightRows.getRootNode(),"Computers","computer","computer");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<LeftRow> getLeftRows() { return m_leftRows; }
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<RightRow> getRightRows() { return m_rightRows; }
    
    public void setTextAreaContent(String value) { m_textAreaContent = value; }
    public String getTextAreaContent() { return m_textAreaContent; }
    
    public void onTextAreaAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            BaseActionEventDrop baed = (BaseActionEventDrop)ae;
            m_textAreaContent = "Dropped Info: " + baed.getDragInfo();
        }
    }
    
}

Multi Selection Grid

This example shows how to drag & drop multiple items from the grid into the text area below.

The drag-send information is not statically defined with a grid row, but is updated with every selection. The drag info is a string starting with "indices:" and then following a semicolon separated list of values.
