The drag-send-string itself is built in the way "type:value;type:value" - this is the reason why the semicolon separated must be properly built using the functions of the ValueManager helper class.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragMulti}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
  <t:row id="g_3" >
    <t:fixgrid id="g_4" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragMulti.rows}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
      <t:gridcol id="g_5" text="Name" width="100%" >
        <t:field id="g_6" dragsend="#{d.DemoDragMulti.dragSend}" text=".{name}" />
      </t:gridcol>
      <t:gridcol id="g_7" text="Drag Send" width="150" >
        <t:field id="g_8" dragsend="#{d.DemoDragMulti.dragSend}" text="#{d.DemoDragMulti.dragSend}" />
      </t:gridcol>
    </t:fixgrid>
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
  <t:row id="g_10" >
    <t:label id="g_11" text="Selected Names" width="120" />
    <t:textarea id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragMulti.onDropAction}" dropreceive="indices" height="100" text="#{d.DemoDragMulti.selectedNames}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="10" />
  <t:row id="g_14" >
    <t:label id="g_15" text="Drop String" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_16" dropreceive="indices" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoDragMulti.droppedValue}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDragMulti}")

public class DemoDragMulti
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_name;
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }
    }

    protected String m_selectedNames;
    public String getSelectedNames() { return m_selectedNames; }
    public void setSelectedNames(String value) { m_selectedNames = value; }

    protected String m_droppedValue;
    public String getDroppedValue() { return m_droppedValue; }
    public void setDroppedValue(String value) { m_droppedValue = value; }

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    public void setRows(FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> value) { m_rows = value; }
    
    public DemoDragMulti(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setName("NAME"+i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
    }
    
    public void onDropAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            m_droppedValue = ((BaseActionEventDrop)event).getDragInfo();
            String indicesCSV = m_droppedValue.substring("indices:".length());
            String[] indices = ValueManager.decodeCSV(indicesCSV);
            StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer("Selected Names:\n");
            for (int i=0; i<indices.length; i++)
            {
                int index = (new Integer(indices[i])).intValue();
                sb.append(m_rows.getItems().get(index).getName());
                sb.append("\n");
            }
            m_selectedNames = sb.toString();
        }
    }

    /**
     * Returns a comma separated list of all selected lines.
     */
    public String getDragSend()
    {
        List<String> indices = new ArrayList<String>();
        for (int i=0; i<m_rows.getItems().size(); i++)
        {
            MyRow r = m_rows.getItems().get(i);
            if (r.getSelected() == true)
                indices.add(""+i);
        }
        String indicesString = ValueManager.encodeCSV(indices); // forms 1;2;3
        String encodedString = ValueManager.encodeCSV(new String[] {indicesString});
        String result = "indices:"+encodedString;
        return result;
    }

}

Load on Demand (1)

Nothing special with this grid - from visual point of view...! But have look onto the way the grid is filled on server side:

The grid is loaded with 1000 items. The items themselves are not read when filling the grid in the constructor, but the items are read step by step, following the user's navigation within the grid.

In the constructor of the server side bean 1000 "null items" are filled into the grid. Every time the user scrolls through the grid then the method "getRows()" is called on server side. This method returns the visual part of the grid that is sent to the client. The grid's "sbvalue" property tells you about the current scroll position of the user.

By overriding the method you can check if all items that the user wants to see are available. When missing items are detected they are picked from the logic.

Pay attention: the user may scroll through the list of items in "wild ways". You must not expect the user to scroll step by step from the top to the bottom of the list, so that you can fill the item list in an ordered way. You must expect the user to "randomly access" the grid's items.

By the way: getSbvalue() gives you the current scroll position, getSbvisibleamount() gives you the number of grid items that are displayed on client side as maximum and getClientvisibleamount() gives you the number of actually rendered items within the client.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridloadondemand}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" avoidroundtrips="true" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridloadondemand.grid}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridloadondemand.onScrollToTop}" text="Scroll to Top" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridloadondemand.onScrollToEnd}" text="Scroll to Bottom" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.FIXGRIDPivotListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridloadondemand extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    }
    
    public class MyGrid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>
    {
//        *** Old, still valid way of load on demand - overriding the getRows() method        
//        *** Disadvantage: in getRows() you must not change the size of the item list (getItems()).
//        @Override
//        public List<MyRow> getRows()
//        {
//            List<MyRow> result = super.getRows();
//            // check if all items are read
//            boolean foundNullItem = false;
//            for (int i=0; i<result.size(); i++)
//            {
//                if (result.get(i) == null)
//                {
//                    foundNullItem = true;
//                    readItem(getSbvalue()+i);
//                }
//            }
//            if (foundNullItem == false)
//                return result;
//            else
//                return super.getRows();
//        }

        // *** "New" way of load on demand: executing load on demand when grid rendering starts.
        @Override
        public void renderingBegins()
        {
            super.renderingBegins();
            List<MyRow> result = super.getRows();
            // check if all items that are transferred to the client are read
            for (int i=0; i<result.size(); i++)
            {
                if (result.get(i) == null)
                    readItem(getSbvalue()+i);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    MyGrid m_grid = new MyGrid();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridloadondemand(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initializeGridWithNullItems();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public void onScrollToTop(ActionEvent event)
    {
        int newSbValue = 0;
        m_grid.setSbvalue(newSbValue);
    }
    
    public void onScrollToEnd(ActionEvent event)
    {
        int newSbValue = m_grid.getItems().size() - m_grid.getClientvisibleamount();
        m_grid.setSbvalue(newSbValue);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initializeGridWithNullItems()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<1000; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(null);
    }
    
    private void readItem(int index)
    {
        MyRow row = new MyRow();
        row.m_firstName = "First Name " + index;
        row.m_lastName = "Last Name " + index;
        m_grid.getItems().set(index,row);
    }

}

Load on Demand (2)

This example shows how to scroll through a list with potencially infinite length (it is limited to 250 in this example).

The total grid increases its size automatically always checking that there is some "down-scroll" possibility until all items are loaded. On client side the effect of course is, that the scroll bar gets smaller and smaller because the total number of grid items is increased.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridloadondemand2}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" avoidroundtrips="true" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridloadondemand2.grid}" sbvisibleamount="20" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridloadondemand2 extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    }
    
    public class MyGrid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>
    {
        @Override
        public void renderingBegins()
        {
            super.renderingBegins();
            // ensure that always sbvalue+2*sbvisibleamount items are loaded
            int loadToIndex = getSbvalue() + 2 * getSbvisibleamount();
            if (loadToIndex > 250)
                loadToIndex = 250;
            for (int index=getItems().size(); index <= loadToIndex; index++)
            {
                getItems().add(readItem(index));
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    MyGrid m_grid = new MyGrid();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridloadondemand2(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initializeGridWithNullItems()
    {
    }
    
    private MyRow readItem(int index)
    {
        MyRow row = new MyRow();
        row.m_firstName = "First Name " + index;
        row.m_lastName = "Last Name " + index;
        return row;
    }

}

Default Grid Popups

The server side grid representation (FIXGRIDListBinding, FIXGRIDTreeBinding) provides default methods that can be directly used e.g. by LINK or BUTTON components.

The default functions open some popup in which the user can...

1. Search & export content
2. Export content
3. Explicitly rearrange columns

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDefaultPopups}">
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridDefaultPopups.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Search&amp;export..." />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridDefaultPopups.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
<t:link id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridDefaultPopups.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_8" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDefaultPopups.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="First name" width="50%;100" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Last name" width="50%;100" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDefaultPopups}")

public class DemoGridDefaultPopups
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }

        String i_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }

        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridDefaultPopups(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogriddefaultpopups.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridDefaultPopups}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Dynamic Columns

Dynamic Grid - Grid level

This example shows a grid that is dynamically created at server side.

The easiest way that you can use for defining dymamic areas within your screen is to use the ROWDYNAMICCONTENT component - that allows to define the XML layout definition to be places inside dynamically. In the example the dynamic layout definition contains a corresponding grid definition.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDyn}">
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_2" contentbinding="#{d.DemoGridDyn.dynRow}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIXGRIDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDyn}")

public class DemoGridDyn
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String[] m_colValues;
        public void setColValues(String[] value) { m_colValues = value; }
        public String[] getColValues() { return m_colValues; }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private String[] m_columns = new String[] {"firstName", "lastName", "street"};

    private ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynRow = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    private FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------



    public DemoGridDyn(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        buildGrid();
        buildData();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynRow() { return m_dynRow; }
    public void setDynRow(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding value) { m_dynRow = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void buildData()
    {
        m_rows.getItems().clear();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            String[] values = new String[m_columns.length];
            for (int j=0; j<m_columns.length; j++)
                values[j] = "VALUE " + i + "/" + j;
            r.setColValues(values);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
    }

    private void buildGrid()
    {
        FIXGRIDNode f = new FIXGRIDNode()
                .setObjectbinding(pbx("rows"))
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setHeight("100%")
                .setSbvisibleamount(35);
        int colCounter = 0;
        for (String column: m_columns)
        {
            GRIDCOLNode gc = new GRIDCOLNode()
                    .setText(column)
                    .setWidth(100);
            f.addSubNode(gc);
            FIELDNode fi = new FIELDNode()
                    .setText(".{colValues[\""+colCounter+"\"]}");
            colCounter++;
            gc.addSubNode(fi);
        }
        m_dynRow.setContentNode(f);
    }

}

Dynamic Grid - Column level

You may place a DYNAMICCONTENT component into the FIXGRID - and as result render all or some columns dynamically.

In the example the number of columns can be set, after pressing the button "Render" the grid is updated accordingly.

The dynamically created columns access a map "data" which is available on item level.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_6" format="int" labeltext="Number of dynamic columns" value="#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns.numberOfColumns}" width="250" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns.onRenderAction}" text="Render columns" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_2" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_3" text="Fix column 1" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{text1}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_9" contentbinding="#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns.dymColumns1}" />
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Fix column 2" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{text2}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns}")

public class DemoGridDynContentColumns
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_text1;
        String i_text2;
        Map<String,String> m_data = new HashMap<String,String>();
        public GridItem()
        {
            Random r = new Random();
            for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
                m_data.put("dyn"+i,"Dyn " + i + "/" + r.nextInt(100));
        }
        public String getText1() { return i_text1; }
        public void setText1(String value) { this.i_text1 = value; }
        public String getText2() { return i_text2; }
        public void setText2(String value) { this.i_text2 = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
        public Map<String, String> getData() { return m_data; }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dymColumns1 = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    int m_numberOfColumns = 3;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridDynContentColumns(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        renderColumns();
        fillData();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogriddyncontentcolumns.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridDynContentColumns}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDymColumns1() { return m_dymColumns1; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public int getNumberOfColumns() { return m_numberOfColumns; } 
    public void setNumberOfColumns(int numberOfColumns) { m_numberOfColumns = numberOfColumns; }

    public void onRenderAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        renderColumns();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderColumns()
    {
        List<ComponentNode> cs = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        for (int i=0; i<m_numberOfColumns; i++)
        {
            GRIDCOLNode gcn = new GRIDCOLNode()
                .setText("Dyn " + i)
                .setWidth("100%;100");
            cs.add(gcn);
            LABELNode ln = new LABELNode()
                .setText(".{data.dyn"+i+"}");
            gcn.addSubNode(ln);
        }
        m_dymColumns1.setContentNodes(cs);
    }

    private void fillData()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setText1("Text 1 " + i);
            gi.setText2("Text 2 " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

}

One column - two controls

Typically column components within a grid are defined by column. But: you can also dynamically define the component of a column per row.

In the example the RENDERED attribute is used to switch between the components that are placed inside one column cell.

Note that the RENDERED attribute is interpreted on server side. This means that even when placing certain components into the layout for one grid column, then only this one component (per row) is sent to the client, for which the RENDERED binding tells "true".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridflexcols}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#D0D0D0" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridflexcols.rows}" rowbgpaint="background(#FFFFFF)" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Control Type" width="100" >
<t:combobox id="g_5" flush="true" validvaluesbinding=".{rowControlTypes}" value=".{controlType}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="First Name" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_7" bgpaint="null!" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:field id="g_9" background="#FFFFFF00" bgpaint="null!" border="top:0;left:0;bottom:0;right:0" height="100%" rendered=".{fieldRendered}" text=".{firstName}" width="100%" />
<t:combofield id="g_10" actionListener=".{onComboFieldAction}" background="#FFFFFF00" bgpaint="null!" border="top:0;left:0;bottom:0;right:0" height="100%" rendered=".{comboFieldRendered}" text=".{firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Field" width="50" >
<t:checkbox id="g_12" enabled="false" selected=".{fieldRendered}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Combo Field" width="50" >
<t:checkbox id="g_14" enabled="false" selected=".{comboFieldRendered}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.FIXGRIDPivotListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridflexcols extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        int m_controlType = 0; // 0 => FIELD, 1 ==> COMBOFIELD
        public int getControlType() { return m_controlType; }
        public void setControlType(int controlType) { m_controlType = controlType; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public boolean getFieldRendered()
        {
            if (m_controlType == 0)
                return true;
            else
                return false;
        }
        public boolean getComboFieldRendered()
        {
            if (m_controlType == 1)
                return true;
            else
                return false;
        }
        public ValidValuesBinding getRowControlTypes()
        {
            return getControlTypes();
        }
        public void onComboFieldAction(ActionEvent ae)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("Bj�rn","Bj�rn - This is a nice name!");
            idts.addLine("Tom","Tom - OK, as well!");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
            {
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_firstName = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridflexcols(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<7; i++)
        {
            MyRow row = new MyRow();
            row.setFirstName("First Name " + i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(row);
            if (i%2 == 0)
                row.setControlType(1);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public ValidValuesBinding getControlTypes()
    {
        ValidValuesBinding result = new ValidValuesBinding();
        result.addValidValue("0","Field (FIELD)");
        result.addValidValue("1","Combo Field (COMBOFIELD)");
        return result;
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Column Content rendering

This example demonstrates how to build scenarios in which the content of columns is rendered dependent on some other information.

In the example the check boxes "married" and "children" are only rendered when the check box "Pers. Details" is activated.

There is one important aspect to pay attention to: all dynamic behaviour (such as rendering or hiding the check boxes) must NOT happen on the component level which is located directly below the GRIDCOL component. This level must be defined in a fix way. What happens below this level is then up to you!

This is the reason why the check boxes are surrounded by a PANE / ROW combination.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGriddyncbs}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGriddyncbs.rows}" rowbgpaint="background(#FFFFFF)" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Pers. Details" width="100" >
<t:checkbox id="g_7" flush="true" selected=".{withPersonalDetails}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Children" width="60" >
<t:pane id="g_9" >
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:checkbox id="g_11" rendered=".{withPersonalDetails}" selected=".{withChildren}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Married" width="60" >
<t:pane id="g_13" >
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:checkbox id="g_15" rendered=".{withPersonalDetails}" selected=".{married}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass(expressionBase="#{d.demoGriddyncbs}")

public class DemoGriddyncbs extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String i_name;
        boolean i_married;
        boolean i_withChildren;
        boolean i_withPersonalDetails;
        public String getName()
        {
            return i_name;
        }
        public void setName(String name)
        {
            i_name = name;
        }
        public boolean isMarried()
        {
            return i_married;
        }
        public void setMarried(boolean married)
        {
            i_married = married;
        }
        public boolean isWithChildren()
        {
            return i_withChildren;
        }
        public void setWithChildren(boolean withChildren)
        {
            i_withChildren = withChildren;
        }
        public boolean isWithPersonalDetails()
        {
            return i_withPersonalDetails;
        }
        public void setWithPersonalDetails(boolean withPersonalDetails)
        {
            i_withPersonalDetails = withPersonalDetails;
        }
        public boolean isWithoutPersonalDetails()
        {
            return !i_withPersonalDetails;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGriddyncbs(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        MyRow r;
        r = new MyRow(); r.setName("George"); m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        r = new MyRow(); r.setName("John"); m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        r = new MyRow(); r.setName("Paul"); m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        r = new MyRow(); r.setName("Ringo"); m_rows.getItems().add(r);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
}

Column rendering

The visibility of columns can be controlled using the RENDERED attribute that is available with the GRIDCOL component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridcolrender}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" drawoddevenrows="true" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridcolrender.rows}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" rendered="#{d.demoGridcolrender.firstNameRendered}" text="First Name" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" rendered="#{d.demoGridcolrender.lastNameRendered}" text="Last Name" width="150" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" rendered="#{d.demoGridcolrender.streetRendered}" text="Street" width="200" >
<t:field id="g_9" text=".{street}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:checkbox id="g_12" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoGridcolrender.firstNameRendered}" text="Render &#34;First Name&#34;" />
<t:checkbox id="g_13" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoGridcolrender.lastNameRendered}" text="Render &#34;Last Name&#34;" />
<t:checkbox id="g_14" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoGridcolrender.streetRendered}" text="Render &#34;Street&#34;" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoGridcolrender}")

public class DemoGridcolrender extends PageBean
{
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
    }
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    boolean m_firstNameRendered = true;
    boolean m_lastNameRendered = true;
    boolean m_streetRendered = true;
    
    public DemoGridcolrender(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<25; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            r.setLastName("LN " + i);
            r.setStreet("ST " + i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
    }
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void setFirstNameRendered(boolean value) { m_firstNameRendered = value; }
    public boolean isFirstNameRendered() { return m_firstNameRendered; }
    public void setLastNameRendered(boolean value) { m_lastNameRendered = value; }
    public boolean getLastNameRendered() { return m_lastNameRendered; }
    public void setStreetRendered(boolean value) { m_streetRendered = value; }
    public boolean getStreetRendered() { return m_streetRendered; }
    
}

Individual Column Layout

This grid may look a bit confusing... - but this is by intention! You see that there are two types of grid rows combined within one grid - the one with 4 fields, the other one with 2 fields.

Actually, if you have a look inside, then each grid row is a wide column pane, in which the content is rendered dynamically. The dynamic rendering is done using the ROWDYNAMICCONTENT component. This is the easiest and recommended way to do dynamic rendering. (You also can directly manipulate the JSF component tree, there are also some examples within this demo workplace, but especially in case of a grid rendering this is quite complex).

When looking inside the server side code, then you see that each grid item knows itself how it is rendered by just defining the corresponding XML definition.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_01" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic.grid}" rowheight="27" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" width="30" >
<t:gridrowselector id="g_5" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_7" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_8" contentbinding=".{content}" />
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic}")

/**
 * In this example there are two types of grid lines: persons and cars. Each 
 * item specifies its dynamic content rendering by returning the corresponding
 * content, that is defined statically.
 * <br><br>
 * In more complex scenarios you can, of course, build up an individual content
 * binding instance per line.
 */
public class DemoGridRowDynamic 
    extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public abstract class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public abstract ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent();
        public void onRemove(ActionEvent event)
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
        }
    }
    
    public class PersonGridItem extends GridItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        String m_town;
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return CB_PERSON; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setTown(String value) { m_town = value; }
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
    }

    public class CarGridItem extends GridItem
    {
        String m_id;
        String m_producer;
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return CB_CAR; }
        public String getId() { return m_id; }
        public void setId(String id) { m_id = id; }
        public String getProducer() { return m_producer; }
        public void setProducer(String producer) { m_producer = producer; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static String XML_PERSON = "<t:field text='.{firstName}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{lastName}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:button actionListener='.{onRemove}' text='Rem.' width='50' height='100%' border='top:0'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{street}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{town}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"; 
    static String XML_CAR = "<t:field text='.{id}' width='60%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:button actionListener='.{onRemove}' text='Rem.' width='50' height='100%' border='top:0'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{producer}' width='40%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>";
    private static ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding CB_PERSON = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    private static ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding CB_CAR = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static
    {
        CB_PERSON.setContentXml(XML_PERSON);
        CB_CAR.setContentXml(XML_CAR);
    }
    
    public DemoGridRowDynamic(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20;i++)
        {
            if (i%3 == 0 || i%3 == 1)
            {
                PersonGridItem gi = new PersonGridItem();
                gi.setFirstName("FN"+i);
                gi.setLastName("LN"+i);
                gi.setStreet("ST"+i);
                gi.setTown("TO"+i);
                m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            }
            else
            {
                CarGridItem gi = new CarGridItem();
                gi.setId("ID"+i);
                gi.setProducer("PR"+i);
                m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Column Spanning

By using the component SPANGRID you can flexibly arrange components within the cells of the grid. Each cell component may define an explicit horizontal column spanning.

The definition of cell components needs to be done within the code of the page (i.e. within the corresponding Java program), because each row now may contain an individual set of components.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColSpan}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:spangrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#00000060" borderheight="1" borderwidth="0" dynamicheightsizing="true" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridColSpan.grid}" rowbgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#ffffff10);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000010)" rowheight="23" rowpopupmenu="GRID" sbvisibleamount="25" selectioncolor1="#FF000080" selectioncolor2="#FF000020" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" >
<t:spangridcol id="g_4" sortenabled="false" text="Title" width="60" />
<t:spangridcol id="g_5" text="First Name" width="50%;100" />
<t:spangridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%;100" />
</t:spangrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" rendered="false" >
<t:checkbox id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridColSpan.onDifferentRowheightsAction}" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridColSpan.differentRowheights}" text="Different row height per item type" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="GRID" >
<t:menuitem id="g_9" command="SELECT" text="Select" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.CHECKBOXNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.SPANGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridColSpan}")

public class DemoGridColSpan
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // Some "business classes"
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class Summary
    {
        boolean m_checked;
        String m_text;
        public void setText(String value) { m_text = value; }
        public String getText() { return m_text; }
        public boolean isChecked() { return m_checked; }
        public void setChecked(boolean checked) { m_checked = checked; }
    }
    
    public class Person
    {
        String m_title;
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        public void setTitle(String value) { m_title = value; }
        public String getTitle() { return m_title; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    }
    
    public class CostCenter
    {
        String m_name;
        public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // Inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends SPANGRIDItem
    {
        Object m_o;
        public GridItem(Object o)
        {
            m_o = o;
            renderContent();
        }
        private void renderContent()
        {
            ComponentNode cn;
            if (m_o instanceof CostCenter)
            {
                cn = new LABELNode()
                    .setText(".{o.name}")
                    .setWidth("100%")
                    .setBackground("#c0c0ff80")
                    .setHeight("100%;40")
                    .setFocusable(true)
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .setFont("weight:bold");
                addContent(3,cn);
            }
            else if (m_o instanceof Person)
            {
                cn = new FIELDNode()
                    .setText(".{o.title}")
                    .setBorder("left:1;color:#00000030")
                    .setBackground("C0FFC080")
                    .setRounding(0);
                addContent(1,cn);
                cn = new FIELDNode()
                    .setText(".{o.firstName}")
                    .setBorder("left:1;color:#00000030")
                    .setBackground("FFFFFF80")
                    .setRounding(0);
                addContent(1,cn);
                cn = new FIELDNode()
                    .setText(".{o.lastName}")
                    .setBorder("left:1;color:#00000030")
                    .setBackground("FFFFFF80")
                    .setRounding(0);
                addContent(1,cn);
            }   
            else if (m_o instanceof Summary)
            {
                cn = new COLDISTANCENode();
                addContent(1,cn);
                cn = new PANENode()
                    .setPadding("left:5");
                ROWNode rn = new ROWNode();
                cn.addSubNode(rn);
                CHECKBOXNode cbn = new CHECKBOXNode()
                    .setSelected(".{o.checked}")
                    .setText(".{o.text}");
                rn.addSubNode(cbn);
                addContent(2,cn);
            }   
        }
        public Object getO() { return m_o; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    boolean m_differentRowheights = false;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridColSpan(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher); 
        for (int i=0; i<30; i++)
        {
            CostCenter cc = new CostCenter();
            cc.setName("Cost Center " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(cc));
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                Person p = new Person();
                p.setTitle("Dr");
                p.setFirstName("First " + j);
                p.setLastName("Last " + j);
                m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(p));
            }
            Summary s = new Summary();
            s.setText("5 persons listed above");
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(s));
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public boolean getDifferentRowheights() { return m_differentRowheights; }
    public void setDifferentRowheights(boolean differentRowheights) { m_differentRowheights = differentRowheights; }

    public void onDifferentRowheightsAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (m_differentRowheights == false)
        {
            for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
                gi.setRowHeight(20);
        }       
        else
        {
            for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
            {
                if (gi.getO() instanceof CostCenter)
                    gi.setRowHeight(30);
                else if (gi.getO() instanceof Summary)
                    gi.setRowHeight(16);
                else
                    gi.setRowHeight(20);
            }
        }
    }
    
    
}

Grid in Grid

Grid in Grid Cell

You can define grids to be contained in grid cells.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridInGrid}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:animatedpane id="g_3" curtaincolor="#40404010" curtainflash="#{d.DemoGridInGrid.persons.sbvalue}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_5" background="#F0F0FF" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" headlinerowheight="20" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridInGrid.persons}" rowheight="50" sbvisibleamount="6" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="#{rr.literals.firstName}" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_7" background="#FFFFFF00" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="#{rr.literals.lastName}" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_9" background="#FFFFFF00" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Kids" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_11" padding="0" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_13" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#F0FFF0,#C0FFC0,vertical)" border="top:0;left:0;bottom:0;right:0" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding=".{kids}" rowheight="16" sbvisibleamount="5" suppressheadline="false" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="#{rr.literals.firstName}" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_15" background="#FFFFFF80" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="#{rr.literals.lastName}" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_17" background="#FFFFFF80" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" width="80" >
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener=".{onRemoveKid}" contentareafilled="false" text="Remove" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:animatedpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridInGrid.onAddPerson}" text="Add Person" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="104" />
<t:button id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridInGrid.onAddKid}" rendered="#{d.DemoGridInGrid.persons.selectedItem != null}" text="Add Kid" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridInGrid}")

public class DemoGridInGrid 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Kid extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        Person i_owner;
        
        public Kid(Person owner)
        {
            i_owner = owner;
        }
        
        public void onRemoveKid(ActionEvent event) 
        {
            i_owner.getKids().getItems().remove(this);
        }

        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    public class Person extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    
        protected FIXGRIDListBinding<Kid> m_kids = new FIXGRIDListBinding<Kid>();
        public FIXGRIDListBinding<Kid> getKids() { return m_kids; }
        public void setKids(FIXGRIDListBinding<Kid> value) { m_kids = value; }

        public void createKid() 
        {
            Kid k = new Kid(this);
            m_kids.getItems().add(k);
        }

    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<Person> m_persons = new FIXGRIDListBinding<Person>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridInGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
        
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<Person> getPersons() { return m_persons; }

    public void onAddPerson(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Person p = new Person();
        p.setFirstName("New first name");
        p.setLastName("New last name");
        m_persons.getItems().add(p);
    }
    
    public void onAddKid(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Person p = m_persons.getSelectedItem();
        if (p == null)
            return;
        p.createKid();
    }


}

Individual Column Layout

This grid may look a bit confusing... - but this is by intention! You see that there are two types of grid rows combined within one grid - the one with 4 fields, the other one with 2 fields.

Actually, if you have a look inside, then each grid row is a wide column pane, in which the content is rendered dynamically. The dynamic rendering is done using the ROWDYNAMICCONTENT component. This is the easiest and recommended way to do dynamic rendering. (You also can directly manipulate the JSF component tree, there are also some examples within this demo workplace, but especially in case of a grid rendering this is quite complex).

When looking inside the server side code, then you see that each grid item knows itself how it is rendered by just defining the corresponding XML definition.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_01" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic.grid}" rowheight="27" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" width="30" >
<t:gridrowselector id="g_5" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_7" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_8" contentbinding=".{content}" />
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic}")

/**
 * In this example there are two types of grid lines: persons and cars. Each 
 * item specifies its dynamic content rendering by returning the corresponding
 * content, that is defined statically.
 * <br><br>
 * In more complex scenarios you can, of course, build up an individual content
 * binding instance per line.
 */
public class DemoGridRowDynamic 
    extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public abstract class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public abstract ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent();
        public void onRemove(ActionEvent event)
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
        }
    }
    
    public class PersonGridItem extends GridItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        String m_town;
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return CB_PERSON; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setTown(String value) { m_town = value; }
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
    }

    public class CarGridItem extends GridItem
    {
        String m_id;
        String m_producer;
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return CB_CAR; }
        public String getId() { return m_id; }
        public void setId(String id) { m_id = id; }
        public String getProducer() { return m_producer; }
        public void setProducer(String producer) { m_producer = producer; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static String XML_PERSON = "<t:field text='.{firstName}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{lastName}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:button actionListener='.{onRemove}' text='Rem.' width='50' height='100%' border='top:0'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{street}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{town}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"; 
    static String XML_CAR = "<t:field text='.{id}' width='60%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:button actionListener='.{onRemove}' text='Rem.' width='50' height='100%' border='top:0'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{producer}' width='40%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>";
    private static ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding CB_PERSON = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    private static ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding CB_CAR = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static
    {
        CB_PERSON.setContentXml(XML_PERSON);
        CB_CAR.setContentXml(XML_CAR);
    }
    
    public DemoGridRowDynamic(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20;i++)
        {
            if (i%3 == 0 || i%3 == 1)
            {
                PersonGridItem gi = new PersonGridItem();
                gi.setFirstName("FN"+i);
                gi.setLastName("LN"+i);
                gi.setStreet("ST"+i);
                gi.setTown("TO"+i);
                m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            }
            else
            {
                CarGridItem gi = new CarGridItem();
                gi.setId("ID"+i);
                gi.setProducer("PR"+i);
                m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Grid Sequence

Press the button at the end of the grid - and sub items will be shown.

This example shows a grid in which two different object types are contained.

Technically the grid cell is a dynamic content area (ROWDYNAMICCONTENT within a PANE) that is rendered differently per object type.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridInGrid2}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_4" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridInGrid2.rows}" rowheight="23" sbvisibleamount="30" suppressheadline="true" width="100%;450" >
<t:gridcol id="g_5" text="Whole Row" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_6" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_1" contentbinding=".{dynamicContent}" />
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.PANEComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridInGrid2}")

public class DemoGridInGrid2
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public interface IRenderLine
    {
        public void renderLine(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding content);
        public void renderHeadLine(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding content);
    }
    
    public class MyPerson 
            implements Serializable, IRenderLine
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        List<MyCar> m_cars = new ArrayList<MyCar>();
        public int getNumberOfCars() { return m_cars.size(); }
        public void renderLine(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding content)
        {
            PANENode p = new PANENode()
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setHeight("100%");
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                p.addSubNode(r);
                {
                    FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode()
                        .setText(".{o.firstName}")
                        .setWidth(150)
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:1;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode()
                        .setText(".{o.lastName}")
                        .setWidth(150)
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:1;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode()
                        .setText(".{o.street}")
                        .setWidth("100%")
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode()
                        .setText(".{o.numberOfCars}")
                        .setActionListener(".{onShowCars}")
                        .setWidth(60)
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBackground("#c0c0c080")
                        .setContentareafilled(false)
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0");
                    r.addSubNode(b);
                }
                content.setContentNode(p);
            }
        }
        public void renderHeadLine(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding content)
        {
            PANENode p = new PANENode()
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setHeight("100%");
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                p.addSubNode(r);
                {
                    LABELNode f = new LABELNode()
                        .setText("First Name")
                        .setBackground("#FFFF0010")
                        .setWidth(150)
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:1;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    LABELNode f = new LABELNode()
                        .setText("Last name")
                        .setBackground("#FFFF0010")
                        .setWidth(150)
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:1;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    LABELNode f = new LABELNode()
                        .setText("Street")
                        .setBackground("#FFFF0010")
                        .setWidth("100%")
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    LABELNode b = new LABELNode()
                        .setText("Cars")
                        .setBackground("#FFFF0010")
                        .setWidth(60)
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBackground("#c0c0c080")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0");
                    r.addSubNode(b);
                }
                content.setContentNode(p);
            }
        }
    }
    
    public class MyCar 
        implements Serializable, IRenderLine
    {
        String m_id;
        String m_type;
        public void setId(String value) { m_id = value; }
        public String getId() { return m_id; }
        public void setType(String value) { m_type = value; }
        public String getType() { return m_type; }
        public void renderLine(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding content)
        {
            PANENode p = new PANENode()
            .setWidth("100%")
            .setHeight("100%");
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                p.addSubNode(r);
