                {
                    COLDISTANCENode c = new COLDISTANCENode()
                        .setWidth(100);
                    r.addSubNode(c);
                }
                {
                    FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode()
                        .setText(".{o.id}")
                        .setWidth("50%")
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0")
                        .setBackground("#00000010");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode()
                        .setText(".{o.type}")
                        .setWidth("50%")
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:1;right:0;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0")
                        .setBackground("#00000010");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                content.setContentNode(p);
            }
        }
        public void renderHeadLine(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding content)
        {
            PANENode p = new PANENode()
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setHeight("100%");
            {
                ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                p.addSubNode(r);
                {
                    COLDISTANCENode c = new COLDISTANCENode()
                        .setWidth(100);
                    r.addSubNode(c);
                }
                {
                    LABELNode f = new LABELNode()
                        .setText("Id")
                        .setWidth("50%")
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0")
                        .setBackground("#00000018");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                {
                    LABELNode f = new LABELNode()
                        .setText("Type")
                        .setWidth("50%")
                        .setHeight("100%")
                        .setBorder("top:0;left:1;right:0;bottom:0;color:#C0C0C0")
                        .setBackground("#00000018");
                    r.addSubNode(f);
                }
                content.setContentNode(p);
            }
        }
    }
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynamicContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
        protected PANEComponent m_pane = new PANEComponent();
        protected IRenderLine m_object;
        protected boolean m_asHeadline;
        boolean m_showCars = false;
        public MyRow(IRenderLine object)
        {
            m_object = object;
            m_object.renderLine(m_dynamicContent);
        }
        public MyRow(IRenderLine object, boolean asHeadline)
        {
            m_object = object;
            m_asHeadline = asHeadline;
            if (asHeadline == false)
                m_object.renderLine(m_dynamicContent);
            else
                m_object.renderHeadLine(m_dynamicContent);
        }
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynamicContent() { return m_dynamicContent; }
        public Object getO()
        {
            return m_object;
        }
        public void onShowCars(ActionEvent event)
        {
            if (m_showCars == false)
            {
                m_showCars = true;
                MyPerson person = (MyPerson)m_object;
                if (person.m_cars.size() == 0)
                    return;
                int counter = 1;
                int myIndex = m_rows.getItems().indexOf(this);
                MyRow mr = new MyRow(person.m_cars.get(0),true);
                m_rows.getItems().add(myIndex+counter,mr);
                counter++;
                for (int i=0; i<person.m_cars.size(); i++)
                {
                    mr = new MyRow(person.m_cars.get(i));
                    m_rows.getItems().add(myIndex+counter,mr);
                    counter++;
                }
                mr = new MyRow(m_object,true);
                m_rows.getItems().add(myIndex+counter,mr);
                counter++;
            }
            else
            {
                m_showCars = false;
                MyPerson person = (MyPerson)m_object;
                if (person.m_cars.size() == 0)
                    return;
                int myIndex = m_rows.getItems().indexOf(this);
                for (int i=0; i<(person.m_cars.size()+2); i++)
                    m_rows.getItems().remove(myIndex+1);
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    public void setRows(FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> value) { m_rows = value; }
    protected DemoGridInGrid2 m_this = this;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridInGrid2(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        Random r = new Random();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            MyPerson p = new MyPerson();
            p.setFirstName("FN"+i);
            p.setLastName("LN"+i);
            p.setStreet("ST"+i);
            if (i == 0)
                m_rows.getItems().add(new MyRow(p,true));
            m_rows.getItems().add(new MyRow(p));
            // create cars
            int jMax = 2 + r.nextInt(4);
            for (int j=0; j<jMax; j++)
            {
                MyCar c = new MyCar();
                c.setId("ID"+i+"/"+j);
                c.setType("TYPE"+i+"/"+j);
                p.m_cars.add(c);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    

    

}

Flexible Tree

Each line of the grid provides a dynamic content which is filled according to the object that is kept in the line.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeFlex}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeFlex.tree}" rowheight="16" sbvisibleamount="30" suppressheadline="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridheader id="g_4" rowheight="25" >
<t:label id="g_5" />
<t:pane id="g_6" background="#C0F0C0" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#00000000,#00000040,vertical)" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Name" width="100" />
<t:colline id="g_9" background="#c0c0c0" height="100%" />
<t:label id="g_10" text="Head" width="100" />
<t:colline id="g_11" background="#c0c0c0" height="100%" />
<t:label id="g_12" align="right" text="Budget" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridheader id="g_13" rowheight="25" >
<t:label id="g_14" />
<t:pane id="g_15" background="#C0C0FF" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#00000000,#00000040,vertical)" >
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="First Name" width="50%" />
<t:colline id="g_18" background="#c0c0c0" height="100%" />
<t:label id="g_19" text="Last Name" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridcol id="g_20" text="Text" width="150" >
<t:treenode id="g_21" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_22" text="Content" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_23" background=".{background}" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_24" contentbinding=".{dynContent}" />
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.COLLINEComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.LABELComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeFlex}")

public class DemoTreeFlex
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class CostCenter
    {
        String m_name;
        String m_head;
        BigDecimal m_budget;
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String name) { m_name = name; }
        public String getHead() { return m_head; }
        public void setHead(String head) { m_head = head; }
        public BigDecimal getBudget() { return m_budget; }
        public void setBudget(BigDecimal budget) { m_budget = budget; }
    }
    
    public class Employee
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    }
    
    public class FlexTreeItem extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Object i_object;
        ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding i_dynContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
        public FlexTreeItem(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode, Object object)
        {
            super(parentNode);
            i_object = object;
            renderContent();
        }
        public Object getObject()
        {
            return i_object;
        }
        @Override
        public String getText()
        {
            if (i_object instanceof CostCenter) return ((CostCenter)i_object).getName();
            else if (i_object instanceof Employee) return ((Employee)i_object).getLastName();
            else return "?";
        }
        public String getBackground() 
        { 
            if (i_object instanceof CostCenter) return "#F0FFF0";
            else if (i_object instanceof Employee) return "#F0F0FF";
            else return "#FFFFFF";
        }
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() { return i_dynContent; }
        public void renderContent()
        {
            List<ComponentNode> cns = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
            if (i_object instanceof CostCenter)
            {
                CostCenter o = (CostCenter)i_object;
                ComponentNode cn;
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:label"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("text",o.getName());
                cn.addAttribute("width","100");
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:colline"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("height","100%");
                cn.addAttribute("background","#c0c0c0");
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:label"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("text",o.getHead());
                cn.addAttribute("width","100");
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:colline"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("height","100%");
                cn.addAttribute("background","#c0c0c0");
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:label"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("text",o.getBudget()+"");
                cn.addAttribute("width","100%");
                cn.addAttribute("align","right");
                cn.addAttribute("format","bigdecimal");
                cn.addAttribute("formatmask","dec2");
            }
            else 
            {
                Employee o = (Employee)i_object;
                ComponentNode cn;
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:label"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("text",o.getFirstName());
                cn.addAttribute("width","50%");
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:colline"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("height","100%");
                cn.addAttribute("background","#c0c0c0");
                cn = new ComponentNode("t:label"); // -----
                cns.add(cn);
                cn.addAttribute("text",o.getLastName());
                cn.addAttribute("width","50%");
            }
            i_dynContent.setContentNodes(cns);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected FIXGRIDTreeBinding<FlexTreeItem> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<FlexTreeItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoTreeFlex(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            CostCenter cc = new CostCenter();
            cc.setBudget(new BigDecimal((i+1)*1000));
            cc.setName("Cost Center " + i);
            cc.setHead("Head " + i);
            FlexTreeItem top = new FlexTreeItem(m_tree.getRootNode(),cc);
            top.setStatus(top.STATUS_CLOSED);
            for (int j=0; j<8; j++)
            {
                Employee emp = new Employee();
                emp.setFirstName("First " + i + "/" + j);
                emp.setLastName("Last " + i + "/" + j);
                FlexTreeItem sub = new FlexTreeItem(top,emp);
                sub.setStatus(sub.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<FlexTreeItem> getTree() { return m_tree; }
    public void setTree(FIXGRIDTreeBinding<FlexTreeItem> value) { m_tree = value; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    

}

Special Types of Binding

Large output lists

For output-only scenarios there is a special grid - the ARRAYGRID. In the ARRAYGRID all layout information about the columns is passed through array parameters. The mandatory parameters on grid level are the columns[] and widths[] array - the mandatory parameter on item level is the values[] array.

Aside the dynamic configuration there is one important aspect: ARRAYGRID components are not "multiplied out" into their cell components at runtime. This makes them usable for large grids that normally, with normal FIXGRID rendering, would occupy quite a lot of memory for holding the corresponding component tree.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:timer id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.onTimer}" duration="10000" rendered="false" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:rowheader id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Number of columns" />
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="10" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" format="int" value="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.columnCount}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.onNewColumns}" text="Update grid" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Export..." />
<t:link id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Columns..." />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:arraygrid id="g_14" avoidroundtrips="true" bordercolor="#00000020" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" flushcolumnupdates="true" gridcolbgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000040);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000060)" gridcolfont="weight:bold" gridcolforeground="#f0f0f0" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.grid}" rowbgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000004);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000014);" rowpopupmenu="ROW" sbvisibleamount="30" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" usefieldforlabel="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding.onAddItem}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add Item" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_17" />
<t:popupmenu id="ROW" >
<t:menuitem id="g_18" command="remove" text="Remove" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoArrayGridBinding}")

/**
 * Demo of dynamic grid.
 * The first column (index 0) is a special one in this demo - by assigning
 * the text value ARRAYGRIDListBinding.TEXT_GRIDROWSELECTOR or TEXT_GRIDROWINDEX,
 * a grid row selector is rendered as column content. Otherwise (with normal)
 * text a normal LABEL is rendered.
 */
public class DemoArrayGridBinding
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyARRAYGRIDItem extends ARRAYGRIDItem
    {
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("onRowExecute was called");
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("onRowSelect was called");
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            super.onRowPopupMenuItem(event);
            if ("remove".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_grid.getItems().remove(this);                
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static Random s_random = new Random();
    
    ARRAYGRIDListBinding<MyARRAYGRIDItem> m_grid = new ARRAYGRIDListBinding<MyARRAYGRIDItem>();
    int m_columnCount = 25;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoArrayGridBinding(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initGrid();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            onAddItem(null);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public ARRAYGRIDListBinding getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void setColumnCount(int value) 
    { 
        m_columnCount = value; 
        if (m_columnCount <= 0)
            m_columnCount = 1;
    }
    public int getColumnCount() { return m_columnCount; }
    
    public void onAddItem(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Random r = new Random();
        MyARRAYGRIDItem agi = new MyARRAYGRIDItem();
        String[] values = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] backgrounds = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] fonts = new String[m_columnCount];
        for (int j=0; j<m_columnCount; j++)
        {
            if (j == 2 && m_grid.getItems().size()%2 == 0)
                continue;
            values[j] = j+"_"+s_random.nextInt(99999);
        }
        for (int j=0; j<m_columnCount; j++) 
        {
            int randomInt = r.nextInt(10);
            if (randomInt == 5)
            {
                backgrounds[j] = "#ffc0c040";
                fonts[j] = "weight:bold";
            }
            else if (j % 2 == 0)
                backgrounds[j] = "#ffffc040";
            else if (j % 7 == 0)
                backgrounds[j] = "#c0ffc040";
            else
                backgrounds[j] = "#c0ffff40";
        }
        String[] images = new String[m_columnCount];
        images[0] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        images[1] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        images[2] = "/images/icons/add.png";
        agi.setValues(values);
        agi.setBackgrounds(backgrounds);
        agi.setImages(images);
        agi.setFonts(fonts);
        m_grid.getItems().add(agi);
        if (event != null)
            m_grid.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(agi);
    }
    
    public void onNewColumns(ActionEvent event)
    {
        initGrid();
    }
    
    public void onTimer(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Timer: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initGrid()
    {
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        String[] titles = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] widths = new String[m_columnCount];
        String[] aligns = new String[m_columnCount];
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++) titles[i] = "Title " + i;
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++)
        {
            widths[i] = "100";
            if (i%5 == 4) widths[i] = "150";
        }
        for (int i=0; i<m_columnCount; i++)
        {
            aligns[i] = "left";
            if (i%5 == 4) aligns[i] = "right";
        }
        m_grid.setTitles(titles);
        m_grid.setWidths(widths);
        m_grid.setAligns(aligns);
    }
    
}

List of Beans

There is a server side class FIXGRIDBeanListBinding that is a sub-class of FIXGRIDListBinding. This class directly renders a list of beans. It provides add/remove methods that directly manipulate the list, that is passed into the processing.

In the columns the bean properties are reached by expression ".{bean.PROPERTY}".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridBeanBinding}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridBeanBinding.grid}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{bean.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{bean.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_116" text="Street" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_117" text=".{bean.street}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_226" text="City" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_227" text=".{bean.city}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridBeanBinding.grid.onAddItem}" text="Add Item" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridBeanBinding.grid.onRemoveSelectedItems}" text="Remove Items" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.lang.reflect.Method;
import java.lang.reflect.Type;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.FIXGRIDBeanListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridBeanBinding extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDBeanListBinding<Employee> m_grid = new FIXGRIDBeanListBinding<Employee>(Employee.class);
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridBeanBinding(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        List<Employee> employees = readListOfEmployees();
        m_grid.showList(employees);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDBeanListBinding<Employee> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    
    
    
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // the followig code would normally come "from outside"...
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /**
     * Bean class that is used inside the grid. Normally is a class
     * "coming from outside".
     */
    public static class Employee
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        String m_city;
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setCity(String value) { m_city = value; }
        public String getCity() { return m_city; }
    }
    
    /**
     * Dummy method for reading a list of beans
     */
    private List<Employee> readListOfEmployees()
    {
        List<Employee> result = new ArrayList<Employee>();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            Employee e = new Employee();
            e.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            e.setLastName("LN " + i);
            e.setStreet("ST " + i);
            e.setCity("CI " + i);
            result.add(e);
        }
        return result;
    }
    
}

Radio Button in Grid (I)

Radio buttons can be used in a grid as well, of course. When using please pay attention to:

(1) A radio button group never spans several lines. Remember: all the radio buttons of one group maintain exactly one and the same property instance. In case of a grid, each row represents a different object instance, and as consequence a different property instance, on server side.

(2) The name of the group must be different from row to row. You achieve this by binding the name to a server side value that is part of the row data.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridwithrb}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridwithrb.rows}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" align="center" text="A" width="50" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_5" align="center" flush="true" group=".{group}" refvalue="A" value=".{prio}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" align="center" text="B" width="50" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" align="center" flush="true" group=".{group}" refvalue="B" value=".{prio}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" align="center" text="C" width="50" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_9" align="center" flush="true" group=".{group}" refvalue="C" value=".{prio}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Text" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_11" text=".{text}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Prio" width="50" >
<t:field id="g_13" background="#F0F0F0" enabled="false" flush="true" text=".{prio}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="Group" width="80" >
<t:label id="g_15" text=".{group}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridwithrb extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_prio;
        String m_text;
        String m_group;
        public void setPrio(String value) { m_prio = value; }
        public String getPrio() { return m_prio; }
        public void setText(String value) { m_text = value; }
        public String getText() { return m_text; }
        public void setGroup(String value) {  m_group = value; }        
        public String getGroup() {  return m_group; }        
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridwithrb(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            MyRow mr = new MyRow();
            mr.setPrio("A");
            mr.setText("Text " + i);
            mr.setGroup("GROUP"+i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(mr);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    

}

Radio Button in Grid (II)

This example shows how to implement a radio button scenario spanning multiple rows.

The steps are:
1. The radio button(s) must refer to one central value that is managed outside the grid processing.
2. The radio button must flush its value to the server side when clicked by the user.
3. Each radio button must bind to some unique value

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRadioButton}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRadioButton.grid}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Person" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{person}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Column" width="100" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" flush="true" group="BOSS" refvalue=".{rbIndex}" value="#{d.DemoGridRadioButton.rbValue}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Radio button value" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoGridRadioButton.rbValue}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridRadioButton}")

public class DemoGridRadioButton
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_rbIndex;
        public String getRbIndex() { return m_rbIndex; }
        public void setRbIndex(String value) { this.m_rbIndex = value; }
        
        String m_person;
        public String getPerson() { return m_person; }
        public void setPerson(String value) { this.m_person = value; }
        
    }
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    String m_rbValue = "0";
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public String getRbValue() { return m_rbValue; }
    public void setRbValue(String value) { this.m_rbValue = value; }

    public DemoGridRadioButton(IWorkpageDispatcher d)
    {
        super(d);
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setPerson("Person " + i);
            gi.setRbIndex(i+"");
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/deomgridradiobutton.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridRadioButton}"; }

}

Grid Data Binding

The focus of this demo is the data binding between the grid columns and the server side objects.

Normally you use an expression ".{xxx}" for property binding within a component that serves as cell component. As consequence the expression "xxx" is executed from the grid item on.

You can still use the "#{...}" expression style for dynamic binding. In this case of course there is no item / row dependency anymore. In the example the "editable" control is implemented using "#{...}" expressions.

An interesting aspect in this example is the radio button implementation: the radio button maintains a central property, but the reference values are taken from the row items.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridbinding}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.demoGridbinding.rows}" sbvisibleamount="10" selectorcolumn="2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="RBI" width="30" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_5" flush="true" group="RBI" refvalue=".{index}" value="#{d.demoGridbinding.radioButtonIndex}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" background="#{d.demoGridbinding.colorFirstName}" enabled="#{d.demoGridbinding.enabledFirstName}" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_9" background="#{d.demoGridbinding.colorLastName}" enabled="#{d.demoGridbinding.enabledLastName}" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:checkbox id="g_12" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoGridbinding.enabledFirstName}" text="Enable / Disable First Name" />
<t:checkbox id="g_13" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoGridbinding.enabledLastName}" text="Enable / Disable Last Name" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Radio Button Index" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_16" flush="true" format="int" value="#{d.demoGridbinding.radioButtonIndex}" width="50" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoGridbinding extends PageBean
{
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public int getIndex() { return m_rows.getItems().indexOf(this); }
    }
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();    
    boolean m_enabledFirstName = true;
    boolean m_enabledLastName = true;
    int m_radioButtonIndex = -1;
    
    public DemoGridbinding(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            MyRow row = new MyRow();
            row.setFirstName("FN" + i);
            row.setLastName("LN"+i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        }
    }
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    public void setEnabledFirstName(boolean value) { m_enabledFirstName = value; }
    public boolean getEnabledFirstName() { return m_enabledFirstName; }
    
    public void setEnabledLastName(boolean value) { m_enabledLastName = value; }
    public boolean getEnabledLastName() { return m_enabledLastName; }
    
    public void setRadioButtonIndex(int value) { m_radioButtonIndex = value; }
    public int getRadioButtonIndex() { return m_radioButtonIndex; }
    
    public String getColorFirstName()
    {
        if (getEnabledFirstName() == true)
            return "#FFFFFF";
        else
            return "#E0E0FF";
    }
    
    public String getColorLastName()
    {
        if (getEnabledLastName() == true)
            return "#FFFFFF";
        else
            return "#E0E0FF";
    }
    
}

Schedule

This demo shows how to use the components SCHEDULE and SCHEDULEITEM in order to build complex scheduling scenarios. The story behind is very simple:

Each grid row contains one SCHEDULE component. The SCHEDULEITEMS components within the SCHEDUL are created dynamically - dependent on the scheduling situation.

There is a drag & drop management - and there is the possibility to create new items by right mouse button click. In both cases the mouse position that is transferred as percentage value into the server side processing is used to properly position the SCHEDULE component.

For drawing background information (here: break times ) a DRAWAREA can be nicely used.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoScheduleGrid}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoScheduleGrid.rows}" rowheight="50" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridheader id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@backgroundColorBlue@&#39;]}" />
<t:schedule id="g_6" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@backgroundColorBlue@&#39;]}" border="0" numberofblocks="8" schedulemax="480" >
<t:scheduleitem id="g_7" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="0" schedulewidth="60" text="08:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
<t:scheduleitem id="g_8" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="60" schedulewidth="60" text="09:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
<t:scheduleitem id="g_9" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="120" schedulewidth="60" text="10:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
<t:scheduleitem id="g_10" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="180" schedulewidth="60" text="11:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
<t:scheduleitem id="g_11" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="240" schedulewidth="60" text="12:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
<t:scheduleitem id="g_12" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="300" schedulewidth="60" text="13:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
<t:scheduleitem id="g_13" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="360" schedulewidth="60" text="14:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
<t:scheduleitem id="g_14" align="left" font="weight:bold;size:9" resizingenabled="false" scheduleleft="420" schedulewidth="60" text="15:00" textwithlinewrap="false" />
</t:schedule>
</t:gridheader>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@titlebarBackground@&#39;]}" font="weight:bold" foreground="#F0F0F0" text="Machine" width="80" >
<t:label id="g_16" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@backgroundColorBlue@&#39;]}" text=".{machine}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_17" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@titlebarBackground@&#39;]}" foreground="#F0F0F0" text="Orders" width="100%" >
<t:drawarea id="g_18" drawcommands="rectangle(12.5%,0,6.25%,100%,#ff000020);write(13.5%,1,Breakf.,10,#FF000080,lefttop);rectangle(43.75%,0,18.75%,100%,#ff000020);write(44.75%,1,Lunch,10,#FF000080,lefttop)" >
<t:schedule id="g_19" actionListener=".{onScheduleAction}" border="0" dropreceive="order" height="100%" numberofblocks="8" padding="5" popupmenu="SCHEDULE" schedulemax="480" width="100%" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_20" contentbinding=".{content}" />
</t:schedule>
</t:drawarea>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="SCHEDULE" >
<t:menuitem id="g_21" command="cmdCreateNewOrder" text="Create new Order" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;
import java.util.Set;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.SCHEDULEITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventScheduleSizeChanged;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.IActionListenerDelegation;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl.LongDelegation;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoScheduleGrid}")

public class DemoScheduleGrid
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class MyOrder implements Serializable
    {
        String i_key = "id"+(s_orderId++) + "";
        String i_name;
        long i_start; // 0 == 8:00, then in minutes
        long i_duration; // in minutes
        MyRow i_assignedRow;
        public MyOrder(String name, long start, long duration, MyRow assignedRow)
        {
            super();
            i_name = name;
            i_start = start;
            i_duration = duration;
            m_orders.put(i_key,this);
            i_assignedRow = assignedRow;
        }
        public long getStart() { return i_start; }
        public void setStart(long start) { i_start = start; }
        public void setDuration(long value) { i_duration = value; }
        public long getDuration() { return i_duration; }
//        public void onInvoke(ActionEvent ae)
//        {
//            if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventScheduleSizeChanged)
//            {
//                BaseActionEventScheduleSizeChanged sscEvent = (BaseActionEventScheduleSizeChanged)ae;
//                i_start = sscEvent.getScheduleLeft();
//                i_duration = sscEvent.getScheduleWidth();
//            }
//        }
    }
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Set<MyOrder> i_orders = new HashSet<MyOrder>(); 
        String m_machine;
        DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_content = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
        
        
        public String getMachine() { return m_machine; }
        public void setMachine(String value) { m_machine = value; }
        public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return m_content; }
        
        private void updateSchedule()
        {
            // update of the components within the schedule row
            StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
            List<ComponentNode> nodes = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
            for (final MyOrder order: i_orders)
            {
                String expression = "#{d.DemoScheduleGrid.orders."+order.i_key+".onInvoke}";
                String background = null;
                if (order.i_name != null && order.i_name.contains("New"))
                    background = "#8da8d0c0";
                else
                    background = "#a8d08dc0";
                SCHEDULEITEMNode node = new SCHEDULEITEMNode()
                    .setScheduleleft(""+ order.i_start)
                    // .setSchedulewidth("#{d.DemoScheduleGrid.orders."+order.i_key+".duration}")
                    .bindSchedulewidth(new LongDelegation()
                    {
                        @Override
                        public void setValue(Long value) { order.setDuration(value); }
                        @Override
                        public Long getValue() { return order.getDuration(); }
                    })
                    .setStylevariant("ccgantt2")
                    .setText(order.i_name + "/" + order.i_start +"/" + order.i_duration)
                    .setValign("middle")
                    .setTooltip(order.i_name + "/" + order.i_start +"/" + order.i_duration)
                    .setBackground(background)
                    .setDragsend("order:"+order.i_key)
                    .setTextwithlinewrap("false")
                    // .setActionListener("#{d.DemoScheduleGrid.orders."+order.i_key+".onInvoke}")
                    .bindActionListener(new IActionListenerDelegation()
                    {
                        @Override
                        public void onAction(ActionEvent event) 
                        { 
                            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventScheduleSizeChanged)
                            {
                                BaseActionEventScheduleSizeChanged sscEvent = (BaseActionEventScheduleSizeChanged)event;
                                order.setStart(sscEvent.getScheduleLeft());
                                order.setDuration(sscEvent.getScheduleWidth());
                            }
                        }
                    })
                    .setSizeratbothsides("true")
                    .setDragsticktocursor("false")
                    .setFocusable("true");
                nodes.add(node);
            }
            m_content.setContentNodes(nodes);
        }
        
        public void addOrder(MyOrder order)
        {
            i_orders.add(order);
            order.i_assignedRow = this;
            updateSchedule();
        }
        
        public void removeOrder(MyOrder order)
        {
            i_orders.remove(order);
            updateSchedule();
        }
        
        public void onScheduleAction(ActionEvent ae)
        {
            if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
            {
                BaseActionEventDrop baed = (BaseActionEventDrop)ae;
                String dropInfo = baed.getDragInfo();
                String orderKey = dropInfo.substring("order:".length());
                MyOrder order = m_orders.get(orderKey);
                // new start
                float percX = baed.getPercentageHorizontaAsFloat() + baed.getPercentageDeltaX();
                order.i_start = Math.round(percX / 100f * 480f);
                order.i_start = ((order.i_start+7) / 15) * 15;
                // reassign to new row
                order.i_assignedRow.removeOrder(order);
                addOrder(order);
            }
            else if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
            {
                BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem bae = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)ae;
                int start = Math.round((float)bae.getPercentageHorizontal() / 100f * 480f);  
                start = ((start+7) / 15) * 15;
                int duration = s_random.nextInt(100);
                MyOrder o = new MyOrder("New Order",start,duration,this);
                addOrder(o);
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    static Random s_random = new Random();
    static int s_orderId = 0;
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    Map<String,MyOrder> m_orders = new HashMap<String,MyOrder>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoScheduleGrid(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("schedule");
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setMachine("Machine " +  i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
            r.addOrder(new MyOrder("WO",s_random.nextInt(100),s_random.nextInt(100)+20,r));
            r.addOrder(new MyOrder("WO",250+s_random.nextInt(100),s_random.nextInt(120)+20,r));
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    public Map<String,MyOrder> getOrders() { return m_orders; }

}

Grid data export

Export - default or own

There is a default dialog that opens up when calling the FIXGRIDBinding-method "onOpenGridExportFunctions".

You also can embed the export directly into your own processing:

(.) FIXGRIDBinding.getExporter() provides the methods to create the data
(.) The data is passed into the TempFileManager so that it is reach-able by URL.
(.) The URL together with a Trigger-property is bound by a FILEDOWNLOAD component

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel}" >
<t:filedownload id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.onDownloadFinished}" trigger="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.downloadURL}" url="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.downloadURL}" withcallback="true" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:colsynchedpane id="g_9" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:colsynchedrow id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Open default export dialog:" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Default" width="200+" />
</t:colsynchedrow>
<t:colsynchedrowdistance id="g_2" height="10" />
<t:colsynchedrow id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="Start Export as part of &#34;own&#34; processing: " />
<t:button id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.onDownloadExcelAction}" text="Download Excel" width="200+" />
</t:colsynchedrow>
<t:colsynchedrow id="g_32" >
<t:coldistance id="g_33" />
<t:button id="g_34" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.onDownloadPdfAction}" text="Download PDF" width="200+" />
</t:colsynchedrow>
<t:colsynchedrow id="g_36" >
<t:coldistance id="g_37" />
<t:button id="g_38" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.onShowPdfAction}" text="Show PDF" width="200+" />
</t:colsynchedrow>
</t:colsynchedpane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_17" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_21" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_28" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_30" text="Last name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_13" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ServletUtil;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.tempfile.TempFileManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridExportExcel}")

public class DemoGridExportExcel
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Trigger m_downloadTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_downloadURL;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridExportExcel(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);     
        fillGrid();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridexportexcel.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridExportExcel}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public Trigger getDownloadTrigger() { return m_downloadTrigger; }

    public String getDownloadURL() { return m_downloadURL; }
    public void setDownloadURL(String value) { this.m_downloadURL = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public void onDownloadExcelAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        byte[] bytes = m_grid.getExporter().exportToXLSXWholeGrid(false);
        String contentType = "application/octet-stream"; // browser will/may download
        m_downloadURL = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("gridExport.xlsx",contentType,bytes);
        m_downloadTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onDownloadPdfAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        byte[] bytes = m_grid.getExporter().exportToPDFWholeGrid(false);
        String contentType = "application/octet-stream"; // browser will/may download
        m_downloadURL = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("gridExport.pdf",contentType,bytes);
        m_downloadTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onShowPdfAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        byte[] bytes = m_grid.getExporter().exportToPDFWholeGrid(false);
        String contentType = "application/pdf"; // browser will show URL and not download
        m_downloadURL = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("gridExport.pdf",contentType,bytes);
        m_downloadTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onDownloadFinished(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccessWithPopup("Download was successfully performed.");
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            gi.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

}

Extending PDF and Excel export

The default grid export to PDF and Excel can be fine-tuned.

1. By providing an implementation of interface "IFIXGRIDExportInfoProvider" formatting rules can be applied to the export. Most of the rules are considered both by the default PDF and by the default Excel export functions. - Please extend your implementation from class "DefaultFIXGRIDExportInfoProvider" in order to stay compatible for future extensions of the interface.

2. Both for PDF and for Excel processing the default export class can be extended. The classes is internally structured to allow extension - and provides corresponding extension points as protected methods that you can override.

You extended functions can be either set into the concrete grid instance - or you can define in general via system.xml that your extension class is to be chosen for all grids.

(Please note: in the demo code all classes are coded as inner classes in order to have a compact view on all the code that is involved. In reality you would write own, stand-alone classes for extending the PDF and Excel export functions.)

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridExcelExport}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridExcelExport}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridExcelExport.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_14" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridExcelExport.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Last name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Cell;
import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.CellStyle;
import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row;
import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet;
import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFFont;
import org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFWorkbook;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.ColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultFIXGRIDExportInfoProvider;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.FIXGRIDExcelExporter;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.FIXGRIDPDFExporter;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import com.lowagie.text.Document;
import com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;
import com.lowagie.text.Font;
import com.lowagie.text.Paragraph;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridExcelExport}")

public class DemoGridExcelExport
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * Excel exporter with special features, here: additional head lines in front
     * of the normal header row.
     */
    public class MyExcelExporter extends FIXGRIDExcelExporter
    {
        
        @Override
        protected void createBeforeHeader(XSSFWorkbook wb, Sheet sheet, FIXGRIDBinding fixgrid)
        {
            super.createBeforeHeader(wb, sheet, fixgrid);
            // headline
            {
                Row row = createRow(sheet);
                XSSFFont xfont = createHeaderFont(wb);
                xfont.setFontHeightInPoints((short)40);
                Cell cell = row.createCell(0);
                CellStyle cellStyle = wb.createCellStyle();
                cellStyle.setFont(xfont);
                cell.setCellStyle(cellStyle);
                cell.setCellValue("This is some headline for the excel data.");
            }
            // sub headline
            {
                Row row = createRow(sheet);
                XSSFFont xfont = createHeaderFont(wb);
                Cell cell = row.createCell(0);
                CellStyle cellStyle = wb.createCellStyle();
                cellStyle.setFont(xfont);
                cell.setCellStyle(cellStyle);
                cell.setCellValue("This is some sub-headline for the excel data.");
            }
            // distance row
            {
                createRow(sheet);
            }
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * PDF exporter with special features, here: additional head lines in front
     * of the normal header row.
     */
    public class MyPDFExporter extends FIXGRIDPDFExporter
    {
        final Font MYFONT_HEADLINE = new Font(Font.HELVETICA,Font.DEFAULTSIZE+2,Font.BOLD);
        final Font MYFONT_SUBHEADLINE = new Font(Font.HELVETICA,Font.DEFAULTSIZE-2,Font.NORMAL);
        @Override
        protected void beforeGrid(Document document, FIXGRIDBinding fixgrid, List<ColumnInfo> columns,
                List<List<String>> data)
        {
            try
            {
                Paragraph p = createParagraph("This is some headline for the PDF data.",MYFONT_HEADLINE,null);
                p.setSpacingAfter(10);
                document.add(p);
                p = createParagraph("This is some sub-headline for the PDF data.",MYFONT_SUBHEADLINE,null);
                p.setSpacingAfter(10);
                document.add(p);
            }
            catch (DocumentException exc)
            {
                CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"Problems when adding title to the PDF document",exc);
            }
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Interface for individual cell formatting.
     */
    public class MyExportInfoProvider extends DefaultFIXGRIDExportInfoProvider
    {
        final static String FIRSTNAME3COLOR = "#FFC0C0";
        final static String LASTNAME5COLOR = "#C0FFC0";
        @Override
        public String findBackgroundColorForDataCell(int rowIndex, String dataCellValue, ColumnInfo column)
        {
            if (column.getSortreference().equals("firstName"))
            {
                if (dataCellValue.contains("3")) return "#FFC0C0";
            }
            if (column.getSortreference().equals("lastName"))
            {
                if (dataCellValue.contains("5")) return "#C0FFC0";
            }
            return super.findBackgroundColorForDataCell(rowIndex, dataCellValue, column);
        }
        @Override
        public String findTextColorForDataCell(int rowIndex, String dataCellValue, ColumnInfo column)
        {
            if (column.getSortreference().equals("lastName"))
            {
                if (dataCellValue.contains("7")) return "#800000";
            }
            return super.findTextColorForDataCell(rowIndex, dataCellValue, column);
        }
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    MyPDFExporter m_pdfExporter = new MyPDFExporter();
    MyExcelExporter m_excelExporter = new MyExcelExporter();
    MyExportInfoProvider m_exportInfoProvider = new MyExportInfoProvider();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridExcelExport(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        // set file name for export
        m_grid.getExporter().setExportFilePrefix("SomeGreatGrid");
        // the overridden exporter can be either directly set in the individual
        // grid instance - or it can be set via system.xml for all grid instances
        m_grid.getExporter().setExcelExporter(m_excelExporter);
        m_grid.getExporter().setPDFExporter(m_pdfExporter);
        m_excelExporter.setExportInfoProvider(m_exportInfoProvider);
        m_pdfExporter.setExportInfoProvider(m_exportInfoProvider);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridexcelexport.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridExcelExport}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
}

Accessing client side value strings

Sometimes you want to get the client side text representation on server side as well - e.g. when exporting information.

In this case you can use the method "getItemColumnClientStringValue(...)" which is available with the server side grid object.

The method internally uses the class ValueManager with its methods "convertObject2DisplayString..." and passes the column configuration of the grid into the parameters of this method.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridGetClientTexts}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridGetClientTexts}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridGetClientTexts.grid}" persistid="CELLCLIENTTEXTS" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Birth date" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_11" format="date" formatmask="medium" text=".{birthDate}" timezone="CET" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Weight" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_14" format="float" formatmask="dec2" text=".{weight}" timezone="CET" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridGetClientTexts.onOutputTextAction}" text="Output client texts" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textarea id="g_20" height="150" text="#{d.DemoGridGetClientTexts.protcol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.ColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.READTYPE;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridGetClientTexts}")

public class DemoGridGetClientTexts
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        double i_weight;
        public double getWeight() { return i_weight; }
        public void setWeight(double value) { this.i_weight = value; }

        Date i_birthDate;
        public Date getBirthDate() { return i_birthDate; }
        public void setBirthDate(Date value) { this.i_birthDate = value; }

        String i_name;
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { this.i_name = value; }

        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    String m_protcol;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridGetClientTexts(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setName(RandomLogic.getLastName() + ", " + RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            gi.setBirthDate(new Date());
            gi.setWeight((float)RandomLogic.getHeight());
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridgetclienttexts.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridGetClientTexts}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOutputTextAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        List<ColumnInfo> cols = m_grid.getVisibleColumns();
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            int counter = 0;
            for (ColumnInfo col: cols)
            {
                if (counter != 0) sb.append(", ");
                String cv = m_grid.getItemColumnClientStringValue(gi,col,READTYPE.EXPORT);
                sb.append(cv);
                counter++;
            }
            sb.append("\n");
        }
        m_protcol = sb.toString();
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public String getProtcol() { return m_protcol; }
    public void setProtcol(String value) { this.m_protcol = value; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Special Issues

Fix Columns

By arranging two grids one to another you can achieve the effect of "fix columns".

You need to pay attention to that the left grid is always drawn with the same sizing as the right grid:
(.) same number of rows (SBVISIBLEAMOUNT)
(.) same horizontal scrollbar (HORIZONTALSCROLLMODE)
(.) same row height (ROWHEIGHT)

Typically the left grid is defined without explicit scrollbar on its own. Use attribute VERTICALSCROLLMODE to define so.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="5" />
<t:link id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns.gridleft.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:splitpane id="g_8" dividercolor="#00000030" dividerlocation="150" dividersize="10" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_9" >
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_11" height="100%" horizontalscrollmode="always" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns.gridleft}" rowpopupmenu="GRIDPOPUPMENU" sbvisibleamount="30" verticalscrollmode="hidden" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Id" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_13" background="#00000008" text=".{id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_15" background="#00000008" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_16" >
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_18" height="100%" horizontalscrollmode="always" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns.grid}" rowpopupmenu="GRIDPOPUPMENU" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%;200" >
<t:gridcol id="g_19" rendered="false" text="Id" width="50" >
<t:label id="g_20" text=".{id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_21" text="First Name" width="150" >
<t:label id="g_22" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" text="Street" width="150" >
<t:label id="g_24" text=".{street}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_25" text="Town" width="150" >
<t:label id="g_26" text=".{town}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_27" height="3" />
<t:row id="g_28" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_29" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns.onClearSelection}" text="Clear Selection" />
<t:button id="g_30" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns.onExplicitlySort}" text="Explicitly sort" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDPOPUPMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_31" command="CMD_REMOVE" text="Remove" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Collection;
import java.util.Set;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ArrayListWithChangeIndex;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns}")

public class DemoGridFixColumns
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_id;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_firstName;
        String m_street;
        String m_zipCode;
        String m_town;
        public void setId(String value) { m_id = value; }
        public String getId() { return m_id; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setZipCode(String value) { m_zipCode = value; }
        public String getZipCode() { return m_zipCode; }
        public void setTown(String value) { m_town = value; }
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            if ("CMD_REMOVE".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                removeSelectedItems();
            }
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Select: " + m_gridleft.isCurrentlyProcessingGridAction() + "/" + m_grid.isCurrentlyProcessingGridAction());
            // example: an item does not accept selection
            if ("23".equals(m_id))
            {
                m_grid.deselectItem(this);
            }
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Execute: " + m_gridleft.isCurrentlyProcessingGridAction() + "/" + m_grid.isCurrentlyProcessingGridAction());
        }
        
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    ArrayListWithChangeIndex<GridItem> m_items = new ArrayListWithChangeIndex<GridItem>();
