    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_gridleft = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructor
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridFixColumns(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // there are two grid instances - both sharing the same list
        // of items
        m_gridleft.setItems(m_items);
        m_grid.setItems(m_items);
        // both grids are connected in means of scrolling and selection
        m_gridleft.connectWithBinding(m_grid);
        fillGrid();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // methods
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGridleft() { return m_gridleft; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public int getNofSelectedItemsLeft() { return m_gridleft.getSelectedItems().size(); }
    public int getNofSelectedItems() { return m_grid.getSelectedItems().size(); }
    
    public void onClearSelection(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_gridleft.deselectCurrentSelection();
    }
    
    public void onClearAndRefill(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_items.clear();
        fillGrid();
    }
    
    public void onExplicitlySort(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_grid.sort("firstName",true);
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        sb.append(m_grid.getSbvalue()+"//");
        sb.append(m_gridleft.getSbvalue()+"//");
        Collection<GridItem> gis = m_grid.getSelectedItemsAsSequence();
        for (GridItem gi: gis)
            sb.append(gi.getId()+"/");
        sb.append("////");
        gis = m_gridleft.getSelectedItemsAsSequence();
        for (GridItem gi: gis)
            sb.append(gi.getId()+"/");
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage(sb.toString());
        return false;
    }
    
    private void removeSelectedItems()
    {
        Set<GridItem> gis = m_grid.getSelectedItems();
        for (GridItem gi: gis)
        {
            m_items.remove(gi);
        }
    }
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setId(""+i);
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            gi.setStreet("Street " + i);
            gi.setZipCode("Zipcode " + i);
            gi.setTown("Town " + i);
            m_items.add(gi);
        }
    }
}

Fix Columns (Array Grid)

...the same as in the previous example, but now an ARRAYGRID on the right side, no FIXGRID.

It is not possible to join two ARRAYGRID components in order to form a "fix-columns-grid", you have to join one FIXGRID ans one ARRAYGRID component as consequence.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns2}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns2.gridleft.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:splitpane id="g_6" dividercolor="#00000030" dividerlocation="150" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_7" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" border="0" borderheight="0" borderwidth="0" height="100%" horizontalscrollmode="always" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns2.gridleft}" sbvisibleamount="30" verticalscrollmode="hidden" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Id" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_11" background="#00000008" text=".{id}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_13" background="#00000008" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_14" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:arraygrid id="g_16" border="0" borderheight="0" borderwidth="0" height="100%" horizontalscrollmode="always" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns2.grid}" rowpopupmenu="RIGHTGRID" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%;200" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="RIGHTGRID" >
<t:menuitem id="g_18" command="CLEAR" text="Clear" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Collection;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ARRAYGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ArrayListWithChangeIndex;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridFixColumns}")

public class DemoGridFixColumns2
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    public class GridItem extends ARRAYGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_id;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_firstName;
        String m_street;
        String m_zipCode;
        String m_town;
        public void setId(String value) { m_id = value; }
        public String getId() { return m_id; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        @Override
        public Object[] getValues()
        {
            return new Object[] {m_firstName,m_street,m_zipCode,m_town};
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            super.onRowPopupMenuItem(event);
            if ("CLEAR".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_id = "";
                m_firstName = "";
                m_lastName = "";
                m_street = "";
                m_zipCode = "";
                m_town = "";
                // by default the ARRAYGRIDListBinding is created with supporting
                // change index management. Consequence: changes on item level
                // need to be explicitly passed!
                // (This is not required if creating the ARRAYGRIDListBinding instance
                // with the constructor in which you can pass "false" in the parameter
                // for change index support.
                getChangeIndex().indicateChange();
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("Cleared click info: " + m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection());
            }
        }
    }

    public DemoGridFixColumns2(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // there are two grid instances - both sharing the same list
        // of items
        m_gridleft.setItems(m_items);
        m_grid.setItems(m_items);
        // both grids are connected in means of scrolling and selection
        m_gridleft.connectWithBinding(m_grid);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setId(""+i);
            gi.m_firstName = "First " + i;
            gi.m_lastName = "Last " + i;
            gi.m_street = "Street " + i;
            gi.m_zipCode = "Zipcode " + i;
            gi.m_town = "Town " + i;
            m_items.add(gi);
        }
        m_grid.setTitles(new String[] {"First Name","Street","Zip Code","Town"});
        m_grid.setWidths(new String[] {"150","150","100","150"});
    }
 
    ArrayListWithChangeIndex<GridItem> m_items = new ArrayListWithChangeIndex<GridItem>();
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_gridleft = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGridleft() { return m_gridleft; }
    
    protected ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public ARRAYGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        sb.append(m_grid.getSbvalue()+"//");
        sb.append(m_gridleft.getSbvalue()+"//");
        Collection<GridItem> gis = m_grid.getSelectedItemsAsSequence();
        for (GridItem gi: gis)
            sb.append(gi.getId()+"/");
        sb.append("////");
        gis = m_gridleft.getSelectedItemsAsSequence();
        for (GridItem gi: gis)
            sb.append(gi.getId()+"/");
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage(sb.toString());
        return false;
    }
    
}

Re-selection of rows

This is something quite special about row selection: in the top grid a selection event is passed to the server side processing every time the user clicks onto a value - have a look onto the timestamp output within the statusbar message.

In the bottom grid, row selections are only sent to the server, when the user selects a line first time. Staying on the same line and re-selecting it will not cause any server side processing.

Please note: double clicks (onExecute() processing on server side) are always transferred.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridReselect}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="With reselection" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_5" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridReselect.rows1}" reselectable="true" sbvisibleamount="6" suppressheadline="true" >
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Value" width="200" >
<t:label id="g_7" text=".{value}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Without reselection (default)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_12" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridReselect.rows2}" sbvisibleamount="6" suppressheadline="true" >
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Value" width="200" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{value}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_15" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridReselect}")

public class DemoGridReselect
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public MyRow(String value)
        {
            m_value = value;
        }
        protected String m_value;
        public String getValue() { return m_value; }
        public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }
        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("SELECTION of row: " + m_value + " / Timestamp: " + (new Date()).getTime());
        }
        
    }
    
    public DemoGridReselect(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<25; i++)
        {
            m_rows1.getItems().add(new MyRow("Value " + i));
            m_rows2.getItems().add(new MyRow("Value " + i));
        }
    }
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows1 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows2 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows1() { return m_rows1; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows2() { return m_rows2; }

}

Client side scrolling

By default grid components do not show all items that are available on server side. Background: scalability! - If there are hundreds of items on server side, then only these items are transferred to the client that are currently shown to the user.

You can override this behavior and load all items to the client side, as shown in this example. To do so, you need to...:

(.) ...define the grid dynamically (ROWDYNAMICCONTENT)
(.) ...set the SBVISIBLEAMOUNT attribute dynamically, by re-building the grid when the value changes
(.) ...set the attribute NOSCROLLMODE to true

And...: you should pay attention...!

(.) Do not use this way of using the grid when working with hundreds of items! The memory consumption on server side, rendering speed on client side (for building up the grid) and the data volume that is exchanged between server and client will increase.
(.) Some Grid Functions that normally operate on the grid line index (like "ensureItemIsVisible") do not work anymore.
(.) The header area of the grid will be scrolled, and does not always stay on top. Same with footer.

Consequence: do only use this special usage type of the grid for very rare situations! It's a "side-usage-area" of the grid only!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowheader id="g_1" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_2" format="int" value="#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling.numberOfItems}" width="40" />
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling.onSetNumberOfItems}" text="Buidl Grid/Items" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="10" />
<t:colline id="g_6" background="#00000030" height="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="10" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_8" format="int" value="#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling.lineIndex}" width="40" />
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling.onFocusLine}" text="Show/Focus Line" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_11" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling}" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_13" background="#FFFFFF80" border="#00000030" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_14" contentbinding="#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling.gridContent}" />
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling}")

public class DemoGridClientScrolling
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        protected String m_firstName;
        
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    }

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    protected int m_lineIndex = 0;
    protected int m_numberOfItems = 50;
    protected ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_gridContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    protected String GRID_XML =
        "<t:fixgrid"+
        "    noscrollmode='true'"+
        "    objectbinding='#{d.DemoGridClientScrolling.grid}'"+
        "    sbvisibleamount='@@SBVISIBLEAMOUNT@@'"+
        "    verticalscrollmode='hidden' width='100%'>"+
        "    <t:gridcol text='First Name' width='50%'>"+
        "        <t:label text='.{firstName}' />"+
        "    </t:gridcol>"+
        "    <t:gridcol text='First Name' width='50%'>"+
        "        <t:label text='.{lastName}' />"+
        "    </t:gridcol>"+
        "</t:fixgrid>";

    
    public DemoGridClientScrolling(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        onSetNumberOfItems(null);
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public int getLineIndex() { return m_lineIndex; }
    public void setLineIndex(int value) { m_lineIndex = value; }
    
    public int getNumberOfItems() { return m_numberOfItems; }
    public void setNumberOfItems(int value) { m_numberOfItems = value; }
    
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getGridContent() { return m_gridContent; }

    public void onFocusLine(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
        if (m_lineIndex >= 0 && m_lineIndex < m_grid.getItems().size())
            m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(m_grid.getItems().get(m_lineIndex));
        else
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Wrong index...!");
    }

    public void onSetNumberOfItems(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_numberOfItems < 0)
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Index should be > 0!");
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        for (int i=0; i<m_numberOfItems; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("FN "+ i);
            gi.setLastName("LN " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
        m_gridContent.setContentXml(GRID_XML.replace("@@SBVISIBLEAMOUNT@@",""+m_numberOfItems));
    }

}

Mouse wheel delta

By setting attribute FIXGRID-MOUSEWHEELDELTA you can define the number of rows that are scrolled per mouse wheel movement.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridMouseWheelDelta}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Mouse wheel delta" width="120" />
<t:combobox id="g_4" editable="false" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoGridMouseWheelDelta.mouseWheelDelta}" width="50" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_5" text="1" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_6" text="2" value="2" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_7" text="3" value="3" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" drawoddevenrows="true" height="100%" mousewheeldelta="#{d.DemoGridMouseWheelDelta.mouseWheelDelta}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridMouseWheelDelta.grid}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridMouseWheelDelta}")

public class DemoGridMouseWheelDelta
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }

        String i_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }

    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_mouseWheelDelta = 1;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridMouseWheelDelta(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<1000; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridmousewheeldelta.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridMouseWheelDelta}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getMouseWheelDelta() { return m_mouseWheelDelta; }
    public void setMouseWheelDelta(int value) { this.m_mouseWheelDelta = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grid cell border

By default the border of a component that is used as grid cell is cleared out by the grid management. Reason: a grid does not look nice, if all cell components (e.g. buttons, fields) come with their own border rendering - especially if there is some additional grid cell border.

You can override this behavior by using attribute GRIDCOL-KEEPCELLBORDER. If settin the attribute to "true" then the border of the cell component will explicitly be rendered - there is no implicit clearing.

In the grid of this example you see the first column being rendered as default column: the contained FIELD component has some border, but this is cleared by the grid processing. The second column is defined to keep the border - and as consequence it is rendered accordingly.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellBorder}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridCellBorder.grid}" sbvisibleamount="35" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" keepcellborder="false" text="First Name" width="50%;100" >
<t:field id="g_5" border="#FF0000" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" keepcellborder="true" text="First Name" width="50%;100" >
<t:field id="g_7" border="#FF0000" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridCellBorder}")

public class DemoGridCellBorder
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }

        String i_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }

        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private IListener m_listener;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridCellBorder(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " +i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridcellborder.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridCellBorder}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Fix columns with tree

This example shows how to bind two tree in a way that they form a fix-column-scenario.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeFixColumns}" >
<t:row id="g_1" >
<t:splitpane id="g_7" dividerlocation="200" height="100%" orientation="horizontal" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_8" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" height="100%" horizontalscrollmode="always" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeFixColumns.treeLeft}" sbvisibleamount="25" verticalscrollmode="hidden" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Tree" width="100%" >
<t:treenode id="g_14" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_9" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_16" height="100%" horizontalscrollmode="always" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTreeFixColumns.treeRight}" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_17" text="First Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_18" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="Last Name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_20" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTreeFixColumns}")

public class DemoTreeFixColumns
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyTreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public MyTreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
        public void onToggle()
        {
        }
        public String getLastName()
        {
            return i_lastName;
        }
        public String getFirstName()
        {
            return i_firstName;
        }
    }


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyTreeNode> m_treeRight = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyTreeNode>();
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyTreeNode> m_treeLeft = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyTreeNode>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTreeFixColumns(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        MyTreeNode root = new MyTreeNode(null);
        m_treeLeft.setRootNode(root);
        m_treeRight.setRootNode(root);
        m_treeLeft.connectWithBinding(m_treeRight);
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            MyTreeNode top = new MyTreeNode(root);
            top.setText("Top " + i);
            top.setStatus(MyTreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                MyTreeNode sub = new MyTreeNode(top);
                sub.setText("Sub " + i + "/" + j);
                sub.i_firstName = "First Name " + i + "/" + j;
                sub.i_lastName = "Last Name " + i + "/" + j;
                sub.setStatus(MyTreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
            }
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotreefixcolumns.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTreeFixColumns}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyTreeNode> getTreeRight() { return m_treeRight; }
    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<MyTreeNode> getTreeLeft() { return m_treeLeft; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Synchronized horizontal scrolling

There are situations in which you want to synchronize the horizontal scrolling of the grid content across multiple grids.

To do so:

1. Define an explicit ID for the grid that is the one to scroll.
2. From the other grid reference this ID by using the attribute SCROLLREFERENCEHORIZONTAL.
3. Make sure that the width of both grids is the same (i.e. the width of the contained columns).

In the example both grids are listening to one another, so that the user can both scroll in the top and in the bottom grid.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollingSynch}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="MASTERGRID1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollingSynch.grid1}" sbvisibleamount="5" scrollreferencehorizontal="MASTERGRID2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_3" text="Name" width="2500" >
<t:label id="g_4" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="MASTERGRID2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScrollingSynch.grid2}" sbvisibleamount="5" scrollreferencehorizontal="MASTERGRID1" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_6" columnresizingenabled="false" text="Street" width="1250" >
<t:label id="g_7" text=".{street}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" columnresizingenabled="false" text="Street" width="1250" >
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{city}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridScrollingSynch}")

public class DemoGridScrollingSynch
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem1 extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_name;
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
    }

    public class GridItem2 extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_street;
        String i_city;
        public String getStreet() { return i_street; }
        public String getCity() { return i_city; }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem1> m_grid1 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem1>();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem2> m_grid2 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem2>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridScrollingSynch(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            GridItem1 gi = new GridItem1();
            gi.i_name = "Name " + i;
            m_grid1.getItems().add(gi);
        }
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            GridItem2 gi = new GridItem2();
            gi.i_street = "Street " + i;
            gi.i_city = "City " + i;
            m_grid2.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridscrollingsynch.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridScrollingSynch}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem2> getGrid2() { return m_grid2; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem1> getGrid1() { return m_grid1; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Explicit paging bar (PBC)

The page bean component CCGridPager allows to scroll through grid data using a "web style" navigation bar.

The page bean component is part of the addong package (eclnt_pbc).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCGridPager}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCGridPager}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_2" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCGridPager.grid}" selectorcolumn="2" selectorcolumnwidth="60" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_3" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Last name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_12" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCGridPager.pager}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCGridPager" pagebeaninitdata="pagesAfter:4;pagesBefore:4" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCGridPager;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCGridPager}")

public class DemoPBCCCGridPager
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCGridPager m_pager = new CCGridPager();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCGridPager(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        m_pager.prepare(m_grid,null);
        for (int i=0; i<125; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("First name " + (i+1));
            gi.setLastName("Last name " + (i+1));
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccgridpager.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCGridPager}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCGridPager getPager() { return m_pager; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grid scroll bar style

The grid's own style (attribute STYLESEQ) points to the style class that defines the scroll container that manages the vertical scrolling of the grid items.

The default style class is "riscscrollcontainer". There is an alternative "riscscrollcontainer_dark" in which the rendering of the scroll bar is done in dark colors.

Of course you can set up own styles for the scroll container and the included scroll bar by extending style "riscscrollcontainer".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoGridStyle}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridStyle}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Normal scrollbar" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridStyle.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Dark scrollbar" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_15" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridStyle.grid}" styleseq="riscscrollcontainer_dark" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_19" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridStyle}")

public class DemoGridStyle
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridStyle(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        initGridData();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridstyle.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridStyle}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initGridData()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            gi.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

}

Individual column borders

By using attributes GRIDCOL-BORDERWIDTH and GRIDCOL-BORDERCOLOR you can explicitly define the cell border between the columns - and by this override the definitions that are done on FIXGRID level.

Please be aware of: the border is always between two columns! There is explicitly no border drawn for the right most column. Nevertheless you may define it - the user may change the column sequence, so that the most right column will be moved into grid...

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFixgridCellBorder}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFixgridCellBorder}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFixgridCellBorder.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" bordercolor="#800000" borderwidth="1" text="First name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{person.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" bordercolor="#008000" borderwidth="2" text="Last name" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{person.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" bordercolor="#000080" borderwidth="3" text="Birthday" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_15" format="date" text=".{person.birthDay}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_17" bordercolor="#808080" borderwidth="1" text="Id" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_18" text=".{person.id}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFixgridCellBorder}")

public class DemoFixgridCellBorder
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Person i_person;
        public GridItem(Person person)
        {
            i_person = person;
        }
        public Person getPerson() { return i_person; }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFixgridCellBorder(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        fillGrid();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofixgridcellborder.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFixgridCellBorder}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(RandomLogic.createPerson()));
    }

}

Repeat Processing

REPEAT Component

The REPEAT in this example binds to some simple List on server side. For each item of the list, the content below the REPEAT component is repeated.

In the controls below the REPEAT component, you reference the properties and methods of the item by using the ".{...}" expression notation in order to bind to the corresponding item.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRepeat}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" text="Some repeated rows..." >
<t:repeat id="g_4" listbinding="#{d.DemoRepeat.items}" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="5" >
<t:checkbox id="g_7" selected=".{selected}" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="5" />
<t:field id="g_9" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_10" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener=".{onClear}" text="Clear" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="5" />
</t:repeat>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_14" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoRepeat.onAddItemAction}" text="Add one item" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoRepeat.onRemoveItemsAction}" text="Remove selected items" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoRepeat.onUpdateItemsAction}" text="Update items" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRepeat}")

public class DemoRepeat
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class Item
    {    
        boolean m_selected = false;
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; }
        public boolean getSelected() { return m_selected; }
        public void setSelected(boolean value) { this.m_selected = value; }
        public void onClear(ActionEvent event) 
        {
            i_firstName = null;
            i_lastName = null;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    List<Item> m_items = new ArrayList<Item>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRepeat(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            Item it = new Item();
            it.i_firstName = "First " + i;
            it.i_lastName = "Last " + i;
            m_items.add(it);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorepeat.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRepeat}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public List<Item> getItems() { return m_items; }
    
    public void onAddItemAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Item it = new Item();
        it.i_firstName = "New item";
        it.i_lastName = "New item";
        m_items.add(it);
    }

    public void onRemoveItemsAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        for (int i=m_items.size()-1; i>=0; i--)
        {
            Item item = m_items.get(i);
            if (item.getSelected() == true)
            {
                m_items.remove(i);
            }
        }
    }

    public void onUpdateItemsAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        for (Item item: m_items)
        {
            item.i_firstName += "#";
            item.i_lastName += "#";
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Nesting REPEAT Components

It is possible to nest REPEAT components into other REPEAT components.

In this example the outside REPEAT component binds to a list of departments. Each department item itself provides a list of employees.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatRepeat}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" rowdistance="10" width="100%" >
<t:repeat id="g_4" listbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatRepeat.departments}" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:pane id="g_6" background="#00000008" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{id}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Name" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{text}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_15" background="#00000008" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" font="weight:bold" text="Empoyee Id" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_18" font="weight:bold" text="Employee Name" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:repeat id="g_19" listbinding=".{employees}" >
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text=".{id}" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_22" text=".{name}" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:repeat>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:repeat>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRepeatRepeat}")

public class DemoRepeatRepeat
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Employee
    {
        String i_id;
        String i_name;
        public String getId() { return i_id; }
        public Employee setId(String id) { i_id = id; return this; }
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public Employee setName(String name) { i_name = name; return this; }
    }
    
    public class Department
    {
        String i_id;
        String i_text;
        List<Employee> i_employees = new ArrayList<Employee>();
        public String getId() { return i_id; }
        public Department setId(String id) { i_id = id; return this; }
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public Department setText(String text) { i_text = text; return this; }
        public Department addEmployee(Employee e) { i_employees.add(e); return this; }
        public List<Employee> getEmployees() { return i_employees; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    List<Department> m_departments = new ArrayList<Department>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRepeatRepeat(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_departments.add
        (
            new Department()
            .setId("001")
            .setText("Human Resources")
            .addEmployee(new Employee().setId("0001").setName("John Wayne"))
            .addEmployee(new Employee().setId("0002").setName("Mark Twain"))
        );
        m_departments.add
        (
            new Department()
            .setId("002")
            .setText("Sales")
            .addEmployee(new Employee().setId("0003").setName("Hugo Egon Balder"))
            .addEmployee(new Employee().setId("0004").setName("Wolfgang Ambross"))
            .addEmployee(new Employee().setId("0005").setName("Loriot"))
        );
        m_departments.add
        (
            new Department()
            .setId("003")
            .setText("Production")
            .addEmployee(new Employee().setId("0006").setName("Henry Ford"))
            .addEmployee(new Employee().setId("0007").setName("Robert Bosch"))
        );
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorepeatrepeat.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRepeatRepeat}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public List<Department> getDepartments() { return m_departments; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Server side scrolling

"Normally" the REPEAT binds to a server side list of items. This may have the reulst of long lists being sent from the server to the client which means a problem both from performance and from end user point of view.

As consequence the server side scrolling that you may know from the FIXGRID component already is used for the REPEAT component as well:

On server side you do NOT manage the items within a straigh list, but within a "ServerSideScrollList". This list always provides these items to the client which are currently displayed. You can control the number of items by using the method setNumberOfItems() within the instance of the "special" list.

Within the demo a simple SCROLLBAR component is attached to the right of the pane. The scrollbar binds to the properties of the ServerSideScrollList-instance.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:pane id="g_5" background="#00000008" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" font="weight:bold" text="First Name" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_8" font="weight:bold" text="Last Name" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:repeat id="g_9" listbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items}" >
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{firstName}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:repeat>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_13" height="100%" >
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:scrollbar id="g_15" flush="true" height="100%" orientation="vertical" sbmaxvalue="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.maxIndex}" sbminvalue="0" sbsize="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.numberOfItems}" value="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.topIndex}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.onScrollPageUpAction}" enabled="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.scrollPageUpPossible}" text="Previous" width="80" />
<t:label id="g_18" align="center" text="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.positionText}" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.onScrollPageDownAction}" enabled="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling.items.scrollPageDownPossible}" text="Next" width="80" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ServerSideScrollList;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling}")

public class DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class Item
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { m_firstName = firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { m_lastName = lastName; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    ServerSideScrollList<Item> m_items = new ServerSideScrollList<Item>(); 
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<45; i++)
        {
            Item it = new Item();
            it.setFirstName("First " + i);
            it.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_items.getItems().add(it);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorepeatserversidescrolling.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRepeatServerSideScrolling}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ServerSideScrollList<Item> getItems() { return m_items; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

REPEAT inside Grid

The REPEAT component can be used inside a grid cell as well. In the example the number of addresses is different per item - a corresponding ROW-LABEL combination is created by the REPEAT component.

...of course pay attention: using a REPEAT inside a grid may cause quite a lot of components to be generated and managed internally!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithRepeat}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridWithRepeat.grid}" rowheight="50" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Name" width="150" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Address(es)" width="100%" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_7" >
<t:repeat id="g_8" listbinding=".{addresses}" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{address}" />
</t:row>
</t:repeat>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridWithRepeat}")

public class DemoGridWithRepeat
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class AddressesItem extends Object implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_address;
        public AddressesItem(String address)
        {
            m_address = address;
        }
        public String getAddress() { return m_address; }
    }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_name;
        List<AddressesItem> m_addresses = new ArrayList<AddressesItem>();
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { this.m_name = value; }
        public List<AddressesItem> getAddresses() { return m_addresses; }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridWithRepeat(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        Random r = new Random();
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setName("Name " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            int jMax = r.nextInt(6);
            for (int j=0; j<jMax; j++)
            {
                AddressesItem ai = new AddressesItem("Address " + i + "/" + j);
                gi.m_addresses.add(ai);
            }
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridwithrepeat.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridWithRepeat}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grid inside REPEAT

This demo shows a FIXGRID component that is nested within a REPEAT component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatWithGrid}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:repeat id="g_2" listbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatWithGrid.list}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text=".{departmentName}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" horizontalscrollmode="autowithresize" objectbinding=".{grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" showemptyrows="false" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:repeat>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRepeatWithGrid}")

public class DemoRepeatWithGrid
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        
    }
    
    public class ListItem extends Object implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_departmentName;
        FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> i_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
        public String getDepartmentName() { return i_departmentName; }
        public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return i_grid; }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    List<ListItem> m_list = new ArrayList<ListItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRepeatWithGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        Random r = new Random();
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            ListItem li = new ListItem();
            li.i_departmentName = "Department " + i;
            m_list.add(li);
            int jMax = r.nextInt(10);
            for (int j=0; j<jMax; j++)
            {
                GridItem gi = new GridItem();
                li.i_grid.getItems().add(gi);
                gi.i_firstName = "First Name " + i + "/" + j;
                gi.i_lastName = "Last Name " + i + "/" + j;
            }
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorepeatwithgrid.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRepeatWithGrid}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public List<ListItem> getList() { return m_list; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Image Selection

This demo shows some combination out of the components...

ROWFLEXLINE
REPEAT.

Select an image on the left and it will be shown in the right area.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatImages}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:splitpane id="g_3" dividerlocation="270" height="100%" width="100%;500" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_4" background="#00000008" padding="left:5;right:0;top:1;bottom:1" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_6" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_7" >
<t:repeat id="g_8" listbinding="#{d.DemoRepeatImages.images}" >
<t:image id="g_9" actionListener=".{onClickAction}" background=".{background}" border="left:5;right:5;top:5;bottom:5;color:#00000000" height="65" image=".{image}" invokeevent="leftclick" width="80" />
</t:repeat>
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_10" background="#00000008" padding="20" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:image id="g_12" height="100%" image="#{d.DemoRepeatImages.selectedImage}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRepeatImages}")

public class DemoRepeatImages
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    List<ImagesItem> m_images = new ArrayList<ImagesItem>();
    public List<ImagesItem> getImages() { return m_images; }
    public void setImages(List<ImagesItem> value) { this.m_images = value; }

    public class ImagesItem extends Object implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        public void onClickAction(ActionEvent event) 
        {
            for (ImagesItem ii: m_images)
            {
                if (ii == this)
                {
                    ii.setSelected(true);
                    m_selectedImage = ii.getImage();
                }
                else
                {
                    ii.setSelected(false);
                }
            }
        }

        public String getBackground() 
        { 
            return m_selected ? "#FFCC0050" : null; 
        }

        boolean m_selected;
        public boolean getSelected() { return m_selected; }
        public void setSelected(boolean value) { this.m_selected = value; }

        String m_image;
        public String getImage() { return m_image; }
        public void setImage(String value) { this.m_image = value; }

    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_selectedImage = null;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRepeatImages(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);      
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            ImagesItem ii = new ImagesItem();
            ii.setImage("/images/pictures/ph"+(i%8)+".jpg");
            m_images.add(ii);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorepeatimages.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRepeatImages}"; }
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getSelectedImage()
    {
        return m_selectedImage;
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Bean data grid (PBC)

Straight usage

The page bean component CCDataGridView2 renders a list of beans into a grid.

In the header are of the grid there are filter components - the components respect the column's data type, so that a String filter is different to e.g. a Date-filter.

The page bean component is configured by configuration items, each item pointing to the corresponding property of the bean class, that is managed within the grid.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple}" >
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple.dataView.grid.onOpenGridExportFunctions}" text="Export..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<tpbc:datagridview2 id="g_8" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple.dataView}" persistId="demopbcccdatagridview2simple" shownullcontent="true" withCrossColumnFilter="true" >
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_29" description="First name of the person" propertyName="firstName" title="First name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_30" propertyName="lastName" title="Last name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_32" propertyName="height" title="Height" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_34" propertyName="married" title="Married" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_36" propertyName="gender" title="Gender" />
</tpbc:datagridview2>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple}")

public class DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public enum ENUMGender
    {
        MALE,
        FEMALE,
        DIVERSE
    }
    
    /** 
     * The bean... This normally is an own class. In the demo it
     * is an inner class so that all code is kept within the
     * demo class.
     */
    public static class TestPerson
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        int i_height;
        LocalDate i_birthDate;
        boolean i_married;
        ENUMGender i_gender;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
