        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; }
        public LocalDate getBirthDate() { return i_birthDate; }
        public boolean isMarried() { return i_married; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; }
        public void setHeight(int height) { i_height = height; }
        public void setBirthDate(LocalDate birthDate) { i_birthDate = birthDate; }
        public void setMarried(boolean married) { i_married = married; }
        public ENUMGender getGender() { return i_gender; }
        public void setGender(ENUMGender gender) { i_gender = gender; } 
    }

    /**
     * Listener to the data grid view's listener so that in order to 
     * react on events of the grid processing.
     */
    public class MyDGVListener extends CCDataGridView2.DefaultListener<TestPerson>
    {
        @Override
        public void reactOnGridSelect(TestPerson object)
        {
            reactOnItemSelection(object);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCDataGridView2<TestPerson> m_dataView = new CCDataGridView2<TestPerson>(TestPerson.class);

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillData();
        initialSort();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccdatagridview2simple.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCDataGridView2<TestPerson> getDataView() { return m_dataView; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void reactOnItemSelection(TestPerson object)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection of item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName());
    }

    private void fillData()
    {
        List<TestPerson> ps = new ArrayList<TestPerson>();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            TestPerson p = new TestPerson();
            p.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            p.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            p.setHeight(RandomLogic.getHeight());
            p.setMarried(i%2 == 0);
            p.setBirthDate(RandomLogic.getBirthDate());
            p.setGender(ENUMGender.FEMALE);
            if (i%2 == 0) p.setGender(ENUMGender.MALE);
            if (i%9 == 4) p.setGender(ENUMGender.DIVERSE);
            ps.add(p);
        }
        m_dataView.prepare(ps,new MyDGVListener());
    }

    private void initialSort()
    {
        m_dataView.getGrid().sort("object.firstName",true);
    }

    
}

With popup menu

This example demonstrates how to add popup menu items to the data grid view.

1. set the initialization parameter "withPopupMenu" to true in the page bean component
2. implement the methods "reactOnPopupMenuLoad" and "reactOnPopupMenuLoadInvoke" within your implementation

Please not: any time you update the list of objects that is managed within the grid processing, then you have to explicit refresh the grid by calling method "refreshData".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2PopupMenu}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2PopupMenu}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_8" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2PopupMenu.dataView}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2" pagebeaninitdata="withPopupMenu:true" shownullcontent="true" >
<t:pagebeanconfig id="g_22" configparams="propertyName:firstName;title:First name" configtype="ConfigurationColumn" />
<t:pagebeanconfig id="g_11" configparams="propertyName:lastName;title:Last name" configtype="ConfigurationColumn" />
<t:pagebeanconfig id="g_23" configparams="propertyName:height;title:Height" configtype="ConfigurationColumn" />
<t:pagebeanconfig id="g_16" configparams="propertyName:birthDate;title:Birth data" configtype="ConfigurationColumn" />
<t:pagebeanconfig id="g_20" configparams="propertyName:married;title:Married" configtype="ConfigurationColumn" />
</t:pagebeancomponent>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2;
import org.eclnt.ccee.util.CloneUtil;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2PopupMenu}")

public class DemoPBCCCDataGridView2PopupMenu
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /** 
     * The bean... This normally is an own class. In the demo it
     * is an inner class so that all code is kept within the
     * demo class.
     */
    public static class TestPerson implements Serializable
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        int i_height;
        LocalDate i_birthDate;
        boolean i_married;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; }
        public LocalDate getBirthDate() { return i_birthDate; }
        public boolean isMarried() { return i_married; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; }
        public void setHeight(int height) { i_height = height; }
        public void setBirthDate(LocalDate birthDate) { i_birthDate = birthDate; }
        public void setMarried(boolean married) { i_married = married; }
    }

    /**
     * Listener to the data grid view's listener so that in order to 
     * react on events of the grid processing.
     */
    public class MyDGVListener extends CCDataGridView2.DefaultListener<TestPerson>
    {
        @Override
        public void reactOnGridSelect(TestPerson object)
        {
            reactOnItemSelection(object);
        }
        @Override
        public void reactOnPopupMenuLoad(TestPerson object, DYNAMICCONTENTBinding dynPopupMenuContent)
        {
            List<ComponentNode> l = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
            l.add(new MENUITEMNode()
                    .setText("Delete Item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName())
                    .setCommand("DELETEITEM"));
            l.add(new MENUITEMNode()
                    .setText("Duplicate Item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName())
                    .setCommand("DUPLICATEITEM"));
            dynPopupMenuContent.setContentNodes(l);
        }
        @Override
        public void reactOnPopupMenuItemInvoke(TestPerson object, BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            if ("DELETEITEM".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                deleteItem(object);
            }
            else if ("DUPLICATEITEM".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                duplicateItem(object);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCDataGridView2<TestPerson> m_dataView = new CCDataGridView2<TestPerson>(TestPerson.class);
    List<TestPerson> m_persons = new ArrayList<TestPerson>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCDataGridView2PopupMenu(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillData();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccdatagridview2popupmenu.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2PopupMenu}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCDataGridView2<TestPerson> getDataView() { return m_dataView; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void reactOnItemSelection(TestPerson object)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection of item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName());
    }

    private void deleteItem(final TestPerson object)
    {
        YESNOPopup.createInstance("Deletion of item","Do you really want to remove the selected item?",new IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes() { deleteItemExecute(object); }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo() {}
        });
    }

    private void deleteItemExecute(TestPerson object)
    {
        m_persons.remove(object);
        m_dataView.refreshData(m_persons);
    }

    private void duplicateItem(TestPerson object)
    {
        TestPerson clone = CloneUtil.createClone(object);
        int index = m_persons.indexOf(object);
        m_persons.add(index+1,clone);
        m_dataView.refreshData(m_persons);
    }

    private void fillData()
    {
        m_persons.clear();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            TestPerson p = new TestPerson();
            p.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            p.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            p.setHeight(RandomLogic.getHeight());
            p.setMarried(i%2 == 0);
            p.setBirthDate(RandomLogic.getBirthDate());
            m_persons.add(p);
        }
        m_dataView.prepare(m_persons,new MyDGVListener());
    }

}

With own columns

This example demonstrates how to extend the data grid view with own components.

Inside the layout you can position components of type DATAGRIDVIEW2COLUMNEXIT. With each of the components you define an EXITID.

In your implementation you extends the CCDataGridView2 class and implement corresponding renderExit* methods. There are two types of renderExit* methods - one for rendering single nodes and the one for a list of nodes that can be passed back. In the example the "single node"-type methods are implemented.

By default you need to also extend the data grid view's item class, so that your own components can access data or invoke functions correspondingly.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2OwnControls}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2OwnControls}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<tpbc:datagridview2 id="g_3" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2OwnControls.dataView}" shownullcontent="true" >
<tpbc:datagridview2columnexit id="g_5" exitId="IMAGE" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_25" propertyName="firstName" title="First name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_27" propertyName="lastName" title="Last  name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_29" propertyName="height" title="Height" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_31" propertyName="birthDate" title="Date of birth" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_33" propertyName="married" title="Married" />
<tpbc:datagridview2columnexit id="g_6" exitId="MARRIED" />
</tpbc:datagridview2>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.ConfigurationColumnExit;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.IMAGENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass(expressionBase = "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2OwnControls}")

public class DemoPBCCCDataGridView2OwnControls extends PageBean implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * The bean... This normally is an own class. In the demo it is an inner class
     * so that all code is kept within the demo class.
     */
    public static class TestPerson
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        int i_height;
        LocalDate i_birthDate;
        boolean i_married;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; } 
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; } 
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; } 
        public LocalDate getBirthDate() { return i_birthDate; } 
        public boolean isMarried() { return i_married; } 
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; } 
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; } 
        public void setHeight(int height) { i_height = height; } 
        public void setBirthDate(LocalDate birthDate) { i_birthDate = birthDate; } 
        public void setMarried(boolean married) { i_married = married; }
    }

    /**
     * Extension of CCDataGridView2. In the extension the creation of components is
     * updated, so that own controls are added. There are corresponding after* and
     * before* methods that are called during the generation of the actual components.
     * 
     * Please note: there is the rendering of the filter header and the rendering of
     * the grid columns! Both have to be in synch: if adding a new column you have
     * to embed own components at both places!
     */
    public class MyDGV extends CCDataGridView2<TestPerson>
    {
        /**
         * Extended implementation of GridItem - providing the data and functions that
         * is required for the additional components. In the method "createGridItem"
         * (see code below) you need to create the correct GridItem.
         */
        public class MyDGVGridItem extends GridItem
        {
            String i_avatarImage;
            public MyDGVGridItem(TestPerson object)
            {
                super(object);
                i_avatarImage = RandomLogic.getAvatarImage(object.getLastName(), object.getFirstName());
            }
            public String getAvatarImage() { return i_avatarImage; }
            public void onRemoveAction(ActionEvent event)
            {
                deleteItem(getObject());
            }
        }
        public MyDGV()
        {
            super(TestPerson.class);
        }
        @Override
        protected GridItem createGridItem(TestPerson object)
        {
            // return the extended item - and not use the default one!
            return new MyDGVGridItem(object);
        }
        @Override
        protected GRIDCOLNode renderExitGRIDCOLNode(ConfigurationColumnExit columnExit)
        {
            if ("IMAGE".equals(columnExit.getExitId()))
            {
                GRIDCOLNode gc = new GRIDCOLNode()
                    .setText("")
                    .setWidth("40");
                IMAGENode in = new IMAGENode()
                    .setImage(".{avatarImage}")
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .setImageheight(30).
                    setImagewidth(30).
                    setKeepratiofitmode("cover");
                gc.addSubNode(in);
                return gc;
            }
            else if ("MARRIED".equals(columnExit.getExitId()))
            {
                GRIDCOLNode gc = new GRIDCOLNode()
                    .setText("")
                    .setWidth("80");
                BUTTONNode bt = new BUTTONNode()
                        .setText("Remove...")
                        .setActionListener(".{onRemoveAction}");
                gc.addSubNode(bt);
                return gc;
            }
            else
            {
                return super.renderExitGRIDCOLNode(columnExit);
            }
        }
        @Override
        protected ComponentNode renderExitHeaderColumnNode(ConfigurationColumnExit columnExit)
        {
            if ("IMAGE".equals(columnExit.getExitId()) || 
                "MARRIED".equals(columnExit.getExitId()))
            {
                PANENode p = new PANENode().setStylevariant("ccaddons_datagridview2_filter");
                return p;
            }
            else
            {
                return super.renderExitHeaderColumnNode(columnExit);
            }
        }
    }

    /**
     * Listener to the data grid view's listener so that in order to react on events
     * of the grid processing.
     */
    public class MyDGVListener extends CCDataGridView2.DefaultListener<TestPerson>
    {
        @Override
        public void reactOnGridSelect(TestPerson object)
        {
            reactOnItemSelection(object);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    MyDGV m_dataView = new MyDGV();
    List<TestPerson> m_persons = new ArrayList<TestPerson>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCDataGridView2OwnControls(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        fillData();
    }

    public String getPageName()
    {
        return "/workplace/demopbcccdatagridview2owncontrols.xml";
    }

    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage()
    {
        return "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2OwnControls}";
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCDataGridView2<TestPerson> getDataView()
    {
        return m_dataView;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void deleteItem(final TestPerson object)
    {
        YESNOPopup.createInstance("Deletion of item","Do you really want to remove the selected item?",new IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes() { deleteItemExecute(object); }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo() {}
        });
    }

    private void deleteItemExecute(TestPerson object)
    {
        m_persons.remove(object);
        m_dataView.refreshData(m_persons);
    }

    private void reactOnItemSelection(TestPerson object)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection of item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName());
    }

    private void fillData()
    {
        m_persons.clear();
        ;
        for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
        {
            TestPerson p = new TestPerson();
            p.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            p.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            p.setHeight(RandomLogic.getHeight());
            p.setMarried(i % 2 == 0);
            p.setBirthDate(RandomLogic.getBirthDate());
            m_persons.add(p);
        }
        m_dataView.prepare(m_persons, new MyDGVListener());
    }

}

With own header / footer

This demo shows how to add additional header and footer elements in the data grid view.

Please pay attention: the number of components that you add to the header/footer must exactly match the number of columns.

Please also take a look onto the calculation of the average height in the footer: the corresponding calculation is triggered by some IListener-event ("reactOnGridFiltered") and it uses method "getCurrentlyShownObjects" to obtain the list of items that is currently filtered.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter}" >
<t:row id="g_25" >
<tpbc:datagridview2 id="g_2" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter.dataView}" shownullcontent="true" >
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_35" propertyName="firstName" title="First name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_27" propertyName="lastName" title="Last  name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_29" propertyName="height" title="Height" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_31" propertyName="birthDate" title="Date of birth" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_33" propertyName="married" title="Married" />
</tpbc:datagridview2>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIXGRIDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDFOOTERNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDHEADERNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter}")

public class DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /** 
     * The bean... This normally is an own class. In the demo it
     * is an inner class so that all code is kept within the
     * demo class.
     */
    public static class TestPerson
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        int i_height;
        LocalDate i_birthDate;
        boolean i_married;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; }
        public LocalDate getBirthDate() { return i_birthDate; }
        public boolean isMarried() { return i_married; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; }
        public void setHeight(int height) { i_height = height; }
        public void setBirthDate(LocalDate birthDate) { i_birthDate = birthDate; }
        public void setMarried(boolean married) { i_married = married; }
    }

    /**
     * Listener to the data grid view's listener so that in order to 
     * react on events of the grid processing.
     */
    public class MyDGVListener extends CCDataGridView2.DefaultListener<TestPerson>
    {
        @Override
        public void reactOnGridSelect(TestPerson object)
        {
            reactOnItemSelection(object);
        }
        @Override
        public void reactOnGridFiltered()
        {
            refreshAverageHeight();
        }
    }
    
    public class MyDGV extends CCDataGridView2<TestPerson>
    {
        public MyDGV()
        {
            super(TestPerson.class);
        }
        @Override
        protected void beforeRenderHeader(FIXGRIDNode grid)
        {
            // add 2 additional rows before the filter header line
            for (int i=0; i<2; i++)
            {
                GRIDHEADERNode ghn = new GRIDHEADERNode();
                grid.addSubNode(ghn);
                // add components for the inidvidual components
                String background = "#C0C0FF";
                ghn.addSubNode(new BUTTONNode().setText("This").setBackground(background));
                ghn.addSubNode(new BUTTONNode().setText("is").setBackground(background));
                ghn.addSubNode(new BUTTONNode().setText("an").setBackground(background));
                ghn.addSubNode(new BUTTONNode().setText("additional").setBackground(background));
                ghn.addSubNode(new BUTTONNode().setText("header!").setBackground(background));
            }
        }
        @Override
        protected void beforeRenderFooter(FIXGRIDNode grid)
        {
            // add an additional row before the filter header line
            GRIDFOOTERNode gfn = new GRIDFOOTERNode();
            grid.addSubNode(gfn);
            // add components for the inidvidual components
            String background = "#C0FFC0";
            gfn.addSubNode(new PANENode().setBackground(background));
            gfn.addSubNode(new PANENode().setBackground(background));
            gfn.addSubNode(new LABELNode()
                    .setText(DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter.this.pbx("averageHeight"))
                    .setFont("weight:bold")
                    .setFormat("int")
                    .setAlign("right")
                    .setBackground(background));
            gfn.addSubNode(new PANENode().setBackground(background));
            gfn.addSubNode(new PANENode().setBackground(background));
        }
        
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    MyDGV m_dataView = new MyDGV();
    int m_averageHeight = 0;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillData();
        refreshAverageHeight();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccdatagridview2headerfooter.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2HeaderFooter}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public MyDGV getDataView() { return m_dataView; }
    public int getAverageHeight() { return m_averageHeight; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void reactOnItemSelection(TestPerson object)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection of item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName());
    }

    private void fillData()
    {
        List<TestPerson> ps = new ArrayList<TestPerson>();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            TestPerson p = new TestPerson();
            p.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            p.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            p.setHeight(RandomLogic.getHeight());
            p.setMarried(i%2 == 0);
            p.setBirthDate(RandomLogic.getBirthDate());
            ps.add(p);
        }
        m_dataView.prepare(ps,new MyDGVListener());
    }
    
    private void refreshAverageHeight()
    {
        m_averageHeight = 0;
        List<TestPerson> tps = m_dataView.getCurrentlyShownObjects();
        if (tps.size() > 0)
        {
            int totalHeight = 0;
            for (TestPerson tp: tps)
                totalHeight += tp.getHeight();
            m_averageHeight = Math.round((float)totalHeight/(float)tps.size());
        }
    }

}

Discrete values

The column "gender" is an integer data type. By default it is formatted as number and the filter dialog is a from-to-dialog - as you can see in the "height" column.

You can update the default behavior in two ways:

1. Set initialization parameter "withDisplayValueConversion" within the column configurartion to "true". Now the value that is rendered inside the grid is picked through method "calculateDisplayText", which is part of CCDataGridView2.IListener.

2. Use method "createColumnFilter" of CCDataGridView2.IListener and pass a filter component that is better suitable.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2ExplicitValuesFilter}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2ExplicitValuesFilter}" >
<t:row id="g_25" >
<tpbc:datagridview2 id="g_2" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2ExplicitValuesFilter.dataView}" shownullcontent="true" >
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_35" propertyName="firstName" title="First name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_27" propertyName="lastName" title="Last  name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_29" propertyName="height" title="Height" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_31" propertyName="birthDate" title="Date of birth" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_3" propertyName="gender" title="Gender" withDisplayValueConversion="true" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_33" propertyName="married" title="Married" />
</tpbc:datagridview2>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.ConfigurationColumn;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.DGVColumnFilterExplicitValues;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.IDGVColumnFilter;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.PropertyFormatData;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass(expressionBase = "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2ExplicitValuesFilter}")

public class DemoPBCCCDataGridView2ExplicitValuesFilter extends PageBean implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * The bean... This normally is an own class. In the demo it is an inner class
     * so that all code is kept within the demo class.
     */
    public static class TestPerson
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        int i_height;
        LocalDate i_birthDate;
        boolean i_married;
        int i_gender; // 0 male, 1 female, 2 divers
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; } 
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; } 
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; } 
        public LocalDate getBirthDate() { return i_birthDate; } 
        public boolean isMarried() { return i_married; } 
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; } 
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; } 
        public void setHeight(int height) { i_height = height; } 
        public void setBirthDate(LocalDate birthDate) { i_birthDate = birthDate; } 
        public void setMarried(boolean married) { i_married = married; }
        public int getGender() { return i_gender; }
        public void setGender(int gender) { i_gender = gender; }
    }

    /**
     * Listener to the data grid view's listener so that in order to react on events
     * of the grid processing.
     */
    public class MyDGVListener extends CCDataGridView2.DefaultListener<TestPerson>
    {
        @Override
        public void reactOnGridSelect(TestPerson object)
        {
            reactOnItemSelection(object);
        }
        @Override
        public String calculateDisplayText(TestPerson object, String propertyName, Object propertyValue)
        {
            // of course: the coding of "calculateDisplayText" should be better linked
            // to the coding of "createColumnFilter"...! But we wanted to make it
            // as simple as possible.
            if ("gender".equals(propertyName) && propertyValue != null)
            {
                if (propertyValue.equals(0)) return "male";
                if (propertyValue.equals(1)) return "female";
                if (propertyValue.equals(2)) return "diverse";
            }
            return super.calculateDisplayText(object, propertyName, propertyValue);
        }
        @Override
        public IDGVColumnFilter createColumnFilter(ConfigurationColumn cc, PropertyFormatData format)
        {
            if ("gender".equals(cc.getPropertyName()))
            {
                // of course: the coding of "calculateDisplayText" should be better linked
                // to the coding of "createColumnFilter"...! But we wanted to make it
                // as simple as possible.
                DGVColumnFilterExplicitValues filter = new DGVColumnFilterExplicitValues();
                filter.addValue("0","male");
                filter.addValue("1","female");
                filter.addValue("2","diverse");
                return filter;
            }
            return super.createColumnFilter(cc, format);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCDataGridView2<TestPerson> m_dataView = new CCDataGridView2<TestPerson>(TestPerson.class);
    List<TestPerson> m_persons = new ArrayList<TestPerson>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCDataGridView2ExplicitValuesFilter(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        fillData();
    }

    public String getPageName()
    {
        return "/workplace/demopbcccdatagridview2explicitvaluesfilter.xml";
    }

    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage()
    {
        return "#{d.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2ExplicitValuesFilter}";
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCDataGridView2<TestPerson> getDataView()
    {
        return m_dataView;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void deleteItem(final TestPerson object)
    {
        YESNOPopup.createInstance("Deletion of item","Do you really want to remove the selected item?",new IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes() { deleteItemExecute(object); }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo() {}
        });
    }

    private void deleteItemExecute(TestPerson object)
    {
        m_persons.remove(object);
        m_dataView.refreshData(m_persons);
    }

    private void reactOnItemSelection(TestPerson object)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection of item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName());
    }

    private void fillData()
    {
        m_persons.clear();
        ;
        for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
        {
            TestPerson p = new TestPerson();
            p.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            p.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            p.setHeight(RandomLogic.getHeight());
            p.setMarried(i % 2 == 0);
            p.setBirthDate(RandomLogic.getBirthDate());
            p.setGender(i%3);
            m_persons.add(p);
        }
        m_dataView.prepare(m_persons, new MyDGVListener());
    }

}

One cell rendering of properties

The component DATAGRIDVIEW2ONECELL renders a list of beans into a grid.

The rendering is done using one grid cell into which the properties of the item's bean are arranged.

In the definition of the column component you typically use the following attributes:

(.) PROPERTYNAME - this is the property name of the bean
(.) TITLE - this is the text for the property - it is shown as tool tip
(.) ONECELLNEWLINE - by default a new line is opened within the cell for each new property - by defining "false" the property is arranged in the same column as the previous property
(.) LABELSTYLEVARIANT - the style that is used for rendering the text in the cell. Typical values are "ccbig" or "ccsmall". If no defintion is done then the default style is used.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDataGridView2OneCell1}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDataGridView2OneCell1}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<tpbc:datagridview2onecell id="g_8" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoDataGridView2OneCell1.dataView}" shownullcontent="true" withCrossColumnFilter="true" withItemLeftImage="true" >
<tpbc:datagridview2onecellcolumn id="g_30" labelStyleVariant="ccemphasized" propertyName="lastName" title="Last name" width="100%" />
<tpbc:datagridview2onecellcolumn id="g_29" labelStyleVariant="ccemphasized" oneCellNewLine="false" propertyName="firstName" title="First name" width="100%" />
<tpbc:datagridview2onecellcolumn id="g_32" propertyName="height" title="Height" />
<tpbc:datagridview2onecellcolumn id="g_34" oneCellNewLine="false" propertyName="married" title="Married" />
<tpbc:datagridview2onecellcolumn id="g_36" align="right" oneCellNewLine="false" propertyName="gender" title="Gender" width="100%" />
</tpbc:datagridview2onecell>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.Comparator;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2OneCell;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.DemoPBCCCDataGridView2Simple.ENUMGender;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDataGridView2OneCell1}")

public class DemoDataGridView2OneCell1
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /** 
     * The bean... This normally is an own class. In the demo it
     * is an inner class so that all code is kept within the
     * demo class.
     */
    public static class TestPerson
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        int i_height;
        LocalDate i_birthDate;
        boolean i_married;
        ENUMGender i_gender;
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; }
        public LocalDate getBirthDate() { return i_birthDate; }
        public boolean isMarried() { return i_married; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { i_firstName = firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { i_lastName = lastName; }
        public void setHeight(int height) { i_height = height; }
        public void setBirthDate(LocalDate birthDate) { i_birthDate = birthDate; }
        public void setMarried(boolean married) { i_married = married; }
        public ENUMGender getGender() { return i_gender; }
        public void setGender(ENUMGender gender) { i_gender = gender; } 
    }

    /**
     * Listener to the data grid view's listener so that in order to 
     * react on events of the grid processing.
     */
    public class MyDGVListener extends CCDataGridView2OneCell.DefaultOneCellListener<TestPerson>
    {
        @Override
        public void reactOnGridSelect(TestPerson object)
        {
            reactOnItemSelection(object);
        }
        @Override
        public String findAvatarIconText(TestPerson itemObject)
        {
            return itemObject.getLastName().substring(0,1) + itemObject.getFirstName().substring(0,1);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCDataGridView2OneCell<TestPerson> m_dataView = new CCDataGridView2OneCell<TestPerson>(TestPerson.class);

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDataGridView2OneCell1(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillData();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/DemoDataGridView2OneCell1.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDataGridView2OneCell1}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCDataGridView2OneCell<TestPerson> getDataView() { return m_dataView; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void reactOnItemSelection(TestPerson object)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection of item: " + object.getLastName() + ", " + object.getFirstName());
    }

    private void fillData()
    {
        List<TestPerson> ps = new ArrayList<TestPerson>();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            TestPerson p = new TestPerson();
            p.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            p.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            p.setHeight(RandomLogic.getHeight());
            p.setMarried(i%2 == 0);
            p.setBirthDate(RandomLogic.getBirthDate());
            p.setGender(ENUMGender.FEMALE);
            if (i%2 == 0) p.setGender(ENUMGender.MALE);
            if (i%9 == 4) p.setGender(ENUMGender.DIVERSE);
            ps.add(p);
        }
        Collections.sort(ps,new Comparator<TestPerson>()
        {
            @Override
            public int compare(TestPerson o1, TestPerson o2)
            {
                String s1 = o1.getLastName() + ", " + o1.getFirstName();
                String s2 = o2.getLastName() + ", " + o2.getFirstName();
                return s1.compareTo(s2);
            }
        });
        m_dataView.prepare(ps,new MyDGVListener());
    }

}

Usage variant management

Usage variants with "Grids and Trees"

By adding a simple component (USAGEVARIANTBUTTON) from the addon-package, you add a "configuration variant management" to the FIXGRID processing.

The variant management stores all grid configuration data (column sequence, width, sorting) for a user, so that the user can pick up the configuration later on.

The user can define multiple variants, each variant keeping one configuration. One variant can be selected as default variant which is executed when starting the grid.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_32" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:textpane id="g_6" text="Change the column sequence, change the column widths, remove some columns, sort by one or more levels - and then store the current grid configuration as variant with a dedicated name." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:pane id="g_36" background="#FFFFB0" border="#800000" padding="10" >
<t:row id="g_37" >
<tpbc:usagevariantbutton id="g_34" buttonStyleVariant="ccaslink" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant.usageVariantButton}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:link id="g_30" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant.grid.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Search &amp; Export..." />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Grid columns..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_42" avoidroundtrips="true" clientname="personGrid" height="100%;100" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant.grid}" selectorcolumn="1" width="100%" cellselection="true" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" searchenabled="true" sortreference=".{firstName}" text="First Name" tooltip="This is the first name." width="50%;100" >
<t:field id="g_11" clientname="firstName" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" searchenabled="true" sortreference=".{lastName}" text="Last Name" width="50%;100" >
<t:label id="g_15" clientname="lastName" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Birthday" width="100" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_17" clientname="birthday" format="date" value=".{birthday}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" sortreference=".{married}" text="Mar." tooltip="Married" width="30" >
<t:checkbox id="g_19" align="center" clientname="married" selected=".{married}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_20" tooltip="Remove columns" width="65" >
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener=".{onRemove}" clientname="remove" contentareafilled="false" text="Remove" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_22" tooltip="Grid item detail" width="25" >
<t:icon id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant.grid.rowDataUI.onOpenRowDataPopup}" clientname="details" image="/images/icons/application_form_magnify.png" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant.onAddRow}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Add row" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_26" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant.onClear}" text="Remove all rows" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.usagevariants.CCUsageVariantButton;
import org.eclnt.ccee.usagevariants.UsageVariantManager;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.FIXGRIDExtractApply;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariant}")

public class DemoPBCCCUsageVariant
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String i_firstName;
        String i_lastName;
        boolean i_married;
        Date i_birthday;
        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
        public void setFirstName(String value) { i_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { i_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setMarried(boolean value) { i_married = value; }
        public boolean getMarried() { return i_married; }
        public Date getBirthday() { return i_birthday; }
        public void setBirthday(Date birthday) { i_birthday = birthday; }
        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
        public void onRemove(ActionEvent ae)
        {
            YESNOPopup.createInstance
            (
                "Removing item",
                "Do you really want to remove the selected item?",
                new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
                {
                    public void reactOnYes()
                    {
                        removeExecute();
                    }
                    public void reactOnNo()
                    {
                    }
                }
            );
        }
        private void removeExecute()
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
        }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Item was executed: " + getLastName() + "/" + m_grid.getColumnIndexOfLastSelection() + "/" + m_grid.getShiftPressedOfLastSelection() + "/" + m_grid.getCtrlPressedOfLastSelection());
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    boolean m_oddeven = false;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    CCUsageVariantButton m_usageVariantButton = new CCUsageVariantButton();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPBCCCUsageVariant(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        fillGrid();
        // Usage variant
        // 1. create instance of UsageVariantManager, pass:
        //    a. type of configured issue (any String, your definition)
        //    b. concrete id of configured issue (any String, your definition)
        //    c. implementation of IExtractApply
        // 2. activate - pass "true" as parameter, if the default variant should be immediately applied
        // 3. pass information to CCUsageVariantButton instance that is referenced from the page
        UsageVariantManager uvm = new UsageVariantManager("FIXGRID","DemoPBCCCUsagetVariant",new FIXGRIDExtractApply(m_grid));
        uvm.activate(true);
        m_usageVariantButton.prepare(uvm,null);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void setOddeven(boolean value) { m_oddeven = value; }
    public boolean getOddeven() { return m_oddeven; }
    
    public void onAddRow(ActionEvent ae)    
    {
        // add the item
        GridItem item = new GridItem();
        item.setFirstName("new");
        item.setLastName("new");
        m_grid.getItems().add(item);
        // select the item and focus the item
        m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
        m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(item);
    }
    
    public void onClear(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
    }

    public CCUsageVariantButton getUsageVariantButton() { return m_usageVariantButton; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void fillGrid()
    {
        GridItem row;
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Michael");
        row.setLastName("Schumacher");
        row.setMarried(true);
        row.setBirthday(new Date());
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Alain");
        row.setLastName("Prost");
        row.setMarried(true);
        row.setBirthday(new Date());
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Niki");
        row.setLastName("Lauda");
        row.setMarried(true);
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
        row = new GridItem();
        row.setFirstName("Nik");
        row.setLastName("Heidfeld");
        row.setMarried(false);
        m_grid.getItems().add(row);
    }

}

Usage variants with "Bean data grid"

The page bean component CCDataGridView2 also provides an implementation of the interface "IExtractApply" - that is the base for the usage variant management.

The data that is stored per usage variant is:

1. all the runtime configuration data of the grid itself (column sequence, widths, sorting)
2. all the filter definitions

By placing component USAGEVARIANTBUTTON into the layout and binding it to the CCDataGridView2 instance, the variant management is activated.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_16" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100%" />
<tpbc:usagevariantbutton id="g_5" buttonStyleVariant="ccaslink" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2.usageVariant}" />
<t:link id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2.dataGrid.grid.onEditColumnDetails}" text="Columns" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<tpbc:datagridview2 id="g_2" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2.dataGrid}" shownullcontent="true" withCrossColumnFilter="true" >
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_3" propertyName="firstName" title="First name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_8" propertyName="lastName" title="Last name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_10" propertyName="title" title="Title" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_11" propertyName="weight" title="Weight" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_13" propertyName="height" title="Height" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_14" propertyName="birthDay" title="Birthday" />
</tpbc:datagridview2>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.usagevariants.CCUsageVariantButton;
import org.eclnt.ccee.usagevariants.UsageVariantManager;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2}")

public class DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCDataGridView2 m_dataGrid = new CCDataGridView2<Person>(Person.class);
    CCUsageVariantButton m_usageVariant = new CCUsageVariantButton();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        fillGrid();
        UsageVariantManager uvm = new UsageVariantManager("CCDATAGRIDVIEW2","DEMOPBCCCUSAGEVARIANTDGV2",m_dataGrid.getExtractApplyServiceBridge());
        m_usageVariant.prepare(uvm,null);
        uvm.activate(true);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccusagevariantdgv2.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCUsageVariantDgv2}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public CCDataGridView2 getDataGrid() { return m_dataGrid; }
    public CCUsageVariantButton getUsageVariant() { return m_usageVariant; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGrid()
    {
        List<Person> ps = new ArrayList<Person>();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            ps.add(RandomLogic.createPerson());
        m_dataGrid.prepare(ps,null);
    }

}
